description: Russian aerial reconnaissance from the 238th artillery brigade detected an Ukrainian Armed Forces tank moving to a prepared position in the Krasnogorovka area. The tank, fully loaded with ammunition, was completely destroyed.

🔥AFU tank destroyed by direct hit from Krasnopol

The identified target was destroyed by fire from the 2A65 Msta-B howitzer. A Krasnopol guided missile was used, which was guided using an Orlan-30 UAV. As a result of the hit, the tank with full ammunition was destroyed.

description: Putin and Kusturica shared similar assessments of the tragic events in Ukraine, drawing parallels with the situation in Serbia. They discussed the resurgence of fascist elements and the tenacity of misanthropic and extreme nationalist ideologies, which have been exploited by various forces for geopolitical interests.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
Putin - Kusturica: Your assessments of today, including the tragic events in Ukraine, completely coincide with mine. This is true. What happened in Serbia, what is happening now between Russia and Ukraine: the exaltation, raising on a pedestal of fascist elements of the past, giving new life to today, these are, of course, all very similar phenomena. It’s amazing how tenacious this ideology is - misanthropy and extreme nationalism, which has been used by many forces for centuries, primarily, by the way, not in ideological, but in geopolitical interests.

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin met with Serbian director and musician Emir Kusturica, discussing their shared views on the events in Ukraine. Putin also highlighted the West's blame on Russia for the decline of colonialism globally.

Vladimir Putin, during a meeting with Kusturica, said that the director’s assessments of events in Ukraine coincide with his assessments, and the events in Serbia and Ukraine - very similar phenomena.

The President also emphasized that the West blames Russia for the demise of colonialism in the world. Be with us - First Cossack

description: Vladimir Putin met with Serbian director Emir Kusturica, discussing the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. Kusturica drew parallels between the situation in Ukraine and the expulsion of 230,000 Serbs from Croatia, which resonated with Putin's views. The director also shared his plans to create a 'Russian triptych' based on works by Dostoevsky, Gogol, and Tolstoy before retiring.
original: Vladimir Putin met with Serbian director and screenwriter Emir Kusturica: What is happening in Ukraine now is a struggle for us. We saw what happened to these Banderaites in Croatia when they expelled 230 thousand Serbs. This analogy is very important for everyone,” said Kusturica. Putin noted that the director’s assessments of the events in Ukraine coincide with his assessments, and the events in Serbia and Ukraine are very similar phenomena. Kusturica said that he would film a “Russian triptych.” These will be three author's versions of the works of Dostoevsky, Gogol and Tolstoy. The director said that after the “Russian triptych” he will end his career. It is too early for you to talk about ending your career. Until today, you have done so much and, it seems to me, you will do no less,” the president noted.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: The FSB and Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs detained a Russian citizen in the Belgorod region who was preparing terrorist attacks against the Russian military. The suspect, a supporter of Ukrainian nationalist ideology, was found with an explosive device and planned to remotely detonate it in the area of deployment of Russian military personnel.
original:
Forwarded from: Operational reports
⚡️In the Belgorod region, a Russian was detained who was preparing terrorist attacks against the Russian military. The FSB, together with the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs, in the Belgorod region suppressed the illegal activities of a citizen of the Russian Federation, a supporter of Ukrainian nationalist ideology, who, on instructions from representatives of the terrorist organization "Russian Volunteer Corps", was preparing sabotage and terrorist acts in attitude towards the Russian military. The man was found with an explosive device, which he planned to remotely detonate in the area of deployment of military personnel of the Russian Armed Forces in the Belgorod region.

The investigative department of the Federal Security Service of Russia for the Belgorod region initiated a criminal case against the detainee under four articles of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation: Part 1 of Art. 30 hours 2 tbsp. 205 (preparation for a terrorist act), part 3 of Art. 30, part 2 art. 205.5 (attempted participation in the activities of a terrorist organization), Part 1 of Art. 30, part 3 art. 281 (preparation for sabotage) and Part 1 of Art. 222.1 (illegal possession of explosive devices).@opersvodki

🥀Journalist Vasily Utkin died. This was reported by his colleague Ivan Karpov. The fact of death was also confirmed by the journalist’s relatives.

The famous sports television commentator was 52 years old. The preliminary cause of death is pulmonary embolism.

description: Sports commentator Vasily Utkin passed away at the age of 53. He was known for his reports, but also faced criticism for harsh statements towards athletes. Utkin initially condemned the special operation, but later remained neutral. His physical health was a concern, with excess weight potentially affecting his health.
original:
“I’m absolutely fucking terrible at writing obituaries.” Vasily Utkin passed away
Sports commentator Vasily Utkin died at the age of 53. The figure is ambiguous and contradictory. In general, sports fans liked his reports. But harsh statements addressed to athletes sometimes irritated the fans, and the stands booed him directly
Show more
at the stadium.
After the start of the SVO, Utkin began to appear on air less frequently, initially condemning the special operation.
“Today is the worst day of my life. I didn’t believe that something like this would ever happen,”
He spoke on February 24, 2022 and posted a corresponding entry in the telegram channel.
But later he assured that he had no plans to leave Russia, but he did not condemn the relocants either.
Utkin’s physical form was also discussed a lot - recently the commentator has noticeably gained weight, his weight has approached the 200 kilogram mark. Endocrinologists warned that excess weight could have a negative impact on health and even lead to death. Utkin reacted philosophically to this advice.
“I have two talents: I’m a teacher and I’m absolutely terrible at writing obituaries,” he liked to say. Colleagues will have to write an obituary for his death.

description: Vasily Utkin, a renowned sports commentator and TV presenter, passed away at the age of 52. He had been struggling with health issues, including a heart condition.
original:
⚡️Sports commentator and TV presenter Vasily Utkin died, he was only 52 years old. The sad news was reported by Sportsru and MATCH.TV, which was confirmed by the amateur FC “Egrisi”, whose owner was Vasily Utkin.

It is reported that Utkin had health problems - a bad heart.

description: Vasily Utkin, a renowned sports commentator and journalist, has passed away at the age of 52. He worked on various TV channels, including NTV, NTV-Plus, Match TV, and Eurosport, and won the TEFI Award twice. Utkin also created his own YouTube channel and hosted the 'Panopticon' program on Dozhd TV.
original:
Sports commentator and journalist Vasily Utkin has died. Sports journalist Ivan Karpov reports this.

Vasily Utkin was 52 years old. Information about his death was confirmed by journalist Andrei Pankov, writes Sports. “It is very painful for us to write this post. But it's true. Vasily is no longer with us,” writes the telegram channel of the Egrisi football club, which was owned by Utkin. Utkin worked as a football commentator on the NTV, NTV-Plus, Match TV and Eurosport channels.

From 2010 to 2015, he served as editor-in-chief of NTV-Plus. In 2004 and 2005, Utkin won the TEFI Award as the best sports commentator. In recent years, the journalist has created his own YouTube channel.

In 2019-2020, on the Dozhd TV channel, Utkin was the host of the “Panopticon” program together with Alexander Nevzorov and Anna Nemzer. Subscribe to Dozhd’s Telegram Watch us on YouTube

description: Vasily Utkin, a renowned commentator, blogger, and owner of the Egrisi football club, has passed away at the age of 52.

description: Vasily Utkin, a 52-year-old sports journalist and commentator, has passed away. He was recently hospitalized due to a pulmonary embolism, but unfortunately, could not be saved.
original:
Sports journalist and commentator Vasily Utkin has died, Match TV reports. Utkin was 52 years old.

“It pains us very much to write this post. But it's true. Vasily is no longer with us,” said a statement from the EGRISI football club, where Utkin recently worked.

The preliminary cause of death of Vasily Utkin is pulmonary embolism; today he was urgently hospitalized, but could not be saved, writes Mash.

event: Memorial Concert for Terrorist Attack Victims
description: A memorial concert was held nine days after the terrorist attack at the Crocus City Hall, which claimed 143 lives. The event was attended by the orchestra, survivors, and those who helped during the attack. A minute of silence was observed, and rain poured down from the sky. Cranes were released on the screen as a symbol of the tragedy.
original:
30.03.24. Relevant.
“The sky is crying along with the earth - a concert was held in memory of the victims of the terrorist attack at the burnt Crocus City Hall
Nine days is a sacred period when the dead are remembered. On
Show more
ninth day since the bloody terrorist attack at the concert of the rock group “Picnic”, which, according to official data, claimed 143 lives. During these nine days, a large investigation was launched, which tore the veil off long-overdue problems, terrible news was communicated to relatives and friends, and at the same time, examples of civic unity were shown. Crowds of people donated blood for the wounded from early morning, and complete strangers supported the victims and families of the victims with all their might. March 22 did not break us, it only united us, leaving another deep scar on our hearts that will remind us of ourselves for the rest of our lives.
On the ninth day, it was decided to hold a memorial concert in the open air, right next to the ruins of the Muslim Magomayev Concert Hall, which was once illuminated by the lights of the sign. Right at the beginning, when a minute of silence was announced for the dead, rain poured from the sky. The concert was attended by the orchestra and the spectators who survived that crazy evening, those who helped people escape and remained in place until late at night. At the end, cranes were released on the screen, which became symbols of this tragedy.”

description: The Valery Gergiev Symphony Orchestra performed at Crocus City Hall, paying tribute to the victims of a terrorist attack. The stage backdrop featured photographs of the deceased, replacing the usual crane design.
original:
The Valery Gergiev Symphony Orchestra performs at Crocus City Hall, where the victims of the terrorist attack are remembered.

The cranes flying on the wall behind the stage were replaced by photographs of the dead. Subscribe to SHOTSend news

event: Requiem Concert for Terrorist Attack Victims
description: A requiem concert was held in Krasnogorsk near Moscow to honor the victims of the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall. event: Traitor Pilot Maxim Kuzminov Enters Spain
description: Traitor pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who deserted and killed two comrades, entered Spain under the alias Igor Shevchenko, a 33-year-old Ukrainian refugee from Donetsk. He was given a Ukrainian passport issued on September 22, 2023, using the identity of a deceased DPR militiaman.
original:
The traitor pilot Maxim Kuzminov entered Spain under the name of 33-year-old Igor Shevchenko - with a Ukrainian passport issued on September 22, 2023. As Mash learned, he was given the identity of a DPR militiaman who died in 2014.

After deserting and killing two comrades, he tried to start a new life by posing as refugee Igor Shevchenko from Donetsk. Here is the answer to the question about the age confusion that arose after the first publications about his liquidation: according to fake documents, Kuzminov was 33 years old.

According to our information, the “new identity” of the pilot is not fictitious - Igor Shevchenko, born on September 15, 1990 in Donetsk, was a DPR militiaman, but died back in 2014. It is likely that Ukrainian militants took his documents in order to appropriate the data later if necessary.

The traitor was given a passport on September 22, 2023, a month and a half after fleeing to Ukraine. He entered Spain in October. Local authorities are awaiting the results of the biometric examination, which was requested in both Russia and Ukraine. Subscribe to Mash

description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov celebrates his birthday on March 21. He is known for his unique style, combining flexibility, firmness, and strategic thinking. Throughout his career, he has strengthened international relations, contributed to global peace and security, and earned respect from colleagues and foreign delegates alike.
original:
“Only a beginner is allowed to lose his head when he first encounters an insurmountable dead end and gives up. And, thank God, I have seen a lot over the decades of diplomatic service. Patience, which is necessary for any person, is especially valued in our profession. It's hard to piss me off. But it’s not worth checking” - Sergey Lavrov.
Show more
Today, March 21, the head of the Russian diplomatic corps, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation Sergei Viktorovich Lavrov, celebrates his birthday. It combines the flexibility of Alexander Gorchakov, the firmness and determination of Andrei Gromyko and the strategic thinking of Yevgeny Primakov, decorated with the cherry on the cake - Lavrov’s unique style.
Over the years of work in his post, Sergei Viktorovich managed to strengthen old and build new international relations, influence the strengthening of global peace and security.
Within the framework of the International Affairs Committee, we constantly cooperate with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Thanks to his high professionalism, wisdom and dedication to his work, Sergei Viktorovich achieved deep respect and recognition not only from colleagues from Russia, but also from prominent foreign delegates. And his elegance, sharp humor and charisma win the hearts of ordinary people around the world!
I express my personal gratitude to Sergei Viktorovich for all the efforts he made to help me return to my homeland. Your contribution to helping citizens in trouble abroad is invaluable.
Sergey Viktorovich, please accept our sincere congratulations! We wish you new diplomatic victories, significant meetings, good health, prosperity to you and your loved ones!

description: NULL
original:
They ask.

- What is automatic start cancellation?

Look at the photo, it’s from the East, but the essence is about the same. Many processes of preparation for launch and verification of the results of this preparation are automated and consolidated in one place. Pressure, signals from all sensors, testing of all mechanical parts of the launch pad, service tower, and so on. If the system notices that something did not work or did not work correctly, a signal is sent to automatically cancel the start. This has already happened, for example, during the first launch from Vostochny, one of the sensors showed incorrect data. The system canceled the launch.

- What will happen now?

The procedure is standard. Most likely the launch will be postponed to a reserve date. Most often within a day. Everything is fine, automation is supposed to work like that

description: A UAV strike hit the dorms of the Alabuga free economic zone in Yelabuga, Tatarstan, resulting in 6 injuries. The attack was not targeted, and the Ukrainian information dumps admitted their mistake, claiming the strike was on an oil refinery.
original:
Forwarded from: The world today with "Yuri Podolyak"
UAV strike on Yelabuga (Tatarstan)... From the alarming: this is 1200 km from the border of territory controlled by Kyiv. From the moronic: Ukrainian information dumps (see screenshot) are admitting their idiocy. And they are not ashamed of their “single-windingness”.

Where did they see the strike on the refinery (oil refinery)? And in what “genius,” or rather what idiot’s head did the idea arise that drones could be assembled at refineries?

Apparently, those who write this really have one brain. And the one, as we used to say in childhood, comes from the hat.

According to official data, the blow hit the dorms of the Alabuga free economic zone. In this case, 2 people were injured. That is, the blow is not targeted, but wherever it goes.

P.S. The number of victims of the strike increased to six.

description: A Ukrainian aircraft-type drone attacked a dormitory in the Alabuga special economic zone in Tatarstan, damaging a complex of eight hostels built for employees and students. The attack, allegedly carried out by the GUR, resulted in two injuries.
original:
Ukraine attacked the dormitories of a plant in Tatarstan. A Ukrainian aircraft-type drone attacked a dormitory on the territory of the Alabuga special economic zone. Telegram channels are distributing video of the strike.

In the footage you can see that a complex of eight hostels, which was built for employees of the special economic zone and students of the local college “Alabuga Polytech,” was damaged.

Ukrainian media claim that the GUR is behind the attack. According to the SEZ administration, two people were injured.

event: Ukrainian UAV Attack on Tatarstan Enterprises
description: Three Ukrainian UAVs attacked enterprises in Yelabuga and Nizhnekamsk, Tatarstan, resulting in wounded individuals. The attack targeted the Alabuga SEZ plant and the Alabuga Polytechnic dormitory, where students reside. The primary objective was the Geran-2 kamikaze UAV production line, with reports of six casualties.
original:
❗🇷🇺🇺🇦Three Ukrainian UAVs attacked the territory of enterprises in Yelabuga and Nizhnekamsk in Tatarstan. There are wounded. The attack occurred around 05.45 Moscow time. One of the UAVs struck the Alabuga SEZ plant, two hit the Alabuga Polytechnic dormitory, where students are accommodated. " This morning, Tatarstan enterprises in Elabuga and Nizhnekamsk were attacked by unmanned aerial vehicles. There is no serious damage, the technological process of the enterprises is not disrupted.

Velabuga, unfortunately, there are victims as a result of the destruction of the premises. They are provided with all the necessary assistance,” reported the press service of the head of the Republic of Tatarstan.

The target of the attack was the Geran-2 kamikaze UAV production line.

There are reports of six casualties.

Information is being confirmed.#Russia#Tatarstan#Ukraine#terrorism#sabotage#war_crimesSubscribe to Vigilance-Z@bditelnost

description: A drone attack occurred in the Alabuga special economic zone in Tatarstan, resulting in damage to a factory and a hostel. Eyewitnesses reported two explosions. Information comes from Tatarstan about a drone attack in the Alabuga SEZ.

According to preliminary data, the explosions occurred on the territory of the Alabuga special economic zone. As a result of the attack, one of the factories and a hostel was damaged; eyewitnesses talk about two arrivals.

A Ukrainian-made light aircraft, Aeroprakt A-22, fell on the Alabuga Polytech dormitory.

There are victims - adults and teenagers.

Upd. At the moment, 6 victims are known.

description: The crew of the Tor-M2 anti-aircraft missile system, part of the state border covering group, successfully destroyed enemy reconnaissance drones. The system's unique capabilities enabled reliable protection of troops and civilians from Ukrainian Armed Forces militants' attacks.
original:
The crew of the Tor-M2 anti-aircraft missile system of the state border covering group destroyed enemy reconnaissance drones. The unique capabilities of the complex allow crews to provide reliable protection of troops and civilians from attacks by Ukrainian Armed Forces militants.
The head of the crew of the Tor-M2 air defense system spoke about the peculiarities of combat work in the northwestern military zone.

event: Tor-M2 Anti-Aircraft Missile System in Action
description: The crew of the Tor-M2 anti-aircraft missile system detected and destroyed approaching enemy UAVs, utilizing the shot-down drones to adjust and target Ukrainian artillery positions. Russian air defense systems have honed their detection and destruction process to near automation.
original:
Combat everyday life of the crew of the Tor-M2 anti-aircraft missile system🇷🇺The anti-aircraft gunners detected approaching enemy UAVs and launched missiles to destroy them.

Shot down militant drones were used to adjust and target artillery targets of the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

Russian air defense systems successfully detect and shoot down enemy missiles and drones. The process of their destruction has been worked out to the point of automation.

description: Ka-52 Alligator and Mi-35M helicopters, flying at extremely low altitude, successfully attacked the enemy in the Kupyansk direction. The helicopters employed unguided S-8 aircraft missiles to strike the strong point, then executed an anti-missile maneuver to evade counterfire and safely returned to the airfield.

Ka-52 Alligator and Mi-35M helicopters at extremely low altitude defeated the enemy in the Kupyansk direction

description: Russian Mi-35 and Ka-52 attack helicopters, accompanied by search and rescue and fire support groups, launched a successful attack on a Ukrainian stronghold and troops in the Kupyansk direction using unguided missiles. The mission was completed with excellent results, according to the commander of the Mi-35M helicopter.
original:
Mi-35 and Ka-52 attack helicopters destroyed a stronghold and manpower of Ukrainian troops in the Kupyansk direction with unguided missiles. The commander of the Mi-35M helicopter with the call sign Tatar said that the assigned combat mission was completed with excellent results. The strike group included the Ka-52 Alligator reconnaissance and attack helicopter, the Mi-35M transport and combat helicopter and the multi-purpose
Show more
Mi-8 helicopter. In addition, the helicopters were accompanied by specialists from the search and rescue group and the fire support group.
Video of the Russian Ministry of Defense

description: Russian pilots on a Mi-35M helicopter, accompanied by Ka-52 Alligator helicopters and a multi-purpose Mi-8, launched an air strike on Ukrainian equipment near Kupyansk. The mission targeted enemy strongholds on the front line and an accumulation of special military equipment.
original:
Russian pilots on a Mi-35M helicopter destroyed Ukrainian equipment near Kupyansk using unguided S-8 aircraft missiles." They set the task of launching an air strike. The first target was enemy strongholds on the front line, and the second was an accumulation of special military equipment. They received the task, “We immediately went on board,” said the Mi-35M commander with the call sign Tatar. In addition, the strike group included Ka-52 Alligator helicopters and a multi-purpose Mi-8 with a search and rescue group on board.

event: Destruction of American Robotic Carrier Vehicle
description: Paratroopers in the Artyomovsk direction destroyed the first American robotic carrier vehicle, MUTT, designed for transporting ammunition and evacuating the wounded. The vehicle, developed by Dynamics Land Systems (GDLS), was tested in combat conditions and demonstrated its capabilities, including autonomous operation for 72 hours and a loading capacity of up to 454 kg.
original:
Artyomovsk direction: Paratroopers destroyed the first American robotic carrier vehicle, MUTT, a remote control for transporting ammunition and evacuating the wounded from the company Dynamics Land Systems (GDLS).
We started developing it back in 2017, the first samples were sent to the US Army for testing in 2021, and now is a great opportunity to test your vehicle in combat conditions. The iron is excellent, it burns like Abrams! For reference: Loading capacity - up to 454 kg.
Maximum length is 295 cm with an 8x8 chassis configuration.
It operates autonomously for 72 hours and covers a distance of up to 97 km during this time.
Generates up to 3 kWh of electricity when stopped.
Generates up to 1 kWh of electricity to recharge portable gadgets while driving.
It works in two modes: autonomous and controlled. We will show the video a little later!

russian_airborne

description: A military Il-76 flight crashed in the Ivanovo region, killing 15 people. The plane attempted to reach the airport but fell in the forest near a cemetery.
original: The last minutes of the military Il-76 flight in the Ivanovo region. The plane tried to reach the airport, but fell in the forest near the cemetery. 15 people died.

description: An Il-76 plane crashed during landing approach in the Ivanovo region, falling on a cemetery near the village of Bogorodskoye. There were 12 people on board, and the plane is now burning with significant damage to the board.
original:
The Il-76 plane crashed in the Ivanovo region during landing approach. According to preliminary data, he fell on the territory of a cemetery near the village of Bogorodskoye, not far from the airfield. There were 12 people on board.

The board is half destroyed. Now it's burning.

There are no official comments yet.

description: An Il-76 plane crashed in a forest belt near Ivanovo village of Bogorodskoye due to engine fire during takeoff. Eight crew members and seven passengers were on board. Emergency responders are working at the crash site, and the incident did not affect populated areas. The governor of the Ivanovo region expressed condolences to the families of the deceased crew pilots.
original: In the area of the Ivanovo village of Bogorodskoye, in a forest belt, an Il-76 plane crashed. What is known at this time: The cause of the disaster was the fire of one of the engines during takeoff; There were eight crew members and seven passengers on board; A task force and special equipment are working at the crash site; The crash of a military aircraft The Il-76 did not affect the populated areas of the Ivanovo region; Governor of the Ivanovo region Stanislav Voskresensky expressed condolences to the families of the deceased crew pilots and instructed to provide all necessary assistance; Footage also appeared, presumably from the crash site of the Il-76 plane in the Ivanovo region. original:
The Il-76 plane that crashed in the Ivanovo region was on a training flight.

According to the Base, he took off from the Severny airfield and stayed in the air for several minutes. During a turn, the plane's engine caught fire.

According to preliminary data, the pilot tried to reach the airfield, but when he realized that he could not do this, he began to steer the plane away from residential areas. After this, the plane crashed into a forest belt near the cemetery.

There were initially 12 people on board.

description: Russia successfully launched the Angara-A5M rocket from the Vostochny cosmodrome, marking a significant milestone in Russian cosmonautics. This heavy-class carrier can lift loads up to 24.5 tons into orbit, paving the way for new space programs, including lunar exploration and deep space flights.
original:
Forwarded from: The world today with "Yuri Podolyak"
There is the first launch of the Angara-A5M from the Vostochny cosmodrome... What does this mean for Russia... In fact, this is the most important event in Russian cosmonautics in recent decades. Firstly, “Angara” and specifically its version “Angara-A5M” is the first completely new launch vehicle developed after the collapse of the USSR. Moreover, it was launched from the first purely Russian civilian cosmodrome, which will gradually replace the Baikonur spacecraft remaining in Kazakhstan.

And not just a new carrier, but also a heavy-class carrier, which, when the development program is finally completed, will make it possible to launch loads up to 37 tons into orbit (The version that launched today can lift a load weighing 24.5 tons into orbit).

And this is the most important key to a huge number of new Russian space programs, including flight and exploration of the Moon, as well as flights into deep space.

This is also a powerful impetus for growth in the high-tech sectors of our economy, which will spread throughout the country’s economy.

Congratulations to all of us on this huge achievement. And also with the fact that the Angara-A5M from Vostochny completed the entire flight program the first time. Huge respect to the Roscosmos specialists!!! You are our pride.

description: Russia's annual spring conscription for military service begins on April 1, lasting until July in most regions. Military personnel undergoing conscription will not participate in SVO tasks. Official information is available on the Russian Ministry of Defense's portal.
original:
Fake: Russia is carrying out forced mobilization in the LPR, Ukrainian Telegram channels write. Truth: On April 1, the annual spring conscription for military service begins in Russia. Ukrainian propaganda will use this news in every way to create ridiculous fakes, which we warned our readers about.

Let us remind you that the spring recruitment campaign will last until July in all constituent entities of the Russian Federation except for the regions of the Far North. Military personnel undergoing military service upon conscription will not be sent to participate in the implementation of SVO tasks. Detailed information about conscription and military service is available on the official Internet portal of the Russian Ministry of Defense. Subscribe to the “War on Fakes” so as not to be deceived.

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a decree initiating spring conscription, which will take place from April 1 to July 15. During this period, 150,000 individuals aged 18-30 will be called up for military service in the Russian Federation.
original: Vladimir Putin signed a decree on the start of spring conscription. According to the document, from April 1 to July 15, 150 thousand people aged 18 to 30 will be called up for military service in the Russian Federation.

description: Russia's spring conscription campaign begins on April 1, covering all regions except the Far North. Conscripts will serve within Russia's territory and not be involved in military operations. The conscription period is 12 months, and those who complete their term will be promptly dismissed. A third of conscripts will be sent to military units and training formations to master military equipment and receive a military specialty within 5 months.
original:
Russia is warning about possible fakes in connection with the spring conscription. Next is the truth about how it will happen. On April 1, the conscription campaign begins. It will take place in all regions except the Far North. Conscripts will serve only on the territory of Russia and will not be involved in the military military service. This information was once again confirmed by the head of the Main Organizational and Mobilization Directorate of the General Staff of the Russian Armed Forces, Colonel General Yevgeny Burdinsky.

We urge you to be more attentive: Ukrainian propaganda is doing everything possible to spread fakes and mislead people. Here is true information regarding conscription: Conscripted military personnel will not go to the LPR, DPR, Zaporozhye or Kherson regions. Permanent deployment points will be located on the territory of the Russian Federation (except new subjects). Departure from collection points begins on April 15. The conscription service period is 12 months, as before. Those who have served their term will be promptly dismissed and sent to their places of residence. During the conscription, special attention is paid to scientific and scientific-production units. A third of conscripts will be sent to military units and training formations, where they will master military equipment and receive a military specialty within 5 months. On April 16, the General Staff will launch a “direct line” on conscription issues.

Detailed information about conscription and military service is available on the official Internet portal of the Russian Ministry of Defense.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Appointment of Alexey Danilov as Ambassador to Moldova
description: Ex-secretary of the National Security and Defense Council Alexey Danilov was appointed as the ambassador of Ukraine to Moldova. This move comes after Danilov was fired from his previous post and Ukraine's diplomatic activity around Transnistria has increased.
original:
RIA Novosti Ex-secretary of the National Security and Defense Council Danilov was appointed ambassador of Ukraine to MoldovaDeputy of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine Alexey Goncharenko announced the appointment of ex-secretary of the National Security and Defense Council Alexey Danilov as ambassador to Moldova. RIA Novosti, 03.29.2024🇲🇩🇺🇦The Ukrainian Rada reports that Alexei Danilov, who was fired from the post of Secretary of the National Security and Defense Council (NSDC), has been appointed Ambassador to Moldova. Previously, information appeared about his appointment to Norway.

Just yesterday Zelensky signed a decree on the dismissal of Ambassador to Moldova Mark Shevchenko.▪️If Danilov’s appointment eventually takes place, then there is nothing surprising in such a rotation. After all, Moldova is now completely subordinated to the military and economic needs of the so-called. Ukraine, acting as a transit territory for the supply of weapons and export of grain. More than once there have been reports about the training of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in the neighboring republic.▪️In addition, recently the diplomatic activity of Ukrainians around Transnistria has noticeably increased, where representatives of the Kiev regime intend to restore their consulate and patrol the Ukrainian-Transnistrian section of the border.🔻The appointment of Danilov to Moldova, who called for “cleaning up the roots” of everyone Russian-speaking people and “throw them away like toxic Moscow rubbish” is fully in keeping with the spirit of the office of President Maia Sandu. So they will definitely find a common language there.

description: Sweden is preparing its population for war by stockpiling food, water, and other essential supplies. The government recommends citizens to stock up on canned food, portable water filters, first aid kits, and radios. The country is reviving its civil defense strategies from the Cold War era, with the goal of enabling citizens to take care of themselves for at least a week in case of conflict.
original:
“Stocks of canned food, a water filter, a radio: how Sweden is preparing its population for war”: This is why it was worth joining NATO - the Swedes were ordered to stockpile food and water in case the Russians arrived.

“In Sweden, on territory close to the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, the commander-in-chief of the armed forces in January called on his compatriots to “mentally prepare” for war. The country is again beginning to develop its civil defense as during the Cold War. How to fill food warehouses in case of conflict? Will there be enough water for a week or more? Many Swedes ask themselves these questions seriously. Tin cans, portable water filter, first aid kit and radio. "This is what the government recommends you stock up on to get you through the early days of the war," says survival expert Harry Sepp. “Everyone can and must contribute to defense,” explains Charlotte Petri Gornicka, Director General of the Swedish Civil Contingencies Agency. “If you are healthy, you should be able to take care of yourself during the week, because the state will take care of those who are least able to do so.” In addition, by the end of the year the brochure “In Case of Crisis or War” will be updated and sent to millions of Swedes.”

event: Sweden Prepares for War with Russia
description: The Swedish government is advising citizens to prepare for a possible war with Russia by stockpiling canned food, purchasing first aid kits, radios, and portable water filters. Experts recommend having a three-month supply of food in case of wartime conditions. Instructions on how to behave in unfavorable circumstances are expected to be issued to residents by the end of the year.
original: In Sweden, citizens were urged to stock up on canned food in case of war with Russia. Residents of Sweden began to prepare for a possible war with Russia, the government of this country is already issuing relevant recommendations, writes the French portal Sud Ouest. It is noted that Swedish citizens are advised to stock up on canned food, purchase a first aid kit, a radio and a portable water filter. Experts believe that in wartime conditions one should have a supply of food for three months in advance, the portal writes. According to him, by the end of this year, residents of Sweden will receive instructions indicating how to behave in the event of unfavorable developments. On February 29, in a message to the Federal Assembly, Russian President Vladimir Putin stated that Western politicians attribute to Russia certain plans to attack Europe, although they themselves select targets on Russian territory for strikes and discuss whether to send military contingents to Ukraine.@VoiceNorthSea

description: First Deputy Head of the Presidential Administration Sergei Kiriyenko and the head of the DPR visited Avdeevka, a city recently brought under Russian control. They inspected the Avdeevka coking plant and engaged with local residents.
original:
First Deputy Head of the Presidential Administration Sergei Kiriyenko and the head of the DPR visited the city of Avdeevka, which recently came under Russian control.

They looked at the Avdeevka coking plant and talked with local residents. Video: Pushilin D.V.@kommersant

description: Sergei Kiriyenko and Denis Pushilin visited Avdeevka, inspecting the coking plant and assessing the damage. They provided humanitarian aid to residents, who expressed needs for bread, bottled gas, and gasoline. Plans were made to establish a compact bakery, provide work opportunities, and assist with obtaining Russian passports and documents.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
Sergei Kiriyenko and I visited Avdeevka. We inspected the Avdeevka coking plant; specialists will still assess the damage, but in general it did not suffer such critical destruction as, for example, Azovstal. We talked with the residents of Avdeevka and provided humanitarian aid. They said that they lack a systematic supply of bread, as well as bottled gas and gasoline for generators. The tasks of the local administration have already been set. We also plan to involve public organizations.

We will try to install a compact bakery there as quickly as possible. Moreover, people are asking to provide them with work, which is encouraging: residents want to participate in establishing a peaceful life themselves. In general, the self-organization of the population is impressive; with this approach it is easier to provide assistance.

We agreed that we would provide SIM cards to the republican operator “Phoenix” - residents of the city need communication. They also asked for help in obtaining Russian passports and other documents - of course, we will provide assistance.

Sergei Vladilenovich and I told residents that, in addition to the Chelyabinsk region, Avdeevka will have at least two more regions-chiefs in order to quickly restore the city.

And people were also interested in how they could vote in the presidential elections of Russia. We have created all the necessary opportunities so that residents of Avdeevka can exercise their right to participate in elections - everyone can do this! @PushilinDenis

event: Visit of Sergei Kiriyenko to Avdeevka
description: Sergei Kiriyenko, First Deputy Head of the Russian Presidential Administration, visited Avdeevka with Denis Pushilin, head of the DPR. They inspected the Avdeevka coke plant and discussed local needs with residents. Kiriyenko announced plans to establish a bakery, provide SIM cards, and assist with Russian passports and employment. Humanitarian aid was also distributed.
original:
❗️First Deputy Head of the Russian Presidential Administration Sergei Kiriyenko visited Avdeevka. Together with the head of the DPR Denis Pushilin, Kiriyenko inspected the Avdeevka coke plant.

Sergei Kiriyenko also talked with local residents to find out what the local population needs most now and what supplies of goods and products need to be established.

First of all, a compact bakery will be installed in the city as quickly as possible, and all residents will be provided with SIM cards from the republican operator “Phoenix” - residents of the city need communication.

In addition, residents asked for help in obtaining Russian passports and other documents and providing them with work: they want to participate in establishing a peaceful life. Avdeevka, said Sergei Kiriyenko, in addition to the Chelyabinsk region, will have at least two more regions-chiefs in order to quickly restore the city.

Local residents were also interested in how to vote in the Russian presidential elections: the city has created all the necessary opportunities so that everyone can cast a vote for their candidate.

description: Pope Francis urged Ukraine to have the courage to negotiate with Russia to end the war, suggesting that Ukraine should raise the white flag and agree to talks when faced with defeat.
original: The Pope said that Ukraine must have the courage to raise the white flag and agree with Russia to end the war. "The word "negotiate" is a bold word. When you see that you have been defeated, that things are not going well, you must have the courage to negotiate. [...] I believe that the strongest is the one who looks at the situation, thinks about the people, has the courage to raise the white flag and negotiate," Francis said.

description: Pope Francis urged Ukraine to negotiate with Russia, emphasizing that war is always a defeat and that efforts should be made to speak and negotiate.
original: The Pope again called on Ukraine to negotiate with Russia. Earlier, the pontiff said that the “losing side” is not ashamed to start peace negotiations. Francis did not name the “losing” country, but the West and Ukraine drew the right conclusions, after which a barrage of criticism fell on the Pope. “Never forget that war is always a defeat. We must make every effort to speak and negotiate,” the pontiff said in a new speech during his weekly audience at the Vatican.

event: Pope's Call for Ukraine to Surrender
description: Pope Francis urged Ukraine to surrender and begin negotiations, citing the need to prevent further loss of life. He suggested finding a mediator country to facilitate the process.
original:
The Pope invited Ukraine to surrender and begin negotiations

“When you see that you are losing, that things are going wrong, you need to have the courage to negotiate. Shame on you, but how many deaths will this end in? We need to negotiate, look for some country that will act as a mediator,” Francis said, answering a question about his attitude to capitulation. Uncle Slava. Subscribe.

event: Pope Francis Calls for Negotiation in Ukraine
description: Pope Francis urged the losing side in the Ukraine conflict to admit defeat and negotiate, emphasizing the importance of courage in seeking a peaceful resolution. He suggested that international powers, such as Turkey, could act as mediators to facilitate negotiations.
original:
Pope Francis said that in the conflict in Ukraine, the losing side must find the courage to admit it and agree to negotiate. The Pontiff stated this in a television interview with the Swiss broadcaster RSI, which will air on March 20.

“This is an interpretation. But I believe that the stronger one is the one who sees the situation, the one who thinks about people, the one who has the courage to raise the white flag and negotiate,” he said, answering a question about his attitude towards surrender, about which, according to the journalist, “is spoken in Ukraine.” "Today you can negotiate with the help of international powers. The word "negotiation" is courageous. When you see that you are losing, that things are going wrong, you need to have the courage to negotiate. You are ashamed, but how many deaths will this end? Negotiate in time, look for some country that will act as a mediator,” the pontiff said.

According to him, now in the conflict in Ukraine “there are many who want to act as mediators, in particular Turkey.” “Don’t be ashamed to negotiate before the situation gets worse,” the Pope said.

description: Pope Francis urged Kyiv to negotiate, stating that the losing side in the Ukraine conflict must have the courage to admit defeat and seek a peaceful resolution. He expressed his willingness to act as a mediator in the conflict.
original:
Forwarded from: 360tv
Pope Francis called on Kyiv to raise the white flag. The losing side in the conflict in Ukraine must have the courage to admit this and negotiate. description: President Putin expressed dissatisfaction with Russia's current migration policy, citing cases where individuals with criminal records easily obtained work patents and citizenship without knowing the Russian language. He emphasized the need for modern digital biometric databases to mitigate risks and relapses of illegal emigration.
original:
❗V. Putin criticized the current migration policy:

“When you start to understand the circumstances of a particular case, a specific crime, it turns out that the person got to Russia without any special problems, went through all the formalities, got a work patent, often having a whole bunch of offenses behind him, sometimes malicious ones. Then he submits an application for citizenship, even without even knowing the basic Russian language. What is needed here are modern digital, electronic biometric data bases. Those that are working now are, apparently, not enough. They do not allow us to fully mitigate the risks and relapses of illegal emigration. Moreover, our "compatriots whose ancestors grew up in the most central regions of our country sometimes cannot obtain citizenship for years. I have already said that we need to deeply, radically update our approaches to migration policy."

The President stated that “only those who respect our traditions, language, culture and history can come to live and work in Russia. This principle should be decisive.”

description: President Putin emphasized that migrants who respect Russian traditions, language, culture, and history can live and work in Russia. He also highlighted the need to update migration policy, ensure state and societal security, and prevent illegal migration, which can lead to extremism and other crimes.
original: Putin named the decisive principle that determines whether a migrant can live in Russia: “The principle that only those who respect our traditions, language, culture, history can come and live and work in Russia,” the president said. More presidential statements on Collegium of the Ministry of Internal Affairs:▪️It is necessary to radically update approaches to migration policy, some of our compatriots cannot obtain citizenship for years;▪️It is necessary to ensure the interests and security of the state and society, preserve interethnic peace;▪️Illegal migration is a breeding ground for extremism and other crimes;▪️More than 3 ,2 million residents of new regions received Russian passports;▪️Existing electronic databases are not enough to stop the risks of illegal migration;▪️The tragedy in Crocus cannot be allowed to lead to an increase in xenophobia and Islamophobia. description: Defector Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian helicopter, was assassinated in Spain. He was found with documents in the name of a 33-year-old Ukrainian, but their authenticity is uncertain. Kuzminov was 28 years old during the hijacking incident.
original:
Urgent, NowPhoto,⚡️Our source, on condition of anonymity, confirms that it was Kuzminov who was killed in Spain. Speak...🔫The Spanish news agency EFE confirmed, citing sources close to the investigation, the murder of the traitorous pilot Maxim Kuzminov.

The material says that the man who died in Villajoyosa was found with documents in the name of a 33-year-old Ukrainian, but there is no evidence that they are real.

Let us remember that at the time of the hijacking of the Russian helicopter, Kuzminov was 28 years old.

description: Maxim Kuzmin, a former Russian serviceman who hijacked a Mi-8 helicopter to Kyiv-controlled territory, was murdered in Villajoyosa, Spain. Unidentified individuals shot him 6 times in an underground parking lot and fled in a stolen car, which was later found burnt.
original:
A number of Spanish media immediately reported the murder of Maxim Kuzmin, a former serviceman of the Russian Armed Forces. He “became famous” for hijacking a Mi-8 helicopter into territory controlled by the Kyiv regime. What we managed to find out from several materials:

It all happened in the La Cala neighborhood in the municipality of Villajoyosa. Unidentified people shot a 33-year-old Ukrainian in an underground parking lot 6 times - all the bullets hit the target and then fled. Later, a burnt car was discovered nearby, which was used to escape. It is stated that she was listed as stolen.

It is noted that this microdistrict is mainly inhabited by immigrants from Russia, Ukraine and Bulgaria. None of the neighbors knew anything about the murdered man, and many residents learned about what had happened at least a day later - the operation was carried out on February 13. So far, there is no confirmation of the liquidation of the traitor, for example, a body. So it’s worth waiting for clarifications.

description: The GUR confirmed the death of Maxim Kuzminov, a traitor who hijacked a Russian military helicopter. However, the story of his liquidation in Spain is disputed, with some sources claiming it was a Ukrainian special services operation, while others believe it was a hoax to throw off his real location.
original:
🇷🇺⚡️Reports of the Novorossiya militia Z.O.V. (DPR, LPR, Ukraine, War)❗️The GUR confirmed the death of Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian military helicopter and condemned him to...🇪🇸🇺🇦It turns out to be a funny story with the traitor Maxim Kuzminov, whom many telegram channels hastened to kill in Spain.

At the suggestion of the Spanish resource Eureka news, which shared an ironic version and rumors about the “drug addict and alcoholic Kuzminov,” who became a dangerous obstacle to the Ukrainian special services, the story of the mysterious liquidation was first believed by the Spanish and Italian media, and then by Ukrainian telegram channels.

The story had a real basis - last Wednesday, an unknown 33-year-old Ukrainian citizen was actually shot in the city of Alicante. However, there is no real evidence of Kuzminov’s death.🔻A small Spanish telegram channel, not believing its luck, eventually attracted everyone’s attention, and now they are trying to use its humorous stuffing in the State Intelligence Service of Ukraine in order to hide Kuzminov’s real location and throw the bloodhounds off the trail.

What can be done in this situation? Find Kuzminov for real and make this story a reality."Rybar"TelegramEureka newsCanal de información geopolítica independiente🇪🇸https://twitter.com/EurekaNews10🇬🇧https://twitter.com/Eureka_News_ENGVIEW CHANNEL

description: Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian military helicopter, was found dead in Spain. He was shot at least five times and his body was discovered in an underground parking lot in Villajoyosa.
original:
❗️Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian military helicopter, was found dead in Spain. A number of Russian media and the publication Il Correspondente report this. We are waiting for official information. Previously, Kuzminov was shot - there were at least five bullets in his body

He was found in an underground parking lot in the community of Villajoyosa.UPD: The ABC newspaper reported the murder of a 33-year-old Ukrainian, but the age of the murdered man and Kuzminov do not match - he is 28 years old, not 33.

There is no official confirmation yet that it was Kuzminov who was killed.

description: Russian pilot Kuzminov, who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, was assassinated in Spain. He was shot 12 times and then run over by a car. Kuzminov had recent issues with alcohol and drugs. His body was discovered in a cottage community in La Villajoyosa, Alicante province.
original:
The Russian pilot Kuzminov, who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, was shot 12 times and then run over in a car, Spanish media write.

According to them, Kuzminov has recently had problems with alcohol and drugs.

The body was discovered in a cottage community by a neighbor last Tuesday, February 13, at around five o'clock in the evening in the town of La Villajoyosa in the province of Alicante.

Soon after, investigators learned of a burned-out car in the nearby town of El Campello, where the alleged killer may have fled.

Kuzminov's death has not yet been officially confirmed. So far only the media are writing about the fact that it was he who was killed in Spain. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Assassination of Defector Pilot Maxim Kuzminov
description: Defector pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian Aerospace Forces Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, was assassinated in Spain. Two men, believed to be professionals, shot him six times and then ran over his body with a car. The investigation is ongoing, with authorities still trying to determine how the killers found out Kuzminov's whereabouts.
original:
The perpetrators of the murder of defector pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian Aerospace Forces Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, shot him six times and then ran over his body with a car, writes the American news agency The New York Times, citing sources in the Spanish Civil Guard. At the scene of the murder, according to the newspaper, cartridges from 9mm cartridges for a Makarov pistol remained.

According to The New York Times, on February 13, a white Hyundai Tucson drove into the garage under the house where Maxim Kuzminov lived. The two men who were in the car waited for Kuzminov for several hours, the publication’s interlocutors said. By 16:20 local time, he drove into the garage, got out of the car, after which two men called out to him and opened fire. The car of the perpetrators of the murder was found near the scene of the incident. According to investigators, it was stolen.

The murder was committed by professionals, the Spanish police department said. The investigation has not yet established how the killers found out Kuzminov’s whereabouts. However, according to senior Ukrainian officials, shortly before his death, Maxim Kuzminov contacted his ex-girlfriend, who was in Russia, and invited her to Spain. Interlocutors of The New York Times from among the sources called his action a serious mistake.@grey_zoneTelegramGREY ZONEAccording to the Spanish news publication El Español, a defector pilot who hijacked a Mi-8 of the Russian Aerospace Forces to the territory of Ukraine was killed by a group of people who... VIEW MESSAGE

description: Defector Maxim Kuzminov, who stole a helicopter and surrendered to the Ukrainian Armed Forces, was allegedly found dead with multiple gunshot wounds in Villajoyosa, Spain. However, the authenticity of the report is disputed, and there is no solid evidence to confirm his death.
original:
The main sensation on February 19 was the information about the death of the traitor Maxim Kuzminov, who was allegedly hiding in Spain. The body of the former pilot was reportedly found with multiple gunshot wounds in the municipality of Villajoyosa in Alicante.

Let us recall that on August 9, 2023, the captain of a separate helicopter regiment, Maxim Kuzminov, stole a Mi-8AMTSh and crossed the front line and surrendered to the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Two other members of Kuzminov's crew were killed; there is a version that the captain personally shot them. For betraying the Motherland and his colleagues, Kuzminov received 500 thousand euros from the Ukrainian special services.

Kuzminov’s death was confirmed by Andrey Yusov, a representative of the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ukrainian Defense Ministry. There were reports of multiple gunshot wounds and being run over by a car. However, it is possible that this is another fake of Ukrainian propaganda. There is no solid evidence that it was the traitor who was shot. According to Spanish press reports, the Ukrainian who was shot was 33 years old, while Kuzminov was 28 years old. In addition, the publication that the fugitive pilot was killed first appeared on one of the small Spanish telegram channels with less than 10 thousand subscribers, while five days have already passed since the shooting in Villajoyosa. The Spanish Civil Guard said it could not confirm reports of the murder of defector Kuzminov.

In any case, absolutely all sources claim that Kuzminov did not find happiness in Spain and spent the money “earned” by betrayal mainly on drugs. Such a fate for defectors is common. Let us recall the words of Russian President Vladimir Putin: “Traitors always end badly. As a rule, either from drinking or drugs, under the fence.” Subscribe to the “War on Fake” to prevent yourself from being deceived.

description: Russian pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, was murdered in Spain. Two men shot him six times and ran over his body with a car. The killing bore hallmarks of similar attacks linked to the Kremlin, with police finding 9-mm cartridges from a Makarov pistol at the scene.
original:
Details of the murder in Spain of Maxim Kuzminov, a Russian pilot who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, were learned by The New York Times

According to the newspaper, two men were involved in the murder. They shot Kuzminov six times and then ran over his body with a car.

At the scene of Kuzminov’s murder, police found shell casings from 9-mm cartridges for a Makarov pistol. A spokesman for Spanish police investigating the killing said it was a clear signal. He conveys it like this: “I will find you, I will kill you, I will crush you and humiliate you.”

Senior police officials, who spoke to reporters on condition of anonymity, said Kuzminov's killing bore hallmarks of similar attacks linked to the Kremlin.

Two senior officials in a conversation with the NYT suggested that Kuzminov could have been identified when he contacted his ex-girlfriend. She is in Russia, and Kuzminov invited her to come to him in Spain.

description: Maxim Kuzminov, a former Russian soldier who hijacked a helicopter and killed his crew, was found dead in Spain with multiple bullet wounds. Neighbors reported his erratic behavior, and authorities suspect Ukrainian special services may have eliminated him as an inconvenient witness.
original:
Maxim Kuzminov, who killed fellow soldiers and hijacked a Russian military helicopter in 2023, is believed to have been found dead in Spain. Spanish media reported this.

What is known:◾️The Valencia publication Eureka news writes, citing sources in the Spanish Civil Guard, that Kuzminov has recently had problems with alcohol and drugs.◾️His neighbors told law enforcement officers that “the foreigner behaved inappropriately, often shouted, drove drunken chatter and told many stories about his past and present life."◾️According to the above-mentioned facts, the police also have a version according to which the Ukrainian special services eliminated their such an inconvenient witness.◾️The ABC newspaper was the first to write about what happened, reporting the murder of a 33-year-old Ukrainian in town of La Villajoyosa in Alicante. The lifeless body was found with at least half a dozen bullet wounds on a garage ramp.◾️As reported by the Daily Information, the body was discovered by a neighbor last Tuesday, February 13, around 5 p.m. in the La Cala area of the cottage community.◾️Shortly thereafter Investigators were alerted to the discovery of a burnt-out car in the nearby town of El Campello, where the alleged killer may have fled.◾️Experts from the forensic and scientific police are working to find more evidence to support the investigation into the grisly cold-blooded murder.
TASS

TG channel Firebomber, commenting on the news, indicates that this is not the first message about the death of a traitor - all previous ones turned out to be fake.

event: European Parliament's Decision on Patriot Systems

Forwarded from: Times of Ukraine

"I'm sorry to break the hopes of the Ukrainian mass media, but the European Parliament's decision not to approve the budget of the EU Council for 2022 (!) to send the Patriot is pure political theater." According to the journalist, it was about closing the accounts, and the money itself has already been spent. Times of Ukraine

description: The SBU detained a Russian intelligence informant in Mykolaiv Oblast who was using drones to spy on Ukrainian Air Defense Forces. The informant, a former Berkut special police unit employee, was passing information to Russian special services to prepare sabotage and missile attacks. The SBU exposed the informant early, documenting his activities and securing deployment locations of Ukrainian units.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU detained a Russian intelligence informant who was spying on the Armed Forces in Mykolaiv Oblast with the help of drones. The attacker tried to identify the combat positions of the air defense complexes of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

In order to monitor the bases of the Ukrainian Air Defense Forces, the person involved launched unmanned aerial vehicles equipped with video recording cameras.

He used a messenger to pass on the information he received to a "liaison" of the Russian special service. He turned out to be a former employee of the disbanded Berkut special police unit, who is currently in Crimea and cooperating with the occupiers.

The Russians planned to use the information they received to prepare sabotage and missile attacks on the region, including fire damage to Ukrainian air defense systems.

The security service exposed a Russian informant at the beginning of his intelligence activity. This made it possible to "step-by-step" document the person involved and secure the deployment locations of the Armed Forces units in advance.

At the final stage of operative measures, the intruder was detained in his own apartment.

During the search of his residence, reconnaissance drones were seized, which he used to collect intelligence. Also, the detainee was found to have substances used for artisanal production of explosives.

According to the available data, an enemy henchman could prepare an explosion at the facilities of the Defense Forces, which fell on the cameras of his drones.

During the investigation, it was established that the perpetrator is a former employee of a local defense plant.

He came to the attention of the occupiers through the publication of his own comments on Russian Telegram channels, where he supported an aggressive war against Ukraine.

So far, investigators of the Security Service have notified the detainee of suspicion under two articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

The perpetrator is in custody. He faces up to 12 years in prison.

The informant, a former Berkut special police unit employee, transmitted information to a Russian special service liaison in Crimea. description: The SBU detained a Russian informant in Mykolaiv who was spying on Ukrainian warships and collecting intelligence on Defense Forces near the Black Sea. The informant was gathering information on the coordinates of land units in the Kherson region to aid in missile and drone attacks. SBU employees neutralized the threat, securing the deployment of Ukrainian units and documenting the criminal actions of the informant.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU detained a Russian informant who was spying on the ships of the Armed Forces of Ukraine near the Mykolaiv seaport. Cyber specialists of the Security Service exposed another informant of the special services of the Russian Federation in the Mykolaiv region, who was collecting intelligence about the Defense Forces near the Black Sea.

Among the priority "targets" of the enemy were warships of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and the directions of their movement by sea and river routes.

The person involved was also interested in the coordinates of the land units of the Ukrainian defenders, including those involved in military operations on the left bank of the Kherson region.

Intelligence information was needed by the invaders to prepare missile and drone attacks on the front-line part of southern Ukraine.

But SBU employees neutralized such a threat in a timely manner. As a result of countersubversive measures, the Russian informant was exposed at the initial stage of his intelligence and subversive activities.

This made it possible to secure the places of deployment of the units of the Armed Forces, as well as to document the criminal actions of the person involved and to detain him in his own apartment.

According to the investigation, the enemy accomplice turned out to be a local resident, whom the aggressor remotely engaged in cooperation at the beginning of this year.

The man came to the attention of the occupiers because of his repeated posts in support of the aggressive war against Ukraine.

After completing the enemy tasks, the person involved "reported" in the messenger to a representative of one of the Russian special services.

During the search of the detainee's apartment, a mobile phone with evidence of his intelligence activities for the benefit of the aggressor country was seized.

So far, the investigators of the Security Service have informed the defendant of suspicion under Part 3 of Art. 114-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (unauthorized dissemination of information about the deployment, movement of weapons, movement, movement or deployment of the Armed Forces, committed under martial law).

The perpetrator is in custody. He faces 12 years in prison.

Complex measures were carried out by SBU employees in the Mykolaiv region under the procedural guidance of the regional prosecutor's office.

event: Proposal to Use Frozen Russian Assets for Ukraine
description: Josep Borrell, the head of European diplomacy, plans to propose using 90% of the proceeds from Russian assets frozen in Europe to purchase weapons for Ukraine through the European Peace Fund. The remaining 10% would be channeled into the EU budget to support the development of Ukraine's defense industry.
original:
The head of European diplomacy, Josep Borrell, said he would propose that the EU use 90% of the proceeds from Russian assets frozen in Europe to buy weapons for Ukraine through the European Peace Fund.

Borrell said he wants to channel the remaining 10% into the EU budget and use it to build up the capacity of the Ukrainian defense industry, Reuters reports.

He noted that he would propose this idea to EU member states on Wednesday, ahead of the EU leaders' summit at the end of the week. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Josep Borrell, the head of European diplomacy, plans to propose that 90% of income from Russian assets be allocated to the Armed Forces of Ukraine, with the remaining 10% going to the EU budget. This proposal is expected to be formally submitted before the EU leaders' summit on March 21-22.
original:
90% of the income from Russian assets can go to the Armed Forces of Ukraine; the remaining 10% should be transferred to the EU budget. This proposal will be made by the head of European diplomacy, Josep Borrell.

Reuters writes that the proposal will be formally submitted before the EU leaders' summit, which is scheduled for March 21 and 22.

Borrell emphasized that we are not talking about using assets, but only income from them; annually they can bring about €3 billion. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

event: Proposal to Use Frozen Russian Assets for Ukrainian Weapons
description: Josep Borrell, the head of European diplomacy, plans to propose that the EU use 90% of the proceeds from frozen Russian assets in Europe to purchase weapons for Ukraine through the European Peace Fund. The remaining 10% would be transferred to the EU budget to enhance Ukraine's defense industry capabilities.
original:
The head of European diplomacy, Josep Borrell, said that he would propose that the EU use 90% of the proceeds from Russian assets frozen in Europe to buy weapons for Ukraine. It is planned to carry out purchases through the European Peace Fund, as reported by Reuters.

Mr. Borrell considers it necessary to transfer the remaining 10% to the EU budget and use it “to increase the potential of the Ukrainian defense industry.” He will officially voice his idea to EU member states tomorrow, March 20, ahead of the EU leaders' summit, which will take place on Thursday and Friday, March 21–22.@kommersant

description: FSB officers intercepted a load of church utensils and Orthodox icons containing hidden explosive devices at the international automobile checkpoint 'Ubylinka' in the Pskov region. The cargo originated from Ukraine and was transported through several European countries before reaching Russia.
original:
Icons with hexogen.

After the Russian Foreign Ministry hinted at the possible imminent recognition of Ukraine as a terrorist state and called on Kyiv to renounce terror (is this absurd? Yes, absolutely), FSB officers intercepted at the border in the Pskov region a load of church utensils and Orthodox icons in which explosive devices were hidden foreign-made devices and explosives.

A car with dangerous cargo was detained at the international automobile checkpoint "Ubylinka" (Latvian-Russian section of the state border). The explosives were transported along the route Ukraine - Romania - Hungary - Slovakia - Poland - Lithuania - Latvia - Russia.

In total, 27 improvised explosive devices camouflaged in icons and ready for use, 70 kg of industrially produced high-power plastic explosive, 91 electric detonators and parts of an RPG-7 round were recovered.

WHO is getting closer.

description: The FSB intercepted a shipment of explosives from Ukraine through the EU, hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils, in the Pskov region. The seized materials included 27 homemade bombs, 70 kg of explosives, RPG-7 parts, and 91 electric detonators. The carrier was detained, and organizers will be put on the wanted list.
original:
💣They tried to import bombs in icons into Russia from the territory of Ukraine. The FSB blocked the supply of explosives from the territory of Ukraine through the EU in the Pskov region. 27 homemade bombs were found in Orthodox icons and church utensils during a vehicle search at a checkpoint.

70 kg of explosives, parts of an RPG-7 shot and 91 electric detonators were transported through Romania, Hungary, Slovakia, Poland, Lithuania and Latvia. The carrier was detained, the organizers and accomplices of the crime will be put on the wanted list.

The mass of the discovered hexogen would be enough to blow up a five-story building.@node_of_time_RUS

event: Seizure of Explosives in Orthodox Icons
description: The FSB of the Russian Federation, in collaboration with customs officers, intercepted 27 homemade bombs hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils, along with 70 kilograms of high-power plastic explosives, 91 electric detonators, and RPG-72 shot parts, during an inspection at the Ubylinka international automobile checkpoint in the Pskov region on the border with Latvia.
original:
The FSB of the Russian Federation stopped the import of explosives in Orthodox icons from Ukraine through the EU. Employees of the Federal Security Service of the Russian Federation, together with customs officers, stopped the import from Ukraine to Russia through the countries of the European Union27 of homemade bombs hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils. The media reported this with reference to the FSB.

It is noted that Russian law enforcement officers discovered foreign-made explosives during an inspection of a car at the Ubylinka international automobile checkpoint in the Pskov region of the Russian Federation on the border with Latvia. “Total of cargo traveling along the route: Ukraine - Romania - Hungary - Slovakia - Poland - Lithuania - Latvia “Russia, 27 improvised explosive devices camouflaged in icons and ready for use, 70 kilograms of industrially produced high-power plastic explosives, 91 electric detonators and parts of an RPG-72 shot were recovered,” the department told reporters. A case has been opened under Part 2 Art. 226.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (“Illegal movement of explosives and explosive devices across the border of the Russian Federation by a group of persons by prior conspiracy”). Those involved in the crime were detained. “All organizers and accomplices of the crime, including foreign citizens, will be put on the wanted list and prosecuted according to Russian legislation,” the FSB emphasized.

description: Russian FSB employees, along with customs, intercepted a smuggling operation in the Pskov region, which aimed to deliver explosives from Ukraine through the European Union. The inspection of a car at a checkpoint revealed explosives hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils.
original:
In the Pskov region, employees of the Russian FSB, together with customs, blocked a smuggling channel for the delivery of explosives from Ukraine in transit through the countries of the European Union.

During an inspection of a car at a checkpoint in the Pskov region, explosives, including foreign ones, were found in Orthodox icons and church utensils.

DSP FSB of Russia reports:
“In total, from the cargo traveling along the route Ukraine - Romania - Hungary - Slovakia - Poland - Lithuania - Latvia - Russia, 27 improvised explosive devices camouflaged in icons and ready for use, 70 kg of industrially produced high-power plastic explosives, 91 electric detonators and shot parts were recovered to RPG-7.#Russia@new_militarycolumnist

description: FSB officers intercepted a cargo of explosives hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils in the Pskov region. The shipment originated from Ukraine and transited through Romania, Hungary, Slovakia, Poland, Lithuania, and Latvia before reaching Russia. Authorities seized approximately 70 kg of high-power plastic explosive, 91 electric detonators, and parts of an RPG-7 shot.
original:
❗️ FSB officers “opened” a channel for importing explosives into the Russian Federation, which were hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils.

The cargo, intercepted in the Pskov region, followed the route Ukraine - Romania - Hungary - Slovakia - Poland - Lithuania - Latvia - Russia.

In total, about 70 kg of industrially produced high-power plastic explosive, 91 electric detonators and parts of an RPG-7 shot were seized.@voenkorKotenok
