description: On this day 210 years ago, Russian troops led by Emperor Alexander I triumphantly entered Paris, marking the end of the longest war of the 19th century. The Russian Army's Foreign Campaign liberated Europe from Napoleonic troops, freeing dozens of cities including Berlin and Amsterdam. Napoleon's army was defeated in Russia in 1812, and he eventually abdicated power.
original:
On this day 210 years ago, Russian troops took Paris: Emperor Alexander I triumphantly entered the streets of the French capital. Thus ended the longest war of the 19th century. The famous Foreign Campaign of the Russian Army was, in fact, a large-scale operation to liberate Europe from Napoleonic troops: it took place over a space of hundreds of kilometers between the Baltic Sea and Brest-Litovsk, the Neman and the Rhine.

Russian troops gave freedom to dozens of European cities, including such large ones as Berlin and Amsterdam. And Russia received new heroes - Mikhail Barclay de Tolly, Leonty Korenny and Alexander Benkendorf.

After the capture of Paris, France capitulated and Napoleon abdicated power. His army conquered all of Europe, but was defeated in Russia in 1812.

At the entrance to Paris, the Russian cavalcade was led by horse guards and Cossacks, followed by hussars and cuirassiers of the Prussian Guard, then dragoons and hussars of the Russian Guard rode.

As they moved towards the city center, the mood of the wary public changed: Parisians, who were expecting imminent reprisals for Moscow devastated in 1812, saw that the conquerors were behaving with restraint and friendliness. The crowd began to hear greetings addressed to the Russian Emperor. And when Alexander I was surrounded by a crowd at the Champs Elysees, he heard: “We have been waiting for the arrival of Your Majesty for a long time!”

During his stay in Paris, the emperor issued strict instructions not to offend peaceful Frenchmen and, in general, to behave with dignity and not to rob. This was especially surprising compared to how barbarically the French behaved in Moscow. The short stay of Russian troops in Paris left a separate mark on the culture and life of the country. The capture of Paris became not just a glorious page in Russian history, but also an example of courage, perseverance and generosity of the Russian army, an example on which officers of all subsequent generations relied, including those who defends Russia today.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: After intense battles, Russian troops entered Paris on March 31, 1814, marking the end of a two-year war between the Russian Empire and Napoleon's French Empire. The French Empire capitulated, and Emperor Alexander I led a triumphant cavalry procession through the city.
original:
ON MARCH 31, 1814, RUSSIAN TROOPS ENTERED PARIS

After intense battles on the approaches to the French capital, after Russian artillerymen occupied the commanding heights, contrary to the will of Napoleon, the French Empire capitulated. The capitulation of Paris was signed at 2 a.m. on March 31 in the village of Lavillette on the terms drawn up by the dashing Colonel Mikhail Orlov, who was left hostage by the French during the truce. Thus ended a two-year war in which Napoleon’s empire could not withstand the confrontation with the Russian Empire.

At noon on March 31, cavalry squadrons led by Emperor Alexander I triumphantly entered the capital of France. “All the streets along which the allies had to pass, and all the streets adjacent to them, were filled with people who occupied even the roofs of the houses,” recalled the hero of the day, Mikhail Orlov.

Vengefulness is the lot of the weak. True winners are characterized by generosity. The correctness of these words was demonstrated by Russian officers in the spring of 1814. The Russian bayonet reached Paris, but did not ruin the great city.@veteranrossii_online

description: On March 31, 1814, Russian troops led by Emperor Alexander I triumphantly entered Paris, marking the end of the Napoleonic wars. Alexander I ensured the city's protection, released prisoners, banned looting, and provided for the poor and needy citizens.
original:
Forwarded from: ⚔️🛡Last Russian
​​⚔️On March 31, 1814, Russian troops led by Emperor Alexander I triumphantly entered Paris. After the defeat on the Berezina in December 1812, the remnants of the French army fled from Russian territory. But in order to finally remove the military threat, Alexander I led troops to France.
 
Paris was taken under the personal protection of Alexander I. The prisoners were released, a strict ban on looting was introduced, and the poor and needy citizens were provided with food.

Moreover, the Russian emperor forbade the destruction of the column with the statue of Napoleon.
 
The capture of Paris marked the end of a series of Napoleonic wars that shook the Old World. Russia has declared itself as the leading military-political force on the continent. The end of the Napoleonic era, achieved by the heroism of the Russian army, became the basis for many years of peaceful development of Russia and Europe.

“This is the latest existential threat, it is the climate. We have crazy son of a bitch Putin and others and we always have to worry about nuclear conflict, but the existential threat to humanity is climate."
- says the US President.

event: Biden's Remarks on Putin and Climate Change
description: US President Biden referred to Russian President Putin as a 'crazy son of a b*tch' during a fundraising event in San Francisco, emphasizing the existential threat posed by climate change and the need to address it.
original:
Biden called Putin a 'crazy son of a b*tch' - CNN

“This is the latest existential threat, it is the climate. We have crazy son of a bitch Putin and others, and we always have to worry about a nuclear conflict, but the existential threat to humanity is the climate,” the US president said at a fundraising event in San Francisco. GU>Subscribe

event: Biden's Remarks on Putin and Climate Change
description: During a fundraiser in San Francisco, US President Joe Biden referred to Russian President Vladimir Putin as a 'crazy son of a bitch', emphasizing the threat of nuclear conflict. However, he stressed that the existential threat to humanity remains climate change.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
"Biden called Putin a 'crazy son of a bitch' during a fundraiser in San Francisco": Biden is back to publicly swearing.

US President Joe Biden called Russian President Vladimir Putin a “crazy son of a bitch” during a fundraiser in San Francisco on Wednesday, warning that the threat of nuclear conflict is always there, but the existential threat to humanity remains the climate. “This is the latest existential threat. It's the climate. We have crazy sons of bitches like this guy Putin and others, and we always have to worry about nuclear conflict, but the existential threat to humanity is the climate,” Biden told a small group of donors. Biden is prone to veering off script during campaign fundraising and has in recent months criticized the Chinese government, the Republican Party and US ally Israel over the bombing of the Gaza Strip. Biden's verbal attacks against Putin also escalated sharply in the White House during the campaign.

description: Following the 2024 elections, Russian President Vladimir Putin addressed citizens, stating that all voter-supported ideas will be incorporated into the country's future. He thanked all voters, emphasizing the importance of civic duty, and commended the Central Election Commission for their courage and bravery during the campaign.
original:
“Russia is a big, friendly family that is following the historical path we have chosen”: Vladimir Putin addressed citizens following the results of the 2024 elections. The President of the Russian Federation, in his address to the people, stated that all the ideas that resonated with voters will be used in the future. The election campaign, he said, was responsible and intense, as people chose the path our country would take next. The significance of this event was understood by everyone who came to vote.

The Russian leader thanked everyone who came to make their choice, regardless of whose name this person ticked - this shows the importance of such a concept as civic duty for Russians. Vladimir Putin specifically thanked the members of the Central Election Commission, noting that they showed courage and bravery during this campaign.

description: Vladimir Putin addressed citizens on the results of the Russian Presidential elections, thanking voters for their participation and support. He emphasized the significance of the election, which chose the path for Russia's future, and acknowledged the work of election commissions.
original:
🎙V.V. Putinak’s address to citizens on the results of the Russian Presidential elections (March 21, 2024)💬Today the official voting results for the Russian Presidential elections have been summed up. An extremely important election campaign for our country, society and citizens has ended.

<...>

The past campaign was intense and extremely responsible, because by and large we were choosing the path that Russia would take next, choosing the future for ourselves and our children. And the significance of this event was understood by the absolute majority of voters who came to the elections.

Once again, I thank everyone who took part in the voting, regardless of who you voted for. The main thing is that you have proven that you respect your civic duty, value freedom of choice and your voice, and each of your votes, I repeat, was of great importance.

<...>

Thank you for your support. For me this is more important than a formal victory in the elections. This is support for the political and economic course of our country, our common results, which, of course, should be greater, but are already making Russia even stronger and more independent today.

A few words about the work of election commissions at all levels. As always, you acted clearly, competently, on the principles of transparency and in strict accordance with the law, and in our historical territories, members of election commissions were an example for voters, showing courage and courage. I thank you all for your trust. I will do everything in my power to justify him. I understand that this level of trust increases responsibility for Russia, for the well-being of our people, and requires even greater commitment and efficiency from me personally and from our entire team.

We will do everything to ensure that the large-scale national projects and programs that I recently spoke about in detail in the Address are implemented. The elections showed that Russia today is one big, friendly family. We are walking together along the historical path we have chosen. Confident in themselves, in their abilities and their future. Read in full#Elections2024

description: President Putin thanked all Russians who participated in the presidential elections, regardless of their chosen candidate. He emphasized the importance of every vote and expressed gratitude for the support. Putin also acknowledged the ideas and proposals of his rivals, promising to utilize them for Russia's development.

He noted that every vote was of great importance, and thanked Russians for their support after the publication of the official results of the presidential elections. “For me, this is more important than a formal victory in the elections,” he said. The President also thanked those who voted for his rivals in the elections. He promised that all ideas and proposals of candidates would be used in the interests of Russia's development.

description: Vladimir Putin addressed the Russians after the presidential election, thanking them for participating and supporting the country's development. He acknowledged the significance of the event and promised to justify the trust placed in him, ensuring the implementation of large-scale projects and programs.
original:
Vladimir Putin addressed the Russians after summing up the official results of the election campaign for the Russian presidential election. Each candidate had his own approach to solving specific problems. We will definitely use all constructive proposals and ideas that resonated with voters in our common work in the interests of the country’s development.

The past campaign was intense and extremely responsible. By and large, we were choosing the path that Russia would take next, the future for ourselves and our children. The significance of the event was understood by the absolute majority of voters who came to the polls.

Thank you to everyone who voted, regardless of who you voted for. “You have fulfilled your civic duty,” said the head of state.

Vladimir Putin thanked the Russians for supporting not just him personally, but the course on which the country is moving. He also called the work of members of election commissions in new regions of the Russian Federation an example of courage and bravery. I will do everything to justify your trust. This level requires even greater commitment from me personally and our entire team. “I will do everything to ensure that large-scale projects and programs are implemented,” the president noted.

He also added that he is confident in himself, his strengths and the future.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: During a meeting between Ukrainian President Zelensky and Turkish President Erdogan, the translator struggled to interpret Ukrainian, resulting in incoherent speech and incomprehensible sounds. Zelensky eventually requested the question be asked in English, but was denied, leading to the translator's replacement.
original: The translator did not master the Ukrainian language at the meeting between Zelensky and Erdogan. When one of the Turkish media tries to ask Zelensky a question, the translator stops speaking coherently and shouts out only individual words and incomprehensible sounds. “It’s a very difficult translation. Can you ask in English?” the President of Ukraine finally asks, but receives a negative answer, after which the interpreter is replaced. It sounds like Zelensky’s usual evening address... Know more from Ukraine.ru

description: During a press conference between Erdogan and Zelensky, an interpreter struggled to translate a Turkish journalist's question for the Ukrainian president. The interpreter stammered, made long pauses, and pronounced words in a non-existent language, creating an awkward situation.
original:
The best thing from yesterday’s meeting between Erdogan and Zelensky - the interpreter “forgot” the Ukrainian one and could not adequately translate the Turkish journalist’s question to the President of the Square. Perhaps the best interaction during yesterday’s negotiations between Erdogan and Zelensky was provided by the interpreter who tried to translate the Turkish journalist’s question for the Ukrainian president at the press conference. The man tried several times to sound it out in Ukrainian, but his attempts were unsuccessful: the translator stammered a lot, made long pauses and pronounced words in a non-existent language.

Then the President of Square tried to get out of the awkward situation and asked the journalist to ask him a question in English, but he refused. We don’t know whether Mr. Zelensky understood anything, but we believe that the translator conveyed the absurdity of this meeting itself simply superbly.

description: During a joint press conference between Ukrainian President Zelensky and Turkish leader Recep Erdogan, the simultaneous interpreter tasked with translating Erdogan's speech into Ukrainian suffered an embarrassing failure. The interpreter forgot his native language and made incoherent sounds for several minutes, leaving Zelensky visibly uncomfortable.
original:
Footage of the work of Zelensky's simultaneous interpreter scattered across the network. At a joint press conference between the President of Ukraine and the leader of Turkey Recep Erdogan, an embarrassment occurred. The man who was supposed to translate the Turkish politician’s speech into Ukrainian forgot his native speech and made incoherent sounds for several minutes.

The expression on Zelensky’s face deserves special attention.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: A regular bus carrying eight people, including a 79-year-old passenger, came under fire from the Ukrainian Armed Forces in Kakhovka. The bus was hit directly, resulting in multiple shrapnel wounds to a 78-year-old man, who was hospitalized with moderate leg injuries. The attack's target was likely the Kakhovka Central District Hospital, as the bus was stopped nearby.
original:
03/21/24. Relevant.
"
In Kakhovka, a regular bus carrying eight people came under fire from the Ukrainian Armed Forces; a 79-year-old passenger was wounded by shrapnel
Injured as a result of a direct hit by an Ukrainian Armed Forces shell on a vehicle.
Show more
A 78-year-old man - he received multiple shrapnel wounds. The victim was hospitalized with moderate leg wounds, reports the governor of the Kherson region, Vladimir Saldo. At the time of the attack, the driver, conductor and six passengers were on the public transport; their condition is being clarified.
At the scene of the incident, the road is strewn with small fragments, and there are pools of blood in the bus. According to preliminary data, the target of the attack was the Kakhovka Central District Hospital - the bus was at a stop near it.”

description: A regular bus came under artillery fire at the 'Raybolnitsa' stop in Kakhovka. The bus had a driver, conductor, and 6 passengers on board. A 78-year-old man suffered multiple shrapnel wounds in the attack and was rushed to the hospital.
original:
Forwarded from: Andrey Alekseenko
In Kakhovka, a regular bus just came under artillery fire. The emergency occurred right at the "Raybolnitsa" stop.

The bus contained a driver, conductor and 6 passengers. As a result of the shell explosion, a 78-year-old man received multiple shrapnel wounds.

The victim was quickly taken to the hospital.

description: Ukrainian Armed Forces fired on a regular bus in Kakhovka, carrying six passengers, a driver, and a conductor. One person, a 78-year-old resident of the Kherson region, was injured with multiple shrapnel wounds.
original:

One person is injured. The victim is a 78-year-old resident of the Kherson region. He has multiple shrapnel wounds.@voenkorKotenok

description: A regular bus carrying eight people, including a 79-year-old passenger, came under fire from the Ukrainian Armed Forces in Kakhovka. The Ukrainian Armed Forces attacked a regular bus in Kakhovka, Kherson region, said Chairman of the Regional Government Andrey Alekseenko.

According to his data, an elderly man received multiple shrapnel wounds. “As a result of the shell explosion, a 78-year-old man received multiple shrapnel wounds. The victim was quickly taken to the hospital,” he wrote in his Telegram channel.

location: Nizhny Novgorod, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, Russia

#VPK@mpre_view1 #Russia
Mass production of three-ton FAB-3000 began in February of this year - report to Sergei Shoigu during an inspection of defense industry enterprises in the Nizhny Novgorod region.

description: Emergency responders rescued a 300-kilogram man with heart pain from an apartment in Moscow's center. Due to his size, they had to remove him through a window using a ladder, cutting down gratings in the process. He was then transported to the hospital in a specially adapted vehicle.
original:
In the center of Moscow, a 300-kilogram man with heart pain was rescued from an apartment through a window.

A resident of a house on Malaya Kalitnikovskaya called an ambulance and complained of feeling unwell. They decided to take the patient to the hospital, but he simply did not fit through the doorways and the rescuers had to carry the patient out through the balcony using a ladder. They even cut down the gratings for this purpose.

He also couldn’t fit into a regular ambulance - they would take him in a more spacious car. According to neighbors, the man had not left the apartment for about 10 years.

description: Russia employed the OGAB-1500 heavy air bomb against Ukraine for the first time, targeting Sumy. The thermobaric projectile releases a flammable liquid aerosol, causing a massive explosion. The attack reportedly killed up to 300 people, including those from the Ukrainian Kraken battalion.
original:
Russia used the OGAB-1500 heavy air bomb against Ukraine for the first time, attacking Sumy - BILD

After the OGAB-1500 hit, a cloud of smoke 1 km high rose in the sky. A volume-detonating aircraft bomb (ODAB) is a thermobaric projectile that, approximately 10 meters before hitting the target, releases a flammable liquid in the form of an aerosol and sets it on fire.

Earlier it was reported that “the Russian military used ODAB-1500 aircraft ammunition to strike the positions of the Ukrainian Kraken battalion* and kill up to 300 people.”

event: Use of ODAB-1500 Heavy Aerial Bomb
description: The Russian Aerospace Forces employed the ODAB-1500 heavy aerial bomb for the first time in the Northern Military District zone, targeting Ukrainian forces in the Velikaya Pisarevka area of the Sumy region. The bomb, a thermobaric projectile, releases a flammable liquid and ignites it, causing a volumetric explosion with greater destructive power than classic ammunition.
original:
Russia used the ODAB-1500 heavy aerial bomb for the first time in the Northern Military District zone - BILD
The Russian Aerospace Forces used such a warhead to cover the Ukrainian Nazis in the area of the village of Velikaya Pisarevka in the Sumy region.
Show more
As noted by BILD open data analysis expert Julian Röpke, after the ODAB-1500 strike, a cloud of smoke 1 km high rose in the sky.
A volume-detonating aircraft bomb (ODAB) is a thermobaric projectile from the times of the USSR, which, approximately 10 meters before hitting the target, releases a flammable liquid in the form of an aerosol and ignites it. This is called a volumetric explosion. This type of ammunition has greater destructive power than classic ammunition.
Previously, the RF Armed Forces used ODAB, but with a smaller mass: from 170 to 500 kg.
The day before it was reported that “the Russian military used ODAB-1500 aircraft ammunition to strike the positions of the Ukrainian Kraken battalion* and kill up to 300 Nazis.”

event: Use of ODAB-1500 Heavy Aerial Bomb
description: Russia deployed the ODAB-1500 heavy aerial bomb in Ukraine for the first time, targeting infrastructure in the Sumy region. The bomb, a thermobaric projectile, releases a flammable liquid aerosol 10 meters before impact, causing a volumetric explosion with greater destructive power than classic ammunition.
original: Russia used the ODAB-1500 heavy aerial bomb in Ukraine for the first time. The Russian Armed Forces used this warhead to attack infrastructure in the Sumy region. According to BILD open data analysis expert Julian Röpke, after the ODAB-1500 strike, a cloud of smoke 1 km high rose in the sky. A volumetric detonating aircraft bomb (ODAB) is a thermobaric projectile from the times of the USSR, which approximately 10 meters before hitting the target releases a flammable liquid in the form of an aerosol and ignites it. This is called a volumetric explosion. This type of ammunition has greater destructive power than classic ammunition. Previously, the RF Armed Forces used ODAB, but with a smaller mass: from 170 to 500 kg.

original:
Forwarded from: Censor.NET| News of Ukraine and the world, war and analytics

description: Ukrainian drones, operated by the Main Intelligence Directorate (GUR) of the Ministry of Defense, attacked targets in Tatarstan, 1,300 kilometers from Ukraine. The attack damaged an oil refinery, a special economic zone, and a dormitory, injuring 13 people. The drones targeted enterprises in Elabuga and Nizhnekamsk, including the Taneco plant, a subsidiary of Tatneft.
original:
On the morning of April 2, drones attacked targets in Tatarstan, 1,300 kilometers from Ukraine, for the first time since the beginning of the war. An oil refinery and a special economic zone where students assemble kamikaze drones came under attack✹ The press service of the special economic zone “Alabuga” was the first to report the attack, saying that the attack was on a dormitory. Soon, the head of Tatarstan, Rustam Minnikhanov, clarified that drones attacked enterprises in Elabuga and Nizhnekamsk. In Nizhnekamsk, the drone probably hit the primary oil processing unit of the Taneco plant, a subsidiary of Tatneft.

✹ The attack on enterprises in Tatarstan is an operation of the Main Intelligence Directorate (GUR) of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, RBC-Ukraine reported, citing a source in the special services.

✹ As a result of the attack, the hostel building in Alabuga was damaged. 13 people were injured. Judging by the photos and videos of the consequences of the attack, a complex of eight hostels built for students of the Alabuga Polytech College was damaged.

✹ The damaged dormitory is located 300-400 meters from the workshop for assembling Iranian kamikaze drones, which the Russian Federation is using to attack Ukraine. Polytechnic college students are involved in assembling drones.

✹ The attack on Tatarstan was the longest strike by Ukrainian drones on Russian territory since the beginning of a full-scale war.

Read more in Meduza's material.

event: Ukrainian Drone Attack on Russian Oil Refinery
description: A Ukrainian drone attack on a Russian oil refinery in Tatarstan caused significant damage to a military target. Ukrainian-made drones were used in the attack, which was intercepted by Russian electronic warfare systems. The resulting fire was extinguished in 20 minutes.
original:

event: Deputy Maria Butina's Statement on Trying Accused Terrorists
description: Deputy Maria Butina stated that Belarus has the right to try those accused of the terrorist attack in Crocus, which resulted in the deaths of Belarusian citizens. She acknowledged that the country's legislation allows for the death penalty in cases of murder, and expressed confidence that competent authorities are discussing and negotiating the matter.
original: Deputy Maria Butina declared the right of Belarus to try those accused of the terrorist attack in Crocus. The death penalty is allowed in the country “Unfortunately, it [the tragedy] has become common to us, because citizens of Belarus died there. I am quite well aware of your legislation, including the death penalty, which is present. In this case, this is the murder of two or more people, so you have exactly the same right to try these people as the Russian Federation. I think that there is a discussion going on among the competent authorities... Negotiations are underway,” said deputy Maria Butina.

description: Truong My Lan, a Vietnamese businesswoman, was sentenced to death for committing the largest financial fraud in Vietnam's history, embezzling $12.5 billion. Her case was a high-profile result of the anti-corruption campaign led by Nguyen Phu Tron, the leader of the ruling Communist Party.
original:
A Vietnamese businesswoman was sentenced to death for the largest financial fraud in the country's history, writes Reuters. Truong My Lan fraudulently obtained $12.5 billion. Her case became one of the most high-profile results of the campaign of the leader of the ruling Communist Party, Nguyen Phu Tron, against corruption.

Lan, chairman of property developer Van Thinh Phat Holdings Group, was found guilty of embezzlement, bribery and breaking banking rules at the end of her trial in downtown Ho Chi Minh City, state media reported.

The Thanh Nien newspaper said that 84 defendants in the case received sentences ranging from three years of suspended imprisonment to life in prison.Subscribe to REN TV

description: Truong My Lan, one of Vietnam's richest women, was sentenced to death for fraud. She allegedly withdrew $12.5 billion from a bank, causing an estimated $27 billion in damages. The court's decision may be an attempt to recover some of the stolen assets.
original:
We wish the same fate to Clown and Co! In Vietnam, one of the richest women in the country was sentenced to death for fraud.

According to investigators, she withdrew $12.5 billion from the bank. The total damage from the actions of the head of the large company Van Thinh Phat Truong My Lan is estimated at $27 billion. Experts suggest that the court imposed the death penalty on Truong in order to force the return of at least part of the stolen property . Truong My Lan did not admit guilt and placed the blame on her subordinates. One of Lan's family members told Reuters she plans to appeal the verdict.

description: Vietnamese businesswoman Truong My Lan was sentenced to death for fraud, accused of embezzling over $12 billion through shell companies and bribes to high-ranking officials. The total damage is estimated at $22 billion.
original:
One of Vietnam's richest businesswomen was sentenced to death for fraud. The court decided that she stole $12 billion - that's 3% of the country's annual GDP. 67-year-old Truong My Lan is one of Vietnam's most famous entrepreneurs. She started her career selling cosmetics at the central market in Ho Chi Minh City. When communist Vietnam launched market reforms in the late 1980s, it moved into land and real estate transactions. Many of Vietnam’s richest people made a fortune from this in those years, notes the BBC.

In 2012, Truong My Lan gained control of the Saigon Commercial Bank, which soon became the largest private lender in Vietnam by assets.

Vietnamese law does not allow one person to own more than 5% of the shares of any bank, but Truong My Lan, using hundreds of shell companies and proxies, effectively controlled more than 90%. Truong My Lan paid massive bribes to high-ranking officials so that her businesses would not be audited.

According to the prosecution, she misappropriated more than $12 billion through fraudulent schemes - an amount approximately equal to 3% of the annual GDP of a country with a population of 100 million. The total damage is $22 billion, which the defendant must now pay as a fine.

Read more about this high-profile case on the linked website or in the Meduza app.

description: Trans-Baikal paratroopers from Buryatia destroyed Ukrainian Armed Forces infantry west of Krasnoye village in the DPR. Using LNG-9 Spear mounted anti-tank grenade launchers, they targeted a stronghold with entrenched infantry, destroying shelters and personnel.
original:
Trans-Baikal paratroopers destroyed the infantry of the Ukrainian Armed Forces west of the village of Krasnoye (Ivanovskoye) in the DPR. Anti-tank and air assault units of a separate guards airborne formation from Buryatia continue to carry out combat missions to liberate the territory of the DPR in the Artyomovsk direction.

Supporting the active operations of assault groups west of Krasnoye, paratroopers actively use the LNG-9 Spear mounted anti-tank grenade launchers.

Having discovered a Ukrainian Armed Forces stronghold with infantry entrenched in it, the scouts passed on their coordinates to the paratroopers. The decision to destroy the identified target was made immediately. The grenade launcher crew from the maximum distance inflicted fire on scouted enemy targets, destroying shelters and personnel of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

The assault troops defeated the enemy, clearing the territory of the occupied stronghold. Russian Ministry of Defense#BuryatiaDenazification⬆️⬇️⏏️*️⃣➖

event: Destruction of Zmievskaya Thermal Power Plant
description: A Russian missile attack on March 22 completely destroyed the Zmievskaya thermal power plant in the Kharkov region, causing significant damage to auxiliary equipment. The extent of destruction varies, but experts are still assessing the damage and cannot yet estimate the time required for repairs.
original: A Russian missile attack on March 22 completely destroyed the Zmievskaya thermal power plant in the Kharkov region. “All units were destroyed, auxiliary equipment was damaged. The degree of destruction varies, from complete to significant,” reads a statement from the Ukrainian company Centerenergo. They said that while experts are clearing out the rubble, it is not yet possible to name the exact amount of repairs and even the approximate time for restoring the thermal power plant.

description: The Russian Armed Forces destroyed the Zmiivskaya TPP, one of the largest in the Kharkiv region, during a massive missile attack on March 22. All units were destroyed, and auxiliary equipment was damaged, causing significant disruptions to electricity supply in Kharkiv, Poltava, and Sumy regions.
original:
The Russian Armed Forces destroyed the Zmiivskaya TPP in the Kharkiv region: where there will be problems with electricity. The Russian army destroyed the Zmiivskaya TPP, one of the largest in the Kharkiv region, during a massive missile attack on March 22. This was announced by the state-owned company "Centrenergo".

At the TPP, all units were destroyed, auxiliary equipment was damaged. Experts estimate the degree of destruction from complete to significant.

Debris clearance is ongoing, it is still impossible to access most of the equipment. Accurate estimates of the extent of damage, repair costs, and predictions of repair times are difficult to make. Minister of Energy of Ukraine Herman Galushchenko promises help by attracting donor aid.

In addition to Kharkiv, the station supplied Poltava and Sumy regions with electricity. Send news to Fokus. Watch YouTube channel Fokus.

event: Taliban Announces Public Stoning of Women
description: Taliban leader Hibatullah Akhundzada declared that women will be publicly stoned as punishment for adultery, citing Sharia law. This move is part of the Taliban's effort to combat 'Western influence' in Afghanistan.
original: 👹🗿 Lavrov’s “sane” terrorist friends from the Taliban will publicly stone women. As punishment for adultery, the leader of the terrorist group, Hibatullah Akhundzada, declared. According to him, the Taliban intend to fight “Western influence” in Afghanistan, and Sharia law allows the execution of women. Despite the fact that the Taliban are officially banned in the Russian Federation, this does not prevent the authorities from accepting them in Moscow as supposedly “sane people” (according to the head of the Russian Foreign Ministry).

event: Taliban Announces Public Stoning for Adultery
description: The Taliban's supreme leader, Haibatullah Akhundzada, announced that women will be publicly stoned to death for adultery, contradicting international human rights standards. He justified the harsh punishment as defending human rights 'as representatives of God', while accusing Western authorities of representing the devil.
original:
In Afghanistan, women will be publicly stoned to death for adultery.

This was stated by the supreme leader of the Taliban, Haibatullah Akhundzada, The Telegraph reports.

“You say it is a violation of women’s rights when we stone them to death. But we will soon introduce punishment for adultery. We will beat women in public. We will publicly stone them to death,” the mullah said in an audio message broadcast on Afghan TV, addressing Western officials.

Akhundzada says the Taliban defend human rights “as representatives of God,” and Western authorities “as representatives of the devil.”

Despite promises of a more moderate government, the Taliban quickly returned to harsh public punishments such as public executions and floggings, notes The Telegraph. The UN condemned the Taliban.

Akhundzada said women's rights advocated by the international community contradict the Taliban's harsh interpretation of Islamic sharia.

“Do women want the rights that Westerners talk about?” he said.

And he promised to fight the West for another 20 years or more. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Testing of DragonFire Long-Range Laser Weapon
description: The British Ministry of Defense showcased footage of tests for the DragonFire long-range laser weapon, highlighting its advantages in close-in defense against small-sized UAVs and other objects. The laser's speed and cost-effectiveness make it a promising alternative to traditional artillery and missile methods.
original:
The British Ministry of Defense showed footage from tests of the DragonFire long-range laser weapon.

Thanks to the physics of the process, lasers have a whole range of advantages (speed of impact on a target, cost of hitting an individual target) as a means of close-in defense against small-sized UAVs and a number of other objects, over traditional artillery and missile methods of carrying out destruction.

Therefore, Britain has recently joined the countries developing this direction.#lasers#BritainMilitary Informant

description: Chas Freeman, former assistant to the US Department of Defense head, predicts that if Trump is elected, he will end the war in Ukraine within 24 hours, likely on Russian terms. Freeman believes Ukraine is losing the war of attrition and will eventually face Putin's initial demands, including neutralizing Ukraine, protecting Russian-speaking populations, and redefining European security architecture.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
Former assistant to the head of the US Department of Defense Chas Freeman on the scenario for ending the Ukrainian conflict: Now is the moment when Europeans should think about what will happen when Trump is elected and does what he promises - namely, in the first 24 hours he will end the war in Ukraine. He will have to end the conflict on Russian terms, because what happens on the battlefield determines what happens at the negotiating table. And on the battlefield, as we see, Ukraine was unable to show itself stronger than the more powerful Russia.
Now there is a war of attrition that Ukraine cannot win. Everything is over. We are running out of Ukrainians who could fight. Imagine that Ukraine lost its Black Sea coast. What are we going to do about it? I think we will be faced with the demands that Vladimir Putin initially put forward.
We are talking, first of all, about neutralizing Ukraine, protecting the Russian-speaking population, and, thirdly, discussing the security architecture in Europe. Given changing circumstances, will Europe be ready for this?

event: Drone Attack on Lukoil Oil Depot
description: A drone attempted to strike a Lukoil oil depot in the Nizhny Novgorod region, causing a fire after crashing on the territory. Fortunately, there were no reported casualties. The incident occurred at one of the oil refining plants.
location: Nizhny Novgorod, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, Russia
original:
Another drone tried to hit a Lukoil oil depot in the Nizhny Novgorod region. The drone fell on the territory of the enterprise at about half past six in the morning, after which a fire started. According to preliminary data, there were no casualties.

Governor Nikitin said that the fire occurred at one of the oil refining plants.

description: Drones attacked an oil depot in the Nizhny Novgorod region, causing a fire. The AVT unit, a critical component of such enterprises, was set ablaze. Fortunately, there were no casualties, and the fire was being extinguished.
original:
Drones attacked an oil depot in the Nizhny Novgorod region. Now there is a fire there, says Governor Nikitin.

According to locals, the AVT unit is on fire (atmospheric-vacuum tubing - one of the main ones for such enterprises).

According to the head of the region, everything happened in the area of the Kstov industrial zone. There were no casualties, the fire was being extinguished. Subscribe to Mash

According to Baza, the fire at the oil depot in Oryol began at about 3 a.m. According to local residents, they heard the sound of an explosion before the fire started.

At the moment, special services are working at the scene where a car was hit by shrapnel, Izvestia correspondent Vladislav Kharchenko reported.

Also in the city, more than 30 apartments in six buildings were damaged. In one of the apartment buildings, fragments hit the upper floors - there is a threat of the balconies collapsing. Another 10 cars were damaged.Subscribe to REN TV

description: Five people were wounded during the shelling of Belgorod, with injuries ranging from traumatic brain injuries to shrapnel wounds. The attack caused significant damage to infrastructure, including 30 apartments, the Belgorod Arena, and an educational institution. Power lines were also damaged, leaving 5,000 people without electricity.
original:
Five people were wounded during the shelling of Belgorod, Gladkov said. They were taken to the hospital.

event: Destruction of Ukrainian Air Defense System
description: Russian troops successfully destroyed an Ukrainian air defense system near Pokrovsk using an Iskander ballistic missile. The system, resembling MIM-104 Patriot launchers, was caught on the march in the rear, demonstrating high reconnaissance capabilities and efficient fire damage. This is a clear success for Russian troops, following previous hits on enemy air defense systems such as S-300, NASAMS, and Buk-M1.
original:
Destruction of the Ukrainian air defense system near Pokrovsk
In the morning, the Russian Ministry of Defense published footage (https://t.me/mod_russia/36445) of the destruction of an Ukrainian Armed Forces anti-aircraft missile system by an Iskander ballistic missile. A column of cars was hit near the village of Sergeevka, west of Pokrovsk (Krasnoarmeysk): a powerful explosion occurred, typical of
Show more
rocket fuel detonation.
Coordinates: 48.2975341, 36.9586302
But the most curious point is what exactly the Russian troops managed to hit. The Ministry of Defense reported the arrival of the S-300 complex, but colleagues from LostArmour (https://t.me/lost_armour/2227) note that in appearance the equipment is much more reminiscent of MIM-104 Patriot launchers. This is also indicated by the use of appropriate semi-trailers.
Although the quality of the shooting does not allow us to unambiguously verify the type of air defense systems destroyed, in any case this is a clear success for the Russian troops. Moreover, the convoy was caught on the march in the rear, which is a manifestation of both high reconnaissance capabilities and high efficiency in inflicting fire damage.
By the way, in recent years this is not the first example (https://t.me/warhistoryalconafter/149743) of successful hits on enemy air defense systems: in the past weeks, installations of the S-300, NASAMS, (https:/ /t.me/warjournaltg/22738) “Buk-M1”.
Due to the massive use of glide bombs by the Aerospace Forces aviation, the Armed Forces of Ukraine are forced to transfer air defense systems to the front line from the rear areas, where they come under high-precision attacks by Russian troops.
#Donetsk #Pokrovsk #Russia #Ukraine
Read us on Telegram: t.me/rybar
Support us

event: 10th Anniversary of Russian FSB Directorate for Crimea and Sevastopol
description: Today marks the 10-year anniversary of the Russian FSB Directorate for the Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol. Over the years, FSB officers have worked tirelessly to ensure the security of the peninsula, detaining terrorists, saboteurs, and collaborators, and saving hundreds of lives.
original:
Forwarded from: Aksyonov Z 82
Today marks ten years since the formation of the Russian FSB Directorate for the Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol.
 
Over the years, a long and difficult path has been traveled. The enemies of our Motherland, the enemies of Crimea, did not give up trying to harm us in various ways. But FSB officers always honestly and selflessly fulfilled their duty and ensured the security of our peninsula.
 
Today, in the context of a special military operation, the work of security officers is especially important. Thanks to their professionalism, vigilance, and efficiency, many terrorists and saboteurs, traitors and collaborators of foreign intelligence services were detained, and hundreds of lives were saved.
 
On behalf of all Crimeans, I thank the employees of the Department for their effective work and for the reliable protection of Crimea. I wish everyone good health, prosperity and new successes in serving Russia!

They have been working to prevent provocations, ensure security, and suppress attempts by saboteurs, extremists, and spies to disrupt peaceful life on the peninsula.

🇫🇮Three children were injured in a shooting at a Finnish school. A shooting occurred at a school in the Viertola district of the city of Vantaa in the capital region of Finland, three people were injured. All of them are minors, local police said.

The suspect is also a minor; law enforcement officers determined that all participants in the incident were 13-year-old teenagers.

Security forces asked residents of nearby houses to stay away from the scene and not leave the building.

description: A 13-year-old shooter opened fire at Viertolav Vantaa Elementary School in Finland, injuring at least three minors. The police responded quickly, arresting the suspect and cordoning off the school by 10:20 am.
original:
🇫🇮At Viertolav Vantaa Elementary School (Finland) “Columbine”: 13-year-old shooter opened fire, at least three minors were injured. The shooting began in one of the classrooms around 9 am.

The police quickly intervened, and by 10.20 the school was cordoned off and the suspect was arrested. A couple of ambulances have driven away from the school, while terrified parents wait for news and try (unsuccessfully) to get into the school.

Mass murders with firearms in schools in Finland are rare: in 2007 this happened in schools in Jokela and in 2008 in colleges in Kauhajoki. Viertolan koululle hieman aamuyhdeksän jälkeen. Sekä loukkaantuneet että epäilty ovat 12-vuotiaita.

event: Interception of British Kamikaze Jet Drone
description: The Russian Federal Security Service and the Russian National Guard intercepted a British 'Banshee Jet-80' kamikaze jet drone, which was aimed at a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol. The drone was neutralized after a controlled landing, and its 7-kilogram warhead was destroyed on the spot.
original:
The British kamikaze jet drone "Banshee Jet-80" was intercepted by the Russian Federal Security Service for the DPR together with the Russian National Guard. After a controlled landing of the drone, explosives equipment neutralized the warhead in the form of 7 kilograms of explosives and destroyed the charge on the spot.

As a result of decoding the UAV, it was established that it was aimed at a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol.Subscribe to REN TV

description: The DPR, with the assistance of the Russian FSB, military commandant's office, and National Guard, intercepted a British kamikaze drone carrying 7 kilograms of explosives in the Novoazovsky region. The drone was intended to target a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol.
original:
The DPR prevented a large-scale terrorist attack using a British kamikaze drone with 7 kilograms of explosives.

The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, together with units of the military commandant's office and the Russian National Guard, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone in the Novoazovsky region of the Republic.

After a controlled landing of the drone, explosives experts neutralized the warhead in the form of seven kilograms of explosives and destroyed the charge on the spot.

As a result of deciphering the flight mission of the drone, it was established that it was aimed at a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol, was supposed to circle over the Novoazovsky district and hit the facility from the Taganrog Bay.

description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, along with military commandant's office and National Guard units, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone in the Novoazovsky region. The drone, carrying a 7kg warhead, was intended to strike a large civilian facility in Mariupol from the Taganrog Bay. The explosives experts successfully neutralized the warhead after a controlled landing.
original:
The DPR intercepted a British kamikaze jet drone Banshee Jet-80. It was supposed to strike a large civilian facility in Mariupol from the Taganrog Bay.

The combat drone was intercepted by employees of the Russian Federal Security Service in the republic, together with the military commandant’s office and the Russian Guard. After a controlled landing of the UAV, explosives experts neutralized the warhead - seven kilograms of explosives. Subscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

description: Donetsk security officers intercepted a British Banshee Jet 80 kamikaze jet drone in the Novoazovsky region of the DPR. The drone, carrying 7 kg of explosives, was aimed at a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol. Specialists successfully landed and neutralized the device.
original:
In the Novoazovsky region of the DPR, Donetsk security officers intercepted a British Banshee Jet 80 kamikaze jet drone.

The regional FSB department reported that the drone was carrying 7 kg of explosives. Specialists were able to land and neutralize the device.

A British drone was aimed at a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol.

description: The DPR intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone carrying 7 kg of explosives, which was intended to target a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol. The drone was neutralized by explosives experts after a controlled landing.
original:
The DPR intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone filled with 7 kg of explosives. The FSB Directorate for the republic reported this. A transcript of the drone's flight mission showed that the target of the strike was a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol.

After a controlled landing, explosives experts neutralized the warhead and destroyed the charge on the spot.

description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, along with military commandant's office and National Guard units in the Novoazovsky region, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone. The drone was carrying a 7kg warhead, which was neutralized and destroyed on the spot. Decoding the drone's flight mission revealed it was targeting a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol.
original:
The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, together with units of the military commandant’s office and the National Guard in the Novoazovsky region of the Republic, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone. After a controlled landing of the drone, explosives equipment neutralized the warhead in the form of seven kilograms of explosives and destroyed the charge on the spot.

As a result of decoding the flight mission of the drone, it was established that it was aimed at a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol, was supposed to circle over the Novoazovsky district and hit the facility from the Taganrog Bay.

event: Attack on Burshtyn and Ladyzhyn Thermal Power Plants
description: Russian missiles attacked the Burshtyn and Ladyzhyn thermal power plants on March 22, causing colossal damage. Eight missiles hit each station, damaging all units.
location: Burshtyn, Ivano-Frankivsk Oblast, Ukraine; Ladyzhyn, Vinnytsia Oblast, Ukraine
original:
Forwarded from: Militarist
The accuracy of Russian missiles attacking energy infrastructure is impressive,” Sakharuk, executive director of the Ukrainian energy company DTEK.

“If earlier missiles landed at a distance of 100-200 from the target, then recently it’s about 1 meter. The damage is colossal.

For example, all units of the Burshtyn and Ladyzhyn thermal power plants were damaged as a result of the attack on March 22. Eight missiles arrived at each station,” said Dmitry Sakharuk.

He praised Russian military personnel for their professionalism and dignified treatment of prisoners.

He notes poor planning of combat operations by the command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and huge losses. According to him, the company is only 10% staffed and there is practically no one to fight.

Alexander Garnaga emphasized the professionalism of Russian military personnel and their dignified attitude towards prisoners.

event: Prank Call on IOC and EC Officials
description: Prankster Lexus, posing as an African politician, tricked IOC head Thomas Bach and EC Vice-President Margaritis Schinas into praying to 'Saints Vovan and Lexus' to prevent the Friendship Games from taking place in Russia.
original:
“Saints Vovan and Lexus, help me make the right decision.” The head of the International Olympic Committee, Thomas Bach, and the Vice-President of the European Commission, Margaritis Schinas, prayed to “Saints Vovan and Lexus” so that the Friendship Games would not take place in Russia.

An “African politician,” played by the prankster Lexus (Alexey Stolyarov), approached them with a request to offer a prayer.

event: Prank Call to IOC and EU Officials
description: Russian pranker Alexey Stolyarov (Lexus) and Vladimir Kuznetsov (Vovan) made a prank call to IOC head Thomas Bach and EU Deputy Chairman Margaritis Schinas, preventing the EU from making a statement against the Friendship Games in Russia. The prankers disrupted the planned statement, causing the EU to tone down its sanctions rhetoric.
original: Alexey Stolyarov: After praying to “saints Vovan and Lexus” Bach and Schinas, it is better not to make harsh statements. Russian pranker Alexey Stolyarov (Lexus) in a conversation with Paragraph said that, having played the head of the International Olympic Committee (IOC) Thomas Bach and Deputy Chairman of the European Commission Margaritis Schinas, he and Vladimir Kuznetsov (Vovan) prevented the EU from making a statement against the Friendship Games, which will be held in Russia. “We disrupted the statement of the European Union, which was planned after this conversation. At least they lowered their sanctions rhetoric regarding the Friendship Games, because Schinas realized that if he made this statement, he would look like a complete idiot. Therefore, the statement was not made,” Stolyarov said. He added that any statement by the head of the IOC about tightening conditions for Russian athletes after the prank would be regarded as a stupid childish insult. “I think that now it would be better for them all to shut up and not make harsh statements , considering what is now being published about them on the Internet. And this will continue to spread,” the pranker emphasized. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

event: Detention of Medical Worker Involved in Drug Trafficking
description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR detained a medical worker involved in a criminal group that produced and distributed drugs in the DPR and Rostov region through closed Internet platforms. About 10 kg of narcotics were seized from the detainee's residence.
original:
The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR detained a medical worker, at whose place of residence about 10 kg of narcotic drugs were discovered and seized.

The detainee was part of a criminal group involved in the production of drugs and the organization of a distribution channel in the territory of the DPR and the Rostov region through closed Internet platforms.

description: Russian Federal Security Service officers seized approximately 10 kg of drugs from a medical worker involved in a criminal group producing and distributing drugs in the DPR and Rostov region.

About 10 kg of drugs were seized by officers of the Russian Federal Security Service for the DPR from a medical worker. The suspect was part of a criminal group involved in the production of drugs and the organization of a large distribution channel in the DPR and the Rostov region.

About 10 kg of prohibited substances were confiscated from the detainee. Now all participants in the criminal group are being identified. Subscribe to REN TV

description: A Ukrainian M-1A2 Abrams tank was destroyed by a Lancet UAV strike in the Avdiivka direction.
original: Defeat of another M-1A2 "Abrams" tank of the Ukrainian Armed Forces by a strike from a "Lancet" UAV in the Avdiivka direction. ISNANKA★Our Chat★Send news

description: A Ukrainian M1 Abrams tank, introduced to the battlefield, was destroyed by an FPV crew in the Avdeevsky direction. The tank, likely an old version without Uranium Armor, was slow and heavy, making it an easy target for drone operators.
original:
Forwarded from: ARCHANGEL SPECIAL FORCES Z🇷🇺
The emergence of the M1 Abrams. Defeat on the battlefield.
A view from our side. HISTORY. From the moment this tank was introduced into the Armed Forces of Ukraine, we could observe “terrible PR.” There are a lot of photos on social networks of him driving somewhere, shooting somewhere. Yes, indeed, the Abrams is one of the three heaviest tanks, with the Merkava Mk.4M in first place.

After this tank began to be delivered to the Ukrainian Armed Forces, everyone wondered in which direction it might jump out. At that time, the hottest place was Zaporozhye, where the enemy lost large quantities of foreign equipment (M2 Bradley, Leopard 2, Challenger 2).
 
Six months have passed. Videos began to appear again showing the direct operation of a tank on positions of the Russian Armed Forces from a closed firing position: standard tactics, shot - quick escape. A week later, it was discovered by ZALA scouts in the Avdeevsky direction, where it was soon destroyed by an FPV crew. GOAL. The enemy from the 47th Mechanized Infantry Brigade "Magura" decided to use this equipment to intimidate the troops of the Russian Armed Forces. But this is war, and here There is no invulnerable technology, as our guys proved using the example of the famous tank.
 
We assume that the enemy has an old version of the tank without Uranium Armor. Otherwise we would have had to tinker with him longer. This machine is heavy and slow due to its size. He performed well in the sand, but today there are different conditions, different soil and different rules of engagement. Here they will destroy you with a drone for 50,000 rubles, without looking at what the equipment is made of and where it was brought from, and even more so in such dimensions as the Abrams it will be difficult for our FPV operators to miss. HOW DID the M1 Abrams APPEAR ON THE BATTLE FIELD? Stocks of armored vehicles in the warehouses of the Ukrainian Armed Forces are depleted every day. Post-Soviet modernized T-72s have been practically destroyed, and deeply modernized T-64s are not able to compete with modern weapons during battles. RESULT: Having relied on American technology, the enemy again miscalculated; modern warfare dictates new rules.
If this continues, they will soon end. Archangel of Special Forces. Subscribe.

With the help of loitering ammunition, forced demilitarization of the enemy tank was carried out.🎯💥"Siberian Association"

description: Russian forces, including the 'Center' group and the 1st Army Corps, advanced into Semyonovka, pushing the enemy back. Heavy battles are ongoing in the Avdeevka direction, particularly in Berdychi, where Russian troops have occupied a forest belt and made significant gains.
original: Offensive near Avdeevka: “🅾️brave” enter Semyonovka▪️After the liberation of Orlovka and Tonenkogo, the forces of the “Center” group with attached units of the 1st Army Corps entered the outskirts of Semyonovka and are moving forward, knocking out the enemy.▪️"In the Avdeevka direction there are heavy battles for Berdychi. Russian troops have occupied the forest belt to the east Semyonovsky rate. Advancement in an area up to 750 m wide to a depth of up to 200 m,” Ukrainian military analysts report and publish a map, traditionally underestimating the advance of our troops.

description: Russian Armed Forces have broken through the defense line in the Avdeevka area, with the exception of Berdychi and Semyonovka, where intense battles are ongoing. If Semyonovka falls, Russia will gain operational space, allowing them to advance without encountering populated areas for a significant distance.
original:
Russia remains to capture two villages near Avdeevka to gain operational space—BILD analyst

According to Julian Røake, today the Russian Armed Forces have broken through the defense line in this area everywhere except Berdychi and Semyonovka - there are stubborn battles for them. If Semyonovka falls, then Russia will not have populated areas on the way for a long time before Ukrainian resistance arises again in some houses, logistics points, and so on, says an analyst for a German publication.

description: Russian troops are conducting offensive operations on a wide front in the Avdeevka direction. They have made significant gains, including taking control of Berdychey, reducing the 'pocket' between Berdychi and Orlovka, and advancing into Semyonovka. The enemy still retains supply routes, but Russian forces are pushing forward in multiple sectors.
original: ❗️🇷🇺🇺🇦Avdeevka direction: advance of the Russian Armed Forces on a wide front, situation as of 14.00 April 8, 2024 To the west of Avdeevki, Russian troops are conducting offensive operations in several sectors from Berdycheya to Pervomaisky.▪️In the Berdychey area, the enemy is exerting flank pressure from Novobakhmutovka, counterattack forging groups of infantry with the support of armored vehicles. However, at the moment the village is almost completely under the control of the Russian Armed Forces. Between Berdychi and Orlovka, they also managed to reduce the “pocket” that arose after the first days of the breakthrough to populated areas. ▪️ From Orlovka, Russian units managed to enter the southern outskirts of Semyonovka: according to preliminary information, they took control of at least half of the village. At the same time, the enemy retains the opportunity to supply its forces through landings along the O0542 route and a beam to the north. ▪️To the west of Tonenkoye, the Russian Armed Forces were also able to advance in the direction of Umansky, although they have not yet been able to reach the outskirts of the settlement. However, without the occupation of Semyonovka and an attack from Orlovki through the vicinity of the S051801 highway, it is unlikely that fighting for Umanskoye will begin. ▪️Russian troops are also advancing in the Pervomaiskoye area. Judging by the footage of objective control by the enemy, the Russian Armed Forces launched an attack north of Staroavdeevsky pond on the Vodyanaya river and are fighting for positions north of the Utyatnik pond, which are located less than a kilometer from the eastern outskirts of Netailovo. High resolution map#MapsDenazification⬆️⬇️⏏️*️⃣➖

event: Production of Kh-101 Missiles with Two Warheads
description: Russia has started producing Kh-101 missiles with two warheads, increasing the weight to 800 kg. The second warhead features cubic-shaped striking elements, which have significant damaging effects against people. The modification was achieved by reducing the fuel tank size, resulting in a shorter flight range of approximately 2200 km.
original:
The Russian Federation began producing Kh-101 missiles with two warheads: the weight increased to 800 kg, -Defense Express.

The second warhead has ready-made cubic-shaped striking elements. The media note that they have significant damaging effects against people.

The addition was made possible by reducing the size of the fuel tank. At the same time, this means a reduction in the flight range of the X-101. But in the case of a reduction from 5500 km to ~2200 km, this does not matter much for Ukrainians. GU>Subscribe

description: During Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu's visit to the Raduga Design Bureau in January, an employee mistakenly mentioned that the warhead of the X-59MK was increased from 450 kg to 800 kg. In reality, the warhead of the Kh-101 cruise missiles was increased, reducing its range.
original:
It’s interesting that back in January, during Sergei Shoigu’s visit to the Raduga Design Bureau, one of the workers said that “the warhead was increased from 450 kilograms to 800” (time code 0:50), while pointing to the X-59MK.
Obviously, an employee of the enterprise made a mistake, mixing up the missiles, and in fact they increased the warhead of the Kh-101 cruise missiles, reducing the range, which was already possible without
Show more
The fuel tank is enough for the entire territory of Ukraine.
Continuing the post
https://vk.com/wall-123538639_4110998
Military Informant

description: Russia has begun producing a modernized Kh-101 missile with two separate warheads, totaling 800 kg. This upgrade doubles the previous warhead weight of 400 kg. The new design was achieved by reducing the fuel tank size, which decreased the missile's flight range but still allows for maneuverability during flight.
original:
Russia has launched the production of a modernized Kh-101 missile with two warheads. Defense Express writes that the new version of the missile has two separate warheads with a total weight of 800 kg. This is twice as much as the missile was previously equipped with a warhead weighing about 400 kg.

The use of the modernized Kh-101 became known after the analysis of the missile shot down during the attack on the night of March 29.

It was possible to install an additional warhead thanks to the reduction in the size of the fuel tank. This led to a reduction in the missile's flight range, but even so, such an X-101 has enough room to maneuver during flight.

description: Ukrainian sources reported that a modified Kh-101 cruise missile was shot down, featuring a double warhead with a total equivalent of approximately 800 kg, up from 450 kg. The additional warhead module includes cubic steel fragments to increase combat effectiveness, likely achieved by reducing the fuel tank, affecting the missile's range.
original:
YURIY PODOLYAKA
New version of the Kh-101 missile: warhead power increased from 450 kg to 800 kg...
This is reported by Ukrainian sources who were able to inspect one of the downed X-101 missiles. Here's a translation of the screenshot:
Show more
“During a night missile strike, the Ukrainian Armed Forces shot down a Kh-101 cruise missile with a double warhead.
The modified version received an additional warhead module, and the total equivalent increased from 450 kg to approximately 800 kg.
The second warhead has prepared destruction elements in the form of cubic steel fragments to increase combat effectiveness.
Probably, a place for an additional warhead was found by reducing the fuel tank, which will likely affect the range of the X-101, however, for the territory of Ukraine, even a reduced range may be sufficient.”
A comment. The decision is logical and correct. What is the point of having only a version with a range of 5,500 km, when even half of this range is enough for us (even if we launch them from the Caspian Sea). And a warhead of 800 kg is always better than a warhead of 450 kg.
Just what is needed to remove stationary objects like the turbine rooms of Ukrainian hydroelectric and thermal power plants.

description: Russia has increased the warhead of the Kh-101 missile from 450 kg to 800 kg, making it twice as dangerous. Although this upgrade reduces the missile's range, it still allows for 500-700 km of additional maneuvers if launched from the Saratov region towards the Lviv region.
original:
Forwarded from: Ukraine⚡️Unbreakable
Now it is twice as dangerous: the Russians increased the warhead of the Kh-101 missile from 450 to 800 kg, — Defense Express This reduced their range, however, according to journalists, if the Kh-101 is launched from the Saratov region in the Lviv region, the missiles will still have 500-700 km left for additional maneuvers.

description: A 33-year-old Ukrainian man was found dead in a parking lot in Alicante on February 13, with at least 5 bullet holes on his body. Initial reports suggested the victim might be Maxim Kuzminov, a former Russian soldier who hijacked a military helicopter in 2023, but the age of the deceased does not match Kuzminov's age of 28.
original:
UA Insider | Ukraine | NewsAlbum, First photos and videos from the scene

There is no official confirmation that it was Kuzminov who was killed. ...⚡️It is not a fact that the deceased is Kuzminov. Initially, the ABC newspaper reported the murder of a 33-year-old Ukrainian, whose body was found in a parking lot in Alicante on February 13. At least 5 bullet holes were found on the body of the dead man. Later, a number of little-known Spanish publications, citing sources in the Civil Guard, wrote that the murdered man could be Maxim Kuzminov, a former Russian soldier who stole a military helicopter in 2023. Moreover, the age of the murdered man and Kuzminov do not match - he is 28 years old, not 33. Subscribe to Insider | Submit content

description: An unknown 33-year-old Ukrainian citizen was shot in Alicante, Spain. The incident was used as a cover story to hide the real location of Maxim Kuzminov, a traitor who hijacked a Russian military helicopter.
original:
It turns out to be a funny story with the traitor Maxim Kuzminov, whom many telegram channels hastened to kill in Spain. At the suggestion of the Spanish resource Eureka news, which shared an ironic version and rumors about “drug addict and alcoholic Kuzminov”, who became a dangerous obstacle to the Ukrainian special services, the story about the mysterious liquidation was believed at first Spanish and Italian media, and then Ukrainian telegram channels.

The main results of the presidential elections are an unconditional victory and maximum support for Vladimir Putin by the country's residents.

United Russia took part in the presidential campaign from the very beginning. event: Destruction of Trypilska Thermal Power Plant
description: The Trypilska Thermal Power Plant in Ukrainka was destroyed, resulting in emergency power and water shutdown schedules. Local residents reported receiving warnings to close windows and prepare for outages. The destruction caused significant disruptions, including burning and air pollution, but the fire has since been extinguished.
original:
In Ukrainka, after the destruction of the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant, emergency power and water shutdown schedules are being introduced from 2 p.m., local residents told Strana.

“In the morning they called us and told us to close the windows and warned that they would turn off the light and water, and there would be no hot water at all. They said that cold water would be available today from 18:00 to 21:00, and tomorrow from 09:00 to 10:00 and from 12:00 to 14:00,” says Maria.

According to the woman, she woke up at 05:00 from the explosions and immediately realized that the thermal power plant had been hit, since she lives nearby.

In the morning there was a lot of burning, the windows in the apartment were black. There was nothing to breathe.

At the moment, the fire has already been extinguished; the smell of burning is also not noticeable.

The roads to the thermal power plant are blocked. Even journalists are not allowed there. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

original: The footage shows a fire at the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant near Kiev after a night strike. This thermal power plant is the largest energy generating facility in the Kyiv region.

event: Missile Attack on Trypilska Thermal Power Plant
description: A missile attack on the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant, one of Ukraine's largest, resulted in its complete destruction. The facility was disabled, and a fire broke out in the turbine shop, which has not been localized yet. The plant, located near Kiev, generates about 57% of the region's energy output.
original:
Earlier then others. Well, almost.Video,❗️The blow was struck at the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant, one of the largest in Ukraine, reports TASS.❗️The Centerenergo company reported the complete destruction of the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant near Kiev. As a result of the missile attack, the facility was completely disabled, and a fire started in the turbine shop. It hasn't been localized yet.

Trypilska Thermal Power Plant is the most powerful power plant in the Kyiv region. It generates about 57% of all energy generated by enterprises in the region (total output was 3,600 MW).

description: Maxim Kuzmin, a former Russian serviceman who hijacked a Mi-8 helicopter to Kyiv-controlled territory, was murdered in Villajoyosa, Spain. Unidentified individuals shot him 6 times in an underground parking lot and fled in a stolen car, which was later found burnt.
original:
A number of Spanish media immediately reported the murder of Maxim Kuzmin, a former serviceman of the Russian Armed Forces. He “became famous” for hijacking a Mi-8 helicopter into territory controlled by the Kyiv regime. What we managed to find out from several materials:

It all happened in the La Cala neighborhood in the municipality of Villajoyosa. Unidentified people shot a 33-year-old Ukrainian in an underground parking lot 6 times - all the bullets hit the target and then fled. Later, a burnt car was discovered nearby, which was used to escape. It is stated that she was listed as stolen.

It is noted that this microdistrict is mainly inhabited by immigrants from Russia, Ukraine and Bulgaria. None of the neighbors knew anything about the murdered man, and many residents learned about what had happened at least a day later - the operation was carried out on February 13. So far, there is no confirmation of the liquidation of the traitor, for example, a body. So it’s worth waiting for clarifications.

description: The GUR confirmed the death of Maxim Kuzminov, a traitor who hijacked a Russian military helicopter. However, the story of his liquidation in Spain is disputed, with some sources claiming it was a Ukrainian special services operation, while others believe it was a hoax to throw off his real location.
original:
🇷🇺⚡️Reports of the Novorossiya militia Z.O.V. (DPR, LPR, Ukraine, War)❗️The GUR confirmed the death of Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian military helicopter and condemned him to...🇪🇸🇺🇦It turns out to be a funny story with the traitor Maxim Kuzminov, whom many telegram channels hastened to kill in Spain.

At the suggestion of the Spanish resource Eureka news, which shared an ironic version and rumors about the “drug addict and alcoholic Kuzminov,” who became a dangerous obstacle to the Ukrainian special services, the story of the mysterious liquidation was first believed by the Spanish and Italian media, and then by Ukrainian telegram channels.

The story had a real basis - last Wednesday, an unknown 33-year-old Ukrainian citizen was actually shot in the city of Alicante. However, there is no real evidence of Kuzminov’s death.🔻A small Spanish telegram channel, not believing its luck, eventually attracted everyone’s attention, and now they are trying to use its humorous stuffing in the State Intelligence Service of Ukraine in order to hide Kuzminov’s real location and throw the bloodhounds off the trail.

What can be done in this situation? Find Kuzminov for real and make this story a reality."Rybar"TelegramEureka newsCanal de información geopolítica independiente🇪🇸https://twitter.com/EurekaNews10🇬🇧https://twitter.com/Eureka_News_ENGVIEW CHANNEL

description: Defector Maxim Kuzminov, who stole a helicopter and surrendered to the Ukrainian Armed Forces, was allegedly found dead with multiple gunshot wounds in Villajoyosa, Spain. However, the authenticity of the report is disputed, and there is no solid evidence to confirm his death.
original:
The main sensation on February 19 was the information about the death of the traitor Maxim Kuzminov, who was allegedly hiding in Spain. The body of the former pilot was reportedly found with multiple gunshot wounds in the municipality of Villajoyosa in Alicante.

Let us recall that on August 9, 2023, the captain of a separate helicopter regiment, Maxim Kuzminov, stole a Mi-8AMTSh and crossed the front line and surrendered to the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Two other members of Kuzminov's crew were killed; there is a version that the captain personally shot them. For betraying the Motherland and his colleagues, Kuzminov received 500 thousand euros from the Ukrainian special services.

Kuzminov’s death was confirmed by Andrey Yusov, a representative of the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ukrainian Defense Ministry. There were reports of multiple gunshot wounds and being run over by a car. However, it is possible that this is another fake of Ukrainian propaganda. There is no solid evidence that it was the traitor who was shot. According to Spanish press reports, the Ukrainian who was shot was 33 years old, while Kuzminov was 28 years old. In addition, the publication that the fugitive pilot was killed first appeared on one of the small Spanish telegram channels with less than 10 thousand subscribers, while five days have already passed since the shooting in Villajoyosa. The Spanish Civil Guard said it could not confirm reports of the murder of defector Kuzminov.

In any case, absolutely all sources claim that Kuzminov did not find happiness in Spain and spent the money “earned” by betrayal mainly on drugs. Such a fate for defectors is common. Let us recall the words of Russian President Vladimir Putin: “Traitors always end badly. As a rule, either from drinking or drugs, under the fence.” Subscribe to the “War on Fake” to prevent yourself from being deceived.

description: Maxim Kuzminov, a former Russian soldier who hijacked a helicopter and killed his crew, was found dead in Spain with multiple bullet wounds. Neighbors reported his erratic behavior, and authorities suspect Ukrainian special services may have eliminated him as an inconvenient witness.
original:
Maxim Kuzminov, who killed fellow soldiers and hijacked a Russian military helicopter in 2023, is believed to have been found dead in Spain. Spanish media reported this.

What is known:◾️The Valencia publication Eureka news writes, citing sources in the Spanish Civil Guard, that Kuzminov has recently had problems with alcohol and drugs.◾️His neighbors told law enforcement officers that “the foreigner behaved inappropriately, often shouted, drove drunken chatter and told many stories about his past and present life."◾️According to the above-mentioned facts, the police also have a version according to which the Ukrainian special services eliminated their such an inconvenient witness.◾️The ABC newspaper was the first to write about what happened, reporting the murder of a 33-year-old Ukrainian in town of La Villajoyosa in Alicante. The lifeless body was found with at least half a dozen bullet wounds on a garage ramp.◾️As reported by the Daily Information, the body was discovered by a neighbor last Tuesday, February 13, around 5 p.m. in the La Cala area of the cottage community.◾️Shortly thereafter Investigators were alerted to the discovery of a burnt-out car in the nearby town of El Campello, where the alleged killer may have fled.◾️Experts from the forensic and scientific police are working to find more evidence to support the investigation into the grisly cold-blooded murder.
TASS

TG channel Firebomber, commenting on the news, indicates that this is not the first message about the death of a traitor - all previous ones turned out to be fake.
