event: Russian Troops Using Mannequins as Decoys
description: Russian troops have been using mannequins and dummies as decoys in combat operations, likely to deceive and confuse their opponents in the Alyoshka area. This tactic aims to waste enemy ammunition, slow down targeting, and mislead reconnaissance resources.
original:
Misleading the enemy Today, footage of Russian troops using mannequins and other dummies began to appear on the Internet. Ukrainian military correspondents and armchair experts actively began to discuss what was happening in different directions of combat operations, declaring problems and a lack of military personnel among the “orks.”
However, a more or less adequate part of the Western audience of the Ukrainian segment of social networks shared their thoughts on this matter: The use of mannequins as bait in military operations is a tactic that has been used throughout human history. It is likely that the Russians are using them to deceive and confuse their opponents in the Alyoshka area. This is not necessarily stupid. It encourages you to waste ammunition and slows down targeting. We believe that these methods could and should have been used a long time ago, since equipping false positions always reduces the risk of an enemy strike and misleads the enemy, loading his reconnaissance resources with useless work.ANTISEPTIC

event: Meeting with Deputy Prime Minister Marat Khusnullin
description: Deputy Prime Minister Marat Khusnullin met with officials to discuss housing and communal services, as well as road construction in the region. They outlined plans to modernize facilities, update infrastructure, and improve public transport in the Donetsk People's Republic.
original:
There are always many questions to discuss with Deputy Prime Minister Marat Khusnullin. This time, special attention was paid to housing and communal services and roads in the region.

We will modernize housing and communal services facilities under various state programs, including through special treasury loans this year we will update 10 boiler houses and replace 73 boilers; We will carry out a major overhaul of 77.5 km of main water pipelines, and will also carry out work on the development of heat supply and water supply schemes for the Republic.

In addition, issues of road construction in the region were discussed. In 2024, we plan to restore about 1,000 km of public roads and city road networks.

To improve the operation of public transport in the Donetsk People's Republic, state support programs are also being implemented. This year, the fleet of municipal transport enterprises in the region will be replenished with about 80 buses of various comfort classes.@PushilinDenisTelegramMarat KhusnullinAfter the board, at a meeting with the Head of the Donetsk People's Republic Denis Pushilin, they discussed the implementation of the assigned tasks under the socio-economic program...VIEW MESSAGE

event: Crash of American MQ9 Reaper Drone
description: A US MQ9 Reaper drone, taking off from a Romanian military base and intended to land in Poland, lost contact and crashed in a designated area in north-west Poland. The cause of the accident remains unknown.
original:
Polish General Ireniusz Nowak said that the country's air force had a "nervous, sleepless night" amid the crash of an American MQ9 Reaper drone.

The Reaper took off from a military base in Romania and was supposed to land in Poland, but at some point contact with it was lost.

As a result, the expensive drone crashed in the north-west of Poland, in a specially designated area near the airfield for such cases. The drone was found 9 minutes after it fell. What caused the accident is still unknown.

description: An American MQ-9 Reaper unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) crash-landed in northwestern Poland after losing contact with its base during a scheduled training exercise at Miroslawiec airfield.
original: An American MQ-9 Reaper UAV crash-landed in northwestern Poland, the general command of the country's Armed Forces said. Previously, he was performing scheduled training at an airfield in the Polish city of Miroslawiec and lost contact with the base.

description: A US Air Force MQ-9 Reaper drone, on a quarterly training flight from its base in Romania, lost contact and crashed after experiencing malfunctions. Polish military failed to regain control, and the incident is under investigation by the Americans.
original:
Forwarded from: Belorussian Front
The Polish air force took off its boots and gave an official comment to the crashed MQ-9 Reaper. According to DGRSZ Air Force inspector Ireniusz Nowak, the US Air Force UAV was performing a quarterly “training” flight when it lost contact with its base in Romania. It is worth noting that the Polish talking heads with nights they said that this scout was from 12 Baza Bezzałogowych Statków Powietrznych (12BBSP, Mirosławiec, JW4338), we wrote about the opposite. Nowak also said that after reports of malfunctions on board, the military from Minsk-Mazowieckie failed to take the drone under control. After this, the reconnaissance aircraft crashed. There is still no information about the fate of the second MQ-9 with the call sign WILEY33. The investigation into the disaster is being carried out by the Americans. The Polish military is practically not involved in this process.

A representative of the Polish Ministry of Defense denied speculation in the media regarding the involvement of Russian electronic warfare systems in the incident. Subscribe | Send material

event: Crash of Il-76 Russian Aerospace Forces
description: A Russian Aerospace Forces Il-76 military transport plane crashed near Ivanovo after its engine caught fire due to a bird strike. The crew attempted to return to the airfield but realized they wouldn't survive and steered the plane away from residential buildings before crashing near the village of Podtalitsy, 2 km from the airfield.
original:
Forwarded from: Operation Z: Military Correspondents of the Russian Spring
‼️🇷🇺Crash of Il-76 Russian Aerospace Forces near Ivanovo - details▪️The military transport plane took off from the Severny airfield, stayed in the air for several minutes and its engine caught fire.▪️According to preliminary data, this happened due to a bird hitting one from the right engines, media reports.▪️The crew tried to return to the airfield by making a circle.▪️The pilots realized that they would not be able to survive and until the last minute tried to pull the transporter away from residential buildings.▪️As a result, the IL-76 crashed near the village of Podtalitsy, in 2 km from the airfield. Ambulance crews and rescuers are working on the spot.t.me/RVvoenkor

description: An Il-76 plane, carrying 12 people, crashed in the Ivanovo region during a training flight. The engine caught fire during a turn, and the pilot attempted to steer the plane away from residential areas before it crashed into a forest belt near a cemetery.
original:
Forwarded from: Baza
The Il-76 plane that crashed in the Ivanovo region was making a training flight.

According to the Base, he took off from the Severny airfield and stayed in the air for several minutes. During a turn, the plane's engine caught fire.

According to preliminary data, the pilot tried to reach the airfield, but when he realized that he could not do this, he began to steer the plane away from residential areas. After this, the plane crashed into a forest belt near the cemetery.

There were initially 12 people on board.

description: A military transport plane, reportedly an IL-76, crashed in a forest plantation near Severny airfield in Ivanovo, with 12 people on board. Emergency services have responded to the scene to assess the consequences.

⚡️A military transport plane crashed in Ivanovo - 112

Preliminarily, we are talking about the IL-76. It did not reach the strip of the Severny airfield and crashed in a forest plantation. There were 12 people on board.

Emergency services have arrived at the scene and the consequences are being clarified.

description: According to Ukraine's Defense Ministry, Russia has been accumulating Caliber missiles and may use them in the near future. The number of X-101s has decreased significantly, prompting Russia to restore its fleet's missile supply.
original:
Russia has been accumulating “Calibers” and can use them “in the near future.”

This was stated by the head of the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, Kirill Budanov. “In the near future, I think we will see “Calibers” again, because the number of X-101s has decreased significantly... There are regulations, documents, decisions, etc. . The first was to restore the fleet's missile supply, because by that time they had been significantly reduced. They completed this task,” said the head of the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ukrainian Defense Ministry.

description: According to Ukraine's Head of the Main Intelligence Directorate, Budanov, Russia has been accumulating Caliber missiles and is now technically ready to use them. The fleet's stock of missiles was significantly reduced, but they have completed the task of restoring it.
original:
☄️Russia has been accumulating “Calibers” and can use them in the near future, - Head of the Main Intelligence Directorate of Ukraine Budanov

“The number of X-101s has decreased significantly... There are regulations, documents, decisions, etc. The first is to restore the fleet’s stock of missiles, because they were significantly reduced at that time. They completed this task. That is, now they technically ready for their use.

While the fleet was accumulating its missiles, the Aerospace Forces were using the X-101,” said the head of the Main Intelligence Directorate.

Forwarded from: RUSSIAN PATRIOT

description: A system administrator in Moscow killed his drinking buddy in a dispute over Ukraine. The administrator used foam to attack his friend, causing fatal injuries. The suspect was detained and charged with murder.

description: A system administrator brutally murdered a 31-year-old man in a Moscow office over a dispute about the war in Ukraine. The killer inserted a tube of foam into the victim's mouth and anus, causing fatal injuries.
original:
In Moscow, because of a dispute over Ukraine, a system administrator inserted a tube of foam into his opponent’s mouth and anus and killed him by pressing the spray

The brutal murder took place in the office of a small furniture company on Taganskaya Square. Two men got into a fight over a discussion of the war in Ukraine. One of them poured foam into the throat and anus of the 31-year-old victim, inserting a tube into his mouth.

The suspect was detained and a criminal case was opened under the article “Murder”.

description: A rescue operation is underway at the Pioneer mine in the Zeya district, where 13 people are trapped under the rubble. Over 100 people, including specialists from Khabarovsk Territory, Yakutia, and soon Primorye, are involved in the rescue efforts. So far, more than 3,000 kilograms of soil have been removed.
original:
“Work continues at the quarry, about 100 people are involved”: journalist Denis Blashchuk told how the operation to rescue people is going on at the Pioneer mine in the Zeya district. There are 13 people under the rubble.

Specialists from the Khabarovsk Territory and Yakutia have been involved in the rescue work; in the near future they will be joined by rescuers from Primorye.

More than three thousand kilograms of soil were removed. Work continues.Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: A mine collapse at the Pioneer mine in the Zeya district of the Amur region trapped 13 miners under rubble. A state of emergency has been declared, and a team of rescuers from the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations has been dispatched to the site.

13 miners were trapped under rubble due to a collapse at a mine in the Amur region. A state of emergency has been introduced - governor

“A group of rescuers from the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations moved to the site of a rock collapse at the Pioneer mine in the Zeya district. According to preliminary data, 13 people are under the rubble,” the head of the region wrote.

description: Rescuers from the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations are working to rescue trapped miners at the Pioneer mine in the Amur region. The miners are stuck at a depth of 120 meters following a collapse. So far, 3 thousand cubic meters of soil have been removed from the rubble.

description: A collapse occurred at the Pioneer mine in the Amur region, potentially trapping up to 13 people under the rubble. A helicopter with 13 rescuers and necessary equipment was sent to provide assistance. The entrances to the mine are blocked, and search and rescue operations have begun.

description: A team of 25 mine rescuers from Yakutia arrived at a mine in the Amur region to rescue 13 people trapped under rock rubble. Additional rescuers from the Khabarovsk and Primorsky territories are being sent to assist in the operation.

Forwarded from: RIA Novosti

In addition, rescuers from the Khabarovsk and Primorsky territories are being sent to the scene of the emergency.

description: A fire broke out in a private household in the Kalininsky district of Gorlovka, destroying the roof of an outbuilding. Fortunately, there were no casualties. The cause of the fire is under investigation. Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations firefighters responded to the incident, extinguishing the fire with 8 personnel and 2 tankers.

Fortunately, there were no injuries or deaths. The cause of the fire remains to be determined by investigators. The fire was extinguished by 8 firefighters and 2 tankers from the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations.@mchs_dnr

event: France Considering Troop Deployment to Ukraine
description: Chairman of the National Assembly Yael Braun-Pivet stated that France may send troops to Ukraine, echoing President Macron's previous statement that nothing is ruled out. This suggests that France is open to providing military support to Ukraine.
original:
France may send troops to Ukraine, - Chairman of the National Assembly During a briefing in Odessa, the chairman of the lower house of parliament, Yael Braun-Pivet, continued the old Macron propaganda story, reassuring the Ukrainians with the alleged possibility of sending troops:

“In his statement, President Macron said that he does not rule out anything a priori. In the position that France has demonstrated, is demonstrating and will demonstrate until victory, nothing is excluded, everything remains possible. I will not further interpret the president’s words, this position is quite clear,” she emphasized. RVvoenkor

event: French National Assembly Chairman's Statement on Troop Deployment
description: The Chairman of the French National Assembly, Yael Braun-Pivet, reiterated France's stance on potentially sending troops to Ukraine, echoing President Macron's previous statement that nothing is ruled out. She emphasized that France's position remains clear and open to all possibilities until the end of the war.
original: 🇺🇦The Chairman of the French National Assembly did not rule out sending troops to Ukraine. During her visit to Odessa, the Chairman of the French National Assembly, Yael Braun-Pivet, once again updated the position of Macron, who had previously stated that he “does not rule out” sending French troops to Ukraine. “In his statement, the President of the Republic He said that he does not rule out anything a priori. In the position that France demonstrated, is demonstrating and will demonstrate until the end of the war, until victory itself, nothing is exceptional, everything remains possible. I will not further interpret the president’s words, this position is quite clear,” she emphasized.

event: Meeting between S.V. Lavrov and Chairman of the People's Republic of China Jinping
description: Russian Foreign Minister S.V. Lavrov met with Chinese Chairman Jinping in Beijing, conveying greetings from President V.V. Putin. They discussed the continuity of Russian-Chinese relations, mutual support, and cooperation in trade, culture, and foreign policy, aiming to form a more equitable multipolar world order.
original:
🎙Opening remarks by S.V. Lavrov during the meeting with the Chairman of the People's Republic of China Jinping📍Beijing, April 9, 2024💬I would like to thank you for finding the opportunity to receive our delegation. We see this as another confirmation of your great personal attention to the development of interaction with the Russian Federation.

I have the pleasure and honor to convey to you the best greetings from the President of Russia V.V. Putin. He highly appreciated your congratulatory message on the results of the presidential elections in March. <...> The re-election of President V.V. Putin guarantees the continuity of our relations and the focus on their new development in all areas. We note that it is thanks to the diplomacy of the leaders that Russian-Chinese relations demonstrate stability, as well as the ability to adapt to any (even the most difficult) conditions. The basis of Russian-Chinese relations is mutual support on issues affecting the fundamental interests of our states. Trade turnover is breaking new records. The project of the years of culture of Russia and China has started. The foreign policy “bundle” of Moscow and Beijing is the locomotive of efforts that are gaining more and more supporters to form a more equitable multipolar world order and ensure security on the Eurasian continent.

In 1949, the USSR was the first state to recognize the new China. Since then we have become comrades. These three-quarters of a century have shown how important mutual trust, good neighborliness, friendship, equality, and mutually beneficial partnership are for us and the whole world, which, as you and President V.V. Putin emphasized, is superior in effectiveness to the blocs of the Cold War era and is not directed against any third party.🇷🇺🇨🇳I hope that we will adequately celebrate the 75th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations with the PRC. We will be ready to implement new strategic tasks set by our leaders. Read in full#RussiaChina

event: Meeting between Lavrov and Xi Jinping
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov met with Chinese President Xi Jinping, conveying greetings from President Putin and expressing Russia's high assessment of China's successes under Xi's leadership. The two nations reaffirmed their commitment to strategic objectives and peaceful coexistence, prioritizing sustainable development.
original: At the meeting, Sergei Lavrov expressed to Xi Jinping Russia’s highest assessment of China’s successes under his leadership. The main statements during the meeting: Lavrov conveyed greetings from Putin to Xi Jinping, noted that the President of the Russian Federation greatly appreciated the congratulations on the election results; the Russian Federation and China are ready to implement the goals set by the leaders of the countries strategic objectives; Beijing and Moscow have embarked on the path of peaceful coexistence and cooperation in the interests of sustainable development, Xi Jinping noted. event: Terrorist Attack at Crocus City Hall
description: A terrorist attack occurred at Crocus City Hall, resulting in the loss of civilian lives. The Immortal Regiment of Russia honors the memory of the victims and invites everyone to post a crane image as a symbol of remembrance and support for the victims' relatives.
original:
9 days have already passed since the terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall. In memory of all the civilians who died at the hands of terrorists, the Immortal Regiment of Russia invites everyone on this day to post on their page on social networks or use instead of an avatar an image of a crane flying into the sky as a symbol of our memory and our support for the relatives of the victims.

You will forever remain in our hearts.

description: A memorial was held near Crocus City Hall, where figures of cranes made from candles were lit in the evening to honor those killed in a terrorist attack.
original: Figures of cranes made from candles were lit in the evening near the walls of Crocus City Hall in memory of those killed in the terrorist attack.

description: A memorial event, 'Cranes', was held at Crocus City Hall to honor those killed in a terrorist attack. The event featured a symphony orchestra conducted by Valery Gergiev, with photographs and names of the deceased displayed on the wall behind the stage. The ceremony began with a minute of silence.
original:
Forwarded from: Super.ru
In memory of those killed in the terrorist attack, a “Cranes” event was held at Crocus City Hall. A symphony orchestra conducted by Valery Gergiev performed at the walls of the building. Cranes flying up on the wall behind the stage were replaced by photographs and names of the dead. The action began with a minute of silence.

9 days have passed since the tragedy.@superru

event: Russian Soldier Captured and Cared for by Ukrainian Fighter
description: During the liberation of Avdeevka, a Russian soldier was wounded and taken prisoner by a Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter. Despite being an enemy, the Ukrainian fighter showed compassion and cared for the Russian soldier, carrying water to him under fire for three days until medical help arrived.
original:
“Carrying water from a puddle”: a Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter nursed a wounded Russian military man who had taken him prisoner for three days. During the liberation of the city of Avdeevka, an assault group of the Russian Armed Forces occupied the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ position in the kindergarten building and held it for two days.

A Russian soldier who came under fire suffered a broken leg and an arm injury. He also had his eye knocked out by a shrapnel. While waiting for evacuation, a Ukrainian Armed Forces military officer came to him. When asked to give his call sign, he asked not to shoot at him. The unknown person was without weapons or body armor. He immediately surrendered.

The medical team was unable to reach the wounded soldier for three days due to heavy shelling. For all three days, the captured Ukrainian carried him water, which he collected under fire.

Now our fighter is undergoing treatment in the hospital, and the Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter was taken away for interrogation by our military. He is currently in captivity.Soldier of Fortune. Subscribe!

event: Ukrainian Fighter Aids Wounded Russian Soldier

“Carrying water from a puddle”: a Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter nursed a wounded Russian military man who had taken him prisoner for three days. According to the network, during the liberation of the city of Avdeevka, an assault group of the Russian Armed Forces occupied the position of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the building of a kindergarten and held it for two days.

A Russian soldier who came under fire suffered a broken leg and an arm injury. He also had his eye knocked out by a shrapnel. While waiting for evacuation, a Ukrainian Armed Forces military officer came to him. When asked to give his call sign, he asked not to shoot at him. The unknown person was without weapons or body armor. He immediately surrendered.

The medical team was unable to reach the wounded soldier for three days due to heavy shelling. For all three days, the captured Ukrainian carried him water, which he collected under fire.

Now our fighter is undergoing treatment in the hospital, and the Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter was taken away for interrogation by our military. He is currently in captivity. NgP investigation

event: Death of Lieutenant Colonel Dmitro Fischer
description: Lieutenant Colonel Dmitro Fischer, a Ukrainian Luftwaffe pilot and war criminal, was killed on June 5, 2022, near Orekhov, Zaporozhye region. His remains went unidentified for over 1.5 years until his burial in Mirgorod was reported.
original:
The "Ghost of Kuiva" has been found. Or Operation "Liquidation"
Once upon a time, the squadron commander of the 831st Tactical Aviation Brigade, Lieutenant Colonel of the Ukrainian Luftwaffe Dmitro Fischer, having flown an F-16, voiced a message for the modern sect of the American pilot:
Show more
I liked the car. But in terms of characteristics, of course, it is much inferior to the Su-27. Americans call it "Dog fighter" in English. We call it close-maneuverable air combat. But here the Su-27 is king. There's no escape here.
The exemplary flyer was a participant in aerobatic programs and received a prize for “The best display of aerobatics among countries that are not NATO members.” Participant of the so-called ATO, war criminal.
On June 5, 2022, near the city of Orekhov, Zaporozhye region, he turned into a ghost. For more than 1.5 years he remained unidentified. The message about the burial in Mirgorod appeared only yesterday.
Vyacheslav Yakovenko (“Kerch”) (https://t.me/Yakovenko_ZOV)

event: Criminal Case Opened on Financing of Terrorism
description: The Russian Investigative Committee opened a criminal case on the financing of terrorism by officials of the United States and NATO countries, allegedly through Burisma Holdings, an oil and gas company operating in Ukraine, associated with Hunter Biden, son of the American president.
original:
The Investigative Committee opened a criminal case on the financing of terrorism by “officials of the United States and NATO countries.” The Russian Investigative Committee believes that funds received from through the “oil and gas company Burisma Holdings, operating in Ukraine.” The company is associated with the son of the American president, Hunter Biden.

As a result, the Investigative Committee opened a case under Part 4 of Art. 205.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (financing of terrorism).

Earlier, United Russia Andrei Krasov, Communist Party deputy Nikolai Kharitonov and SRZP deputy Yana Lantratova asked the department to investigate “the organization, financing and conduct of terrorist acts by the United States, Ukraine and other Western countries” against the Russian Federation.

event: Criminal Case Opened on Financing of Terrorism
description: A criminal case was initiated following an appeal from State Duma deputies, alleging that senior US and NATO officials financed terrorist activities. The investigation found that funds from Burisma Holdings, a Ukrainian oil and gas company, were used to carry out terrorist acts in Russia and beyond, targeting prominent figures and causing economic damage.
original:
Based on the results of an inspection organized in connection with an appeal from State Duma deputies, a criminal case was opened on the financing of terrorism. The Main Investigation Department of the Investigative Committee of Russia conducted an investigation following an appeal from a group of deputies of the State Duma of the Federal Assembly of the Russian Federation and other persons about the financing of terrorist activities by senior officials of the United States and NATO countries. Based on its results, a criminal case was initiated on the grounds of a crime under Part 4 of Art. 205.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (financing of terrorism).

It has been established that funds received through commercial organizations, in particular, the oil and gas company Burisma Holdings, operating in Ukraine, have been used in recent years to carry out terrorist acts in the Russian Federation, as well as beyond its borders in order to eliminate prominent political and public figures and causing economic damage.

The investigation, in cooperation with other intelligence services and financial intelligence, verifies the sources of income and further movement of funds in the amount of several million US dollars, the involvement of specific individuals from among government officials, public and commercial organizations of Western countries. In addition, the connections of direct perpetrators of terrorist acts with foreign curators, organizers and sponsors. Commentary from the official representative of the Russian Investigative Committee Svetlana PetrenkoSubscribe to Sledkom

event: Criminal Case on Financing of Terrorist Activities
description: The Russian Investigative Committee has opened a criminal case on senior US and NATO officials financing terrorist activities. The investigation found that funds from Burisma Holdings, an oil and gas company operating in Ukraine, were used to carry out terrorist acts in Russia and abroad, targeting prominent figures and causing economic damage.
original:
The Russian Investigative Committee has opened a criminal case on the financing of terrorist activities by senior officials of the United States and NATO countries.

It was established that funds received through commercial organizations, in particular, the oil and gas company Burisma Holdings, operating in Ukraine, have been used in recent years to carry out terrorist acts in Russia, as well as abroad, in order to eliminate prominent political and public figures and causing economic damage.

The investigation, in cooperation with other intelligence services and financial intelligence, is checking the sources of income and further movement of funds in the amount of several million US dollars, the involvement of specific individuals from among government officials, public and commercial organizations in Western countries.

The connections between the direct perpetrators of terrorist attacks and foreign curators, organizers and sponsors are also being worked out.

event: Criminal Case Opened Against Burisma Holdings

Evidence suggests a connection between the corporation and the family of US President Joe Biden, highlighting the concept of 'strategic terrorism' where transnational corporations, governments, and intelligence services collaborate to pursue their interests in foreign territories.
original:
Forwarded from: Andrey Lugovoy. State Duma
The oil and gas company Burisma from Ukraine is involved in terrorist attacks in Russia. The Russian Investigative Committee opened a criminal case on the financing of terrorism through Burisma Holdings. There is evidence confirming the corporation’s connection with the family of US President Joe Biden. The Americans have such a concept - strategic terrorism. They either carry out a military invasion, or use “soft power” to realize their interests on the territory of a foreign country. He spoke live on “60 Minutes” with Olga Skabeeva , what happens when the selfish interests of a transnational corporation, government and intelligence services come together. Burisma is one example of such an explosive mixture. @lugovoyandrey|Discuss in chat

event: Death of Aid Workers in Gaza Strip
description: Seven aid workers, including foreign nationals, were killed when two World Central Kitchen vehicles came under Israeli fire in the central Gaza Strip. The incident has sparked international outrage, with Poland and Cyprus demanding swift and transparent investigations.
original:
Polish Foreign Minister Radek Sikorski said he has demanded that Israel's ambassador to Poland "give an urgent explanation" over the death of a Polish aid worker with the WCK (World Central Kitchen).

Cyprus' Foreign Ministry has called for a "swift and transparent" investigation into the killing of aid workers WCK in the Gaza Strip. The message said that “humanitarian workers must be protected.” The organization's volunteers remain in Larnaca to operate the sea route.

Two World Central Kitchen vehicles came under Israeli fire overnight in the central Gaza Strip.

The incident killed seven WCK aid workers, including several foreign nationals.

The IDF says it is "conducting an in-depth investigation at the highest level to understand the circumstances of this tragic incident."

description: Israel carried out an airstrike on an international humanitarian convoy in Gaza, killing seven foreign volunteers from World Central Kitchen, including citizens of the US, Canada, Australia, Britain, and Poland. The convoy was transporting humanitarian supplies in a 'demilitarized' zone near Deir al-Balyah.
original:
🇮🇱🇵🇸🇵🇱🇬🇧🇦🇺🇺🇸By the way, in addition to the airstrike on Syria, Israel yesterday also carried out an airstrike on an international humanitarian convoy in Gaza.

Seven foreigners, volunteers of the international humanitarian organization World Central Kitchen, were killed. Among those killed were citizens of the United States, Canada, Australia, Britain and Poland. World Central Kitchen is an authoritative humanitarian organization founded by American-Spanish chef José Andrés in 2010 to help the people of Haiti after the earthquake. The organization prepares and distributes food to those in need in disaster and conflict zones.

They worked in Gaza near the town of Deir al-Balyah, in a zone that they claim is “demilitarized.” Recently, they have managed to deliver 600 tons of food to northern Gaza (where the fighting seems to have ended, according to the Israeli side). The organization had a warehouse from which they were transporting humanitarian supplies when they were hit by three airstrikes.

The authorities of Britain, Poland, the USA, Canada and Australia demanded an explanation in connection with the death of their citizens. The Israeli government has already confirmed the information and admitted that they carried out an "unintentional" air strike on the convoy. Netanyahu said that this was a tragic incident, but this happens during war and they will investigate this episode. The food situation in Gaza is difficult. According to the UN, 576,000 Palestinians are at risk of famine. The number will grow, and this could lead to deaths from starvation, which, in turn, will lead to epidemics, waves of refugees and further escalation with further protests in the United States and Europe. Therefore, in recent months, Western countries have been exploring different options for delivering food to the Gaza Strip. https://www.timesofisrael.com/idf-promises-probe-as-slain-aid-workers-home-countries-demand-explanation/#Israel #PalestineThe Times of IsraelIsrael acknowledges killing 7 aid charity workers in 'tragic, unintentional' airstrikeWorld Central Kitchen halts Gaza ops after 'unforgivable' Israeli bombing; victims' countries demand answers; PM says will 'do everything' to prevent ...

❗️Netanyahu admitted that the Israeli military “unintentionally hit innocent people in the Gaza Strip.” The Prime Minister assured that Israel will not allow this to happen in the future.

Earlier it was reported that as a result of an Israeli airstrike in Gaza, seven employees of the humanitarian organization World Central Kitchen, which provides free food, were killed. Among the dead were citizens of Australia, Great Britain, Ireland, Poland and a person with dual citizenship of the USA and Canada. Subscribe to Telegram SOLOVIOV!

description: Ukrainian soldiers liberated Moschun, a small village in the Kyiv region, from Russian invaders two years ago. Heavy battles took place, but Ukrainian forces heroically defended the village, protecting the capital.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
Moschun is a place of great courage, a great feat of our people. Two years ago, Ukrainian soldiers liberated this small village in the Kyiv region from the Russian invaders. Heavy battles took place here, the enemy tried to break through to Kyiv. But our Ukrainians did not allow this to happen, they heroically defended Moschun, thus protecting the capital as well.

Honor to the defenders of Ukraine!
Eternal memory to all those who gave their lives for the sake of our state and independence.

description: Students from the Russian Embassy school in the United States wrote and sent letters to military personnel in the special operation zone, expressing gratitude and wishing them strength, courage, and a swift return home with victory.
original:
Good luck, dear soldier! Students from the school at the Russian Embassy in the United States wrote and sent letters to military personnel performing tasks in the special operation zone. “I wished the soldier to return home as soon as possible. I want to be as brave and brave as him,” said a fifth-grade student Georgy.

And Varvara from the third grade, despite her young age, thinks just like an adult: “I wrote in my letter that they would return home as soon as possible. I wished them strength, courage, courage. We believe that our soldiers will win."

The school students are explained what Russian military personnel are doing in the special operation zone, and the children have the opportunity to convey their words of gratitude in letters, as well as wish our soldiers to return home with victory. Russian Ministry of Defense

description: Students from the Russian Embassy school in the United States wrote letters to Russian military personnel participating in a special military operation, wishing them victory and a safe return home.
original:
Students from the school at the Russian Embassy in the United States sent letters to Russian military personnel who were participating in a special military operation. The schoolchildren wished the Russian soldiers victory and return home. This was reported to the Russian Ministry of Defense.

Video: Russian Ministry of Defense/TASS

description: Artillerymen on the front line received heartwarming letters from students at the Russian Embassy school in the USA. The soldiers were deeply moved by the words of gratitude and warm wishes from the students.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Ministry of Defense
In a word, warming hearts. Military personnel on the front line have varied leisure time. One of the favorite pastimes of the artillerymen who serve in this unit is re-reading letters from caring compatriots. The soldiers say that such words literally bring tears to your eyes.📨This time, words of gratitude and warm wishes to the defenders of the Fatherland were conveyed by students from the school at the Russian Embassy in the USA. Russian Ministry of Defense

description: The New York Times reports that Ukraine faces a critical demographic constraint, with a severe shortage of young men to recruit into the army. The country's birth rate has been declining since the collapse of the Soviet Union, and the current generation of men under 30 is the smallest in Ukraine's modern history.
original:
⚡️New York Times: “Can Ukraine find new soldiers without exterminating an entire generation?” A year ago, such a publication simply could not have appeared in the Western press. It was impossible to even imagine - an article that says that the Reich is coming out on the edge of a demographic abyss.

The New York Times writes that the estimated million men who serve in the Ukrainian army are exhausted and exhausted. Many soldiers have been at the front for two years. Tens [that's right - hundreds] of thousands of people died or were seriously injured. New recruits are desperately needed. But Ukraine faces a critical demographic constraint that has been brewing for a long time: there are very few young men.

Healthy men under 30, the backbone of most armed forces, are part of the smallest generation in Ukraine's modern history. Ukraine can increase its troops only if it emasculates an entire generation - those born in the first decades after the collapse of the Soviet Union as the birth rate fell. In 1991, Ukrainian women had an average of 1.9 children. Ten years later, the birth rate had dropped to 1.1 children.

Zelensky's decision to conscript men starting at age 25 risks further shrinking this small generation of Ukrainians. And many of the limited number of 25- and 26-year-old men—about 467,000, according to government estimates for 2022—are already serving in the military, living in the liberated territories and outside Ukraine. Others have jobs or disabilities that exempt them from military service.

At the same time, the number of births decreased by almost half from 2021 to 2023. Some 800,000 Ukrainian women aged 18 to 34 have fled to EU countries. At the moment, the absence of women plays a larger role in Ukrainian demography than the recruitment of men. But lower conscription ages risk shrinking the small generation even further.

The embodiment of the slogan “until the last Ukrainian” has acquired clear outlines in demographic calculations. Vyacheslav Yakovenko (“Kerch”)

description: The New York Times reports that Ukraine is considering lowering the conscription age for men from 27 to 25 years old, which could further reduce the already scarce generation of men under 30.
original:
The generation of men under 30 is the least numerous for Ukraine in the entire history of independence — it threatens mobilization, writes The New York Times.

The publication notes that lowering the conscription age for men from 27 to 25 years old can further reduce the generation 🔻subscribe

description: The New York Times highlights Ukraine's demographic crisis, where the share of men aged 20-30 is the lowest in the country's history. This 'gap' is precisely the demographic most desirable for the Ukrainian Armed Forces, leading to a threat of an entire generation's disappearance, which would be a demographic catastrophe for Ukraine's future.
original:
The New York Times points out why Kyiv terrorists are leading Ukraine to depopulation. The share of Ukrainian men aged 20 to 30 is the smallest in the country's history. But it is precisely this “gap” that is most desirable for the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

Thus, there is a threat of the disappearance of an entire generation, which will become a demographic catastrophe for Ukraine and its future.

A demography specialist told the NYT that Ukraine has no choice but to destroy its own population through mobilizing Zelensky’s name. In his opinion, young guys should continue to be drafted into the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. You fight, Taras. And your masters in the West will still speculate about why you should die. Know more from Ukraine.ru

location: Kirovsky District, Donetsk, Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine

02.22.24. Relevant.
"
Ukrainian militants launched a massive artillery strike on the Kirovsky district of Donetsk
During the shelling of the Kirov region there was a direct hit in

apartment in a 9-storey building in the Tekstilshchik microdistrict.

description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces fired 39 shells of 155 mm caliber into densely populated areas of Donetsk, targeting three districts: Kirovsky, Petrovsky, and Kuibyshevsky. One of the shells hit a nine-story building in the Tekstilshchik microdistrict, injuring three civilians.
original:
Over the evening, the Ukrainian Armed Forces fired 39 shells into densely populated areas of Donetsk - local residents filmed one of the attacks in the courtyard of a residential building
In the evening, the Ukrainian army shelled three districts of Donetsk at once - Kirovsky, Petrovsky and Kuibyshevsky. In total, during this time the enemy fired 39 shells of 155 mm caliber into the city, reports the JCCC of the DPR.
Show more
Eyewitnesses filmed footage of one of the criminal Ukrainian strikes. They show how a shell explodes in the middle of a residential building.
As a result of the terrorist attack, one of the shells hit a nine-story building in the Tekstilshchik microdistrict in the Kirovsky district of the city - three civilians were injured at once. They are provided with medical assistance.

event: US Republicans Plan to Finance Ukraine with Loans
description: US Republican Senator Lindsey Graham advocates for financing Ukraine's war efforts with borrowed money, citing the need to prioritize American interests. A proposed bill would use loan funds, potentially backed by seized Russian assets, to support Ukraine. This could lead to Ukraine becoming a US colony, with Russia's goal being to reclaim its historical lands.
original:
Forwarded from: Elena Panina
US Republicans are focusing on financing Ukraine... on credit. Influential Republican Senator Lindsey Graham continues to pump up the topic of financing Ukraine - but for borrowed money, calling it “caring for the needs of Americans.”▪️ “No one wants to help Ukraine more than me, but we have to think first of all about America. However, the idea that we will only give without getting anything back must disappear,” Graham emphasized.

He is referring to the bill being prepared by the Speaker of the US House of Representatives, Mike Johnson, and the heads of the relevant security committees. Non-military financing of Ukraine is supposed to be carried out at the expense of loan funds. It is possible that the collateral will be the assets of the Russian Federation seized as a result of sanctions.▪️An ideal scheme for American imperialism. Push your proxy Ukraine into a war with Russia “to the last Ukrainian,” and then also take money from him. Obviously, the Kyiv regime has no free funds. And it will be paid for with land and state property, primarily industrial enterprises, at bargain prices. The transformation into a 100% US colony will accelerate significantly. And here Russia’s task is to wrest these primordially Russian lands from the clutches of America. The time for geopolitical gifts to the West due to our temporary weakness is over.TelegramPool N3Senator Lindsey Graham - that Ukraine should give the US the money it received: Our allies must return the money to us, because we owe more than 34 trillion...0:29VIEW MESSAGE

event: Proposal for Loan-Based Aid to Ukraine
description: US Senator Lindsey Graham suggested providing aid to Ukraine in the form of a loan, citing the country's mineral resources and potential for repayment. This idea was originally proposed by Trump, and Graham believes it could garner significant support in the House of Representatives and Senate.
original:
US Senator Lindsey Graham proposed helping Ukraine not for free, but on credit: The Europeans made 33 of the 50 billion dollars they transfer to Ukraine as a loan. Let's make it a loan. I spoke with Trump this week about turning aid to Ukraine into a loan. It was his idea, not mine.
Remember American Lend-Lease for Great Britain. We are $34 trillion in debt. Ukraine has minerals, they have a lot of resources. Israel has a powerful economy and was seriously damaged by the events of October 7 [2023]. Taiwan is a fairly rich country. Why don't we provide a soft loan to all three of these allies?
Let them pay us back when they can, if they can. Because our debt is $34 trillion. This is Trump's idea. If it is adopted, I think you can get a lot of votes in the House of Representatives and the Senate. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456298513VkVideo by Gorlovka Self-Defensevk video

event: Proposal for Loan-Based Aid to Ukraine
description: US Senator Lindsey Graham proposed providing aid to Ukraine in the form of a loan, rather than a grant, citing the country's mineral resources and potential for repayment. This idea was originally suggested by former President Trump.
original:
US Senator Lindsey Graham proposed helping Ukraine not for free, but on credit: The Europeans made 33 of the 50 billion dollars they transfer to Ukraine as a loan. Let's make it a loan. I spoke with Trump this week about turning aid to Ukraine into a loan. It was his idea, not mine.
Remember the American Lend-Lease for Great Britain. We have a debt of 34 trillion dollars. Ukraine has minerals, they have a lot of resources. Israel has a powerful economy, it was seriously damaged by the events of October 7 [2023]. Taiwan is a pretty rich country. Why don't we give a soft loan to all three of these allies?


Let them pay us back when they can, if they can. Because our debt is $34 trillion. This is Trump's idea. If it passes, I think it could get a lot of votes in the House and Senate.

description: American Senator Lindsey Graham suggested providing aid to Ukraine on credit or in exchange for minerals. This proposal aims to turn the aid package into a loan, leveraging Ukraine's resources to offset the US's $34 trillion debt.
original:
Forwarded from: Kovpak's detachment
🇺🇦🇺🇸American Senator Lindsey Graham proposed transferring aid to Ukraine on credit or in exchange for minerals. I want to turn the aid package into a loan, and this makes sense to me... We have a debt of $34 trillion. Ukraine has minerals, they have a lot of resources.🤦‍♂️The whole world is with us! But not for free!☝️We have no doubt that the Americans can implement this idea, even with a tuft of wool from a black sheep. Well, the current authorities of Ukraine will gladly accept the offer, because very soon the land in which the minerals are located will return home - to Russia, so it is necessary to sell as soon as possible everything that can still be taken out of Ukraine...#evilRussians@otryadkovpakaKovpak's squad in VKOKovpak's squad in OdnoklassnikiKovpaka's squad in TG

description: Air defense crews of the Vostok group of troops in the South Donetsk direction successfully intercepted six HIMARS missiles aimed at peaceful targets in the Donetsk People's Republic. One of the downed rockets failed to detonate and was later destroyed by Russian sappers.

🔎Air defense crews of the Vostok group of troops in the South Donetsk direction shot down six HIMARS missiles in a few days. The strikes were aimed at peaceful targets of the Donetsk People's Republic.

The sappers decided to destroy the dangerous object on the spot, since the crash site was far from peaceful settlements.🔹Russian Ministry of Defense

description: A severe flood in the Orenburg region has caused significant damage, with the water level in the Ural River reaching a record 1095 centimeters. original:
Flood in the Orenburg region. The main thing for the day✹ The water level in the Ural River reached 1095 centimeters - this is the maximum value in the entire history of observations. Orenburg Mayor Sergei Salmin wrote about this in his Telegram channel.

✹ A preliminary assessment of damage from the flood in the Orenburg region is 40 billion rubles: this amount was announced by the head of the region Denis Pasler to Vladimir Putin.

✹ In Orsk, according to local authorities, the situation is stabilizing. Over the course of a day, the water level in the city dropped by 28 centimeters to 832 centimeters.

✹ In the Orenburg region, 14 people are in hospitals due to the consequences of the flood, four of them are children. This was reported by Assistant to the Head of the Ministry of Health Alexey Kuznetsov. In total, 259 people sought medical help, he said.

✹ “Important stories” connected the general contractor of the broken dam in Orsk with local authorities.

Video shows flooding in Orenburg. Footage from the telegram channel.

description: The water level in Orenburg has exceeded the critical level, reaching 942 centimeters, causing flooding in low-lying areas. The head of the city, Sergei Salmin, is keeping the situation under control - he toured the flooded areas, and his deputy is also on duty. It is reported that while there are no requests for evacuation from residents, emergency services are on standby.

All developments along the Urals and Sakmara fall into the flooding zone in Orenburg - these are the Forshtadt districts, the villages of Kuznechny, Sitsovka, Pristantsionny, Zarechny, Podmayachny, Solnechny, Ovchinny town and the village named after Kuibyshev, the Grand Park residential complex. event: ABBA Members Receive Order of Vasa
description: King Carl XVI Gustaf of Sweden has awarded the members of ABBA - Benny Andersson, Anni-Frida Reus (Lingstad), Björn Ulvaeus and Agnetha Fältskog - with the Order of Vasa for their outstanding services in Swedish and international musical life.
original:
King Carl XVI Gustaf of Sweden has decided to award the members of the legendary group ABBA - Benny Andersson, Anni-Frida Reus (Lingstad), Björn Ulvaeus and Agnetha Fältskog - with the Order of Vasa, the government chancellery reports. According to it, the proposal was prepared by the Order Council at the Order Chancellery His Majesty, after which it was supported by the Cabinet of Ministers. The Order of Vasa is one of four orders of chivalry (also the Order of the Sword, the Order of the Northern Star and the Order of the Seraphim), which are awarded for outstanding deeds, exploits and manifestations of qualities, such as courage in saving a human life, for a scientific feat or contribution of great importance to the country.

Royal Orders of Knighthood are being awarded to Swedes for the first time in almost 50 years, the press release explains. The musicians were awarded them "for outstanding services in Swedish and international musical life"

event: Awarding of Royal Orders of Knighthood to ABBA

The King of Sweden, Carl XVI Gustaf, decided to award the members of the ABBA group with a knightly order. The musicians were awarded for outstanding services in Swedish and international musical life.

description: The Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region is conducting centralized registration of civilian weapons in accordance with Federal Law No. 207-FZ. Citizens are urged to apply to the nearest offices with required documents, including a Russian passport, weapons or seizure documents, and Ukrainian permission to store and carry weapons. Registration will grant the right to store weapons until January 1, 2026.
original:
Currently, the licensing and permitting departments of the Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region are working on centralized registration of civilian weapons in the Zaporozhye region in accordance with the Federal Law of the Russian Federation of June 13, 2023 No. 207-FZ. Due to the limited time for registration civilian weapons (until June 13, 2024), representatives of the department remind of the need for citizens to timely apply to the nearest offices of the licensing and permitting work of the Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region, with an application to register their weapons.

When submitting an application, citizens who own weapons must have the following documents: Passport of a citizen of the Russian Federation; Weapons, if available, or documents confirming their seizure; Permission to store and carry weapons issued by the internal affairs bodies of Ukraine. If the above documents are not available, contact the reception office at place of registration to clarify information; Employees of the licensing and permitting authorities of the Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region, after carrying out the procedures provided for by the legislation of the Russian Federation, will register the weapon, after which they will issue a confirming document that gives the right to store the weapon until January 1, 2026, for return previously seized weapons, it is necessary for all citizens who have not yet applied to the Licensing and Permitting Department to register weapons, collect the above documents and urgently provide them!👉Subscribe to Berdyansk. RelevantAlways relevant news!

description: The Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region is requiring citizens to register their civilian weapons by June 13, 2024. Failure to do so will result in confiscation. Citizens must apply to the nearby offices with necessary documents, including a Russian passport, permit to store and carry weapons, and the weapon itself or documents confirming its seizure.
original:
The Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region notifies of the need to register civilian weapons. The deadline for registering weapons is June 13, 2024.
 
Citizens must promptly apply to the nearby offices of the Office of the National Guard in the Zaporozhye region with an application to register their weapons. When submitting an application, you must have the following documents: 🔹passport of a citizen of the Russian Federation; 🔹permit to store and carry weapons; 🔹weapons (if available) or documents confirming its seizure.
 
After completing legal procedures, employees of the licensing and permitting authorities of the Office of the National Guard of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region will register the weapon and issue a document giving the right to storage.
 
Applications are accepted on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays. Make an appointment by phone:
+7 (990) 235-22-92.
 
Weapons not registered before June 13, 2024 are subject to confiscation in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation.

description: The Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region is conducting centralized registration of civilian weapons in accordance with Federal Law No. 207-FZ. Citizens are urged to apply to the nearest offices with required documents, including a Russian passport, weapons or seizure documents, and Ukrainian permission to store and carry weapons. Registration will grant the right to store weapons until January 1, 2026.
original:
Currently, the licensing and permitting departments of the Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region are working on centralized registration of civilian weapons in the Zaporozhye region in accordance with the Federal Law of the Russian Federation of June 13, 2023 No. 207-FZ. Due to the limited time for registration civilian weapons (until June 13, 2024), representatives of the department remind of the need for citizens to timely apply to the nearest offices of the licensing and permitting work of the Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region, with an application to register their weapons.

When submitting an application, citizens who own weapons must have the following documents: Passport of a citizen of the Russian Federation; Weapons, if available, or documents confirming their seizure; Permission to store and carry weapons issued by the internal affairs bodies of Ukraine. If the above documents are not available, contact the reception office at place of registration to clarify information; Employees of the licensing and permitting authorities of the Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region, after carrying out the procedures provided for by the legislation of the Russian Federation, will register the weapon, after which they will issue a confirming document that gives the right to store the weapon until January 1, 2026, for return previously seized weapons, it is necessary for all citizens who have not yet applied to the Licensing and Permitting Department to register weapons, collect the above documents and urgently provide them!👉Subscribe to Berdyansk. RelevantAlways relevant news!

description: British intelligence revealed the aftermath of the latest strikes on Sevastopol, targeting the Black Sea Fleet's communications center. The attack caused structural damage to one building, including a partial roof collapse, and damaged two other buildings. Additionally, Russian Navy reconnaissance and amphibious ships were also damaged.
original:
🇬🇧British intelligence showed the consequences of the latest strikes on Sevastopol. One of the targets was the communications center of the Black Sea Fleet in Sevastopol. Analysis of the images showed that one building was structurally damaged, including a partial roof collapse, and two other buildings were damaged by the blast.

Reconnaissance and amphibious ships of the Russian Navy were also damaged

description: Satellite images revealed damage to a Ropukha-class landing ship and a Yuri Ivanov-class reconnaissance ship following an attack on Sevastopol on March 24. The attack also caused partial collapse of the roof of the Russian Black Sea Fleet's center building.
original:
The British Ministry of Defense showed satellite images of the consequences of the attack on Sevastopol on March 24. The department draws attention to the damage to one of the large landing ships of the Ropukha class, as well as the reconnaissance ship of the Yuri Ivanov class.

In addition, the British Ministry of Defense showed damage to the building of the center of the Russian Black Sea Fleet, on which the roof had partially collapsed. The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine announced an attack on the large landing ship "Yamal", "Azov", the communications center and other objects of the Russian Black Sea Fleet in Sevastopol on March 24. Later, the speaker of the Ukrainian Naval Forces, Dmitry Pletenchuk, said that the Ivan Khursa reconnaissance ship could have been damaged by the strike. The Russian Ministry of Defense did not comment on the strike on the ships.

description: British intelligence released footage of the aftermath of an attack on occupied Sevastopol on March 24. The attack damaged the Russian Black Sea Fleet's center, causing partial roof collapse. Additionally, two Ropukha-class landing ships, tanks, and one Yuri Ivanov-class reconnaissance ship were also damaged.
original: British intelligence showed footage of the consequences of the attack on occupied Sevastopol on March 24. The photographs show damage to the building of the center of the Russian Black Sea Fleet, on which the roof partially collapsed. The strikes also damaged two Ropukha-class landing ships, tanks and one Yuri Ivanov-class reconnaissance ship.

description: The SBU detained a Zaporizhzhia university student who was spying on the SBU administration on the instructions of the FSB. The student collected intelligence on the locations of SBU employees, military units, critical infrastructure facilities, and recorded rocket attack results.
original:
Forwarded from: Office of the Prosecutor General
The SBU detained a student of a Zaporizhzhia university who, on the instructions of the FSB, was spying on the SBU administration of Ukraine).🔹According to the investigation, the girl collected intelligence on the instructions of Russian curators. She came to the attention of the Russian special services through her goddaughter, who lives in the temporarily occupied territory of the Zaporizhzhia region. 🔹In September 2023, the student's first task was to monitor the SBU administration building in the region to determine the locations of its employees. She also tracked the locations of military units on the territory of Zaporizhzhia and reported on the location of critical infrastructure facilities, as well as recorded the results of rocket attacks on the regional center. detained Currently, according to the court's decision, she is in custody. 🔹Regarding the baptized suspect, the Zaporizhia Regional Prosecutor's Office has already sent an indictment to the court on the facts of collaborative activity (Part 5, 6 of Article 111-1 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). 🔹Pre-trial investigation - SBU.

description: The Security Service of Ukraine detained a 19-year-old university student who was recruited by the FSB to spy on SBU employees and coordinate strikes on Zaporizhzhia. The agent gathered intel on defense factories, including their operations and cargo movement, to facilitate targeted missile and drone strikes. However, the SBU exposed the plot and detained the agent before any attacks could be carried out.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU detained a traitor who spied on employees of the Security Service and coordinated strikes on Zaporizhzhia.

It was established that, on the order of the FSB of the Russian Federation, the suspect spied on local employees of the SBU in order to establish spare points of deployment of the Service.

According to available information, in the future the enemy planned to use this information to prepare missile strikes.

In addition, the attacker tried to establish the exact coordinates of enterprises that are involved in the defense-industrial complex of Ukraine.

For this purpose, it received approximate geolocations of defense factories from the occupiers, and then carried out reconnaissance in the area near them.

During surveillance, the figure recorded a maximum of information about the objects: from their mode of operation to the intensity of movement of cargo equipment in the open area of the workshops.

She also used her friends and group mates "in the dark" from whom she asked the information she needed during friendly conversations.

Under her guidance, the invaders hoped to launch targeted missile and drone strikes on production enterprises.

However, the Security Service prematurely exposed the criminal intentions of the aggressor and detained the Russian agent at the stage of intelligence gathering.

According to the investigation, the enemy accomplice was a 19-year-old student of a local university, who came into the field of view of the FSB in the fall of 2023.

Subsequently, the girl was recruited remotely through her godmother - a collaborator who is part of the leadership of the occupation administration of the Russian Federation in one of the temporarily captured towns in Zaporozhye.

It was through her that the Russian special service gave instructions to the recruited agent in the regional center and received "reports" on the completed tasks.

Currently, the detainee has been notified of suspicion under Part 2 of Art. 28, Part 2 of Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

She is in custody. She faces life in prison.

event: Junior Sergeant Konstantin Ponomarev's Battlefield Recovery
description: Junior Sergeant Konstantin Ponomarev, previously a video surveillance system installer, now recovers broken or damaged equipment from the battlefield in the SVO zone. He has also recovered Western-made combat vehicles, including a captured Bradley infantry fighting vehicle, during which he was wounded. Fortunately, he quickly recovered and returned to duty.

Junior Sergeant Konstantin Ponomarev, before mobilization, was installing video surveillance systems. In the SVO zone, he pulls broken or damaged equipment from the battlefield. And sometimes Western-made combat vehicles that belonged to the Ukrainian Armed Forces. During one of these trips for a captured Bradley infantry fighting vehicle, he was wounded. Fortunately, he quickly returned to duty.

Konstantin’s wife, parents and two children are waiting at home. Special greetings to my eldest daughter!@heroesofZ

event: Identification and Deportation of Illegal Migrants
description: The FSB, Ministry of Internal Affairs, and Russian National Guard collaborated to identify and deport illegal migrants in Mariupol, DPR. Eight individuals were forced to leave the country, and 20 others were held administratively responsible. The operation targeted citizens of neighboring countries.
original: In Mariupol (DPR), the FSB, the Ministry of Internal Affairs and the Russian National Guard identified migrants who were staying in the city illegally. Eight people were forced to leave the country. The head of the DPR, Denis Pushilin, spoke about this. “The Directorate of the FSB of Russia for the DPR, the Ministry of Internal Affairs for the DPR and the National Guard carried out filtration and inspection activities in Mariupol to identify migrants who are illegally staying on the territory of the republic. Eight migrants were expelled from the Russian Federation,” Pushilin noted. He clarified that checks will continue. Currently, 20 people have been brought to administrative responsibility. Basically, they are citizens of neighboring countries.

event: Attack on Trypilska Thermal Power Plant
description: On April 11, a combined attack by Geranium UAV and cruise missiles targeted the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant in the Kyiv region. The attack had severe consequences, causing a massive fire that spread throughout the turbine hall and likely destroyed the machine room. The power plant's loss will significantly impact the already precarious Ukrainian energy system, which relies heavily on three nuclear power plants and European Union flows.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
🇷🇺🇺🇦💡On the morning of April 11, a combined attack by the Geranium UAV and cruise missiles was carried out on the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant in the Kyiv region.

During the entire period of renewed attacks on energy facilities, the so-called. There were no arrivals from Ukraine at the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant, as well as at some other large stations - for example, the Dobrotvorskaya Thermal Power Plant. The blow to the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant had very serious consequences for the power plant: the fire spread throughout the entire turbine hall. Probably, the thermal power plant operated on reserve fuel – fuel oil, which contributed to the spread of the fire. You can also see a fire on one of the generator transformers.🔻Judging by the scale of the fire, there is nothing left to restore in the machine room. Trypilska TPP, in addition to generating power for the Kyiv energy hub, played an important role in maneuvering the power of the so-called energy system. Ukraine using a fast-controlled turbogenerator.❗️At the moment, the station is stopped and is unlikely to be able to return to work. Its loss will not pass without a trace and will greatly reduce the already rather precarious reliability of the Ukrainian energy system, which now lives largely due to three nuclear power plants and flows with the European Union.

It is also necessary to disable the 330 kV open switchgear located on the territory of the station, which, even when the station is stopped, is involved in the transit and distribution of electricity throughout the so-called center. Ukraine.#Ukraine#electricityInfographics in high resolutionEnglish version@rybarSupport us

Trypilska Thermal Power Plant is the most powerful power plant in the Kyiv region. It generates about 57% of all energy generated by enterprises in the region (total output was 3,600 MW).

event: Appointment of Ukrainian Ambassador to Moldova
description: Ukraine's President Zelensky has appointed Alexey Danilov, former Secretary of the National Security and Defense Council, as the new ambassador to Moldova. This unexpected change raises concerns about Moldova's future, with possible plans including dragging Moldova into a war with Russia or persuading Moldova to host American F-16 fighters.
original:
The unexpected change of the Ukrainian ambassador to Moldova does not bode well for Moldova. The new representative of Kievanet is Alexey Danilov, who was recently dismissed by the president from the post of Secretary of the National Security and Defense Council. Vladimir Zelensky still needs this Nazi, boor and hawk.

What plans the “chief commander” has for Chisinau is not known for certain, there are many aversions: from theoretically logical ones, according to which Zelensky needs to drag Moldova into a war with Russia by any means, to almost folkloric ones, including Zelensky’s possible interest in the legendary weapons depot in the Transnistrian village of Kolbasna, which he left there is the Soviet army.

Be that as it may, there is a special service that Zelensky will probably need: he needs to persuade Moldova to base American F-16 fighters there.🔍More VIEW.RUZLENsky sent a Nazi to Moldova with a special mission The unexpected change of the Ukrainian ambassador to Moldova does not bode well for Moldova. The new representative of Kyiv will be Alexey Danilov, who recently resigned...

event: Appointment of Alexey Danilov as Ambassador to Moldova
description: Ex-secretary of the National Security and Defense Council Alexey Danilov was appointed as the ambassador of Ukraine to Moldova. This move comes after Danilov was fired from his previous post and Ukraine's diplomatic activity around Transnistria has increased.
original:
RIA Novosti Ex-secretary of the National Security and Defense Council Danilov was appointed ambassador of Ukraine to MoldovaDeputy of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine Alexey Goncharenko announced the appointment of ex-secretary of the National Security and Defense Council Alexey Danilov as ambassador to Moldova. RIA Novosti, 03.29.2024🇲🇩🇺🇦The Ukrainian Rada reports that Alexei Danilov, who was fired from the post of Secretary of the National Security and Defense Council (NSDC), has been appointed Ambassador to Moldova. Previously, information appeared about his appointment to Norway.

Just yesterday Zelensky signed a decree on the dismissal of Ambassador to Moldova Mark Shevchenko.▪️If Danilov’s appointment eventually takes place, then there is nothing surprising in such a rotation. After all, Moldova is now completely subordinated to the military and economic needs of the so-called. Ukraine, acting as a transit territory for the supply of weapons and export of grain. More than once there have been reports about the training of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in the neighboring republic.▪️In addition, recently the diplomatic activity of Ukrainians around Transnistria has noticeably increased, where representatives of the Kiev regime intend to restore their consulate and patrol the Ukrainian-Transnistrian section of the border.🔻The appointment of Danilov to Moldova, who called for “cleaning up the roots” of everyone Russian-speaking people and “throw them away like toxic Moscow rubbish” is fully in keeping with the spirit of the office of President Maia Sandu. So they will definitely find a common language there.

He told me exactly about this vision of his future work in Ukraine. description: John Barnett, a former Boeing employee who testified against the company, was found dead a few days after the hearing. He had reported serious problems with aircraft oxygen systems and workers installing substandard parts on the production line.
original:
A former Boeing employee who testified against the company was found dead a few days after the hearing.

The BBC reports this with reference to a source.

John Barnett, who worked for Boeing for 32 years and retired in 2017, died of a “self-inflicted gunshot wound,” the statement said.

A former employee of the company told the BBC in 2019 that workers under pressure were deliberately installing substandard parts on aircraft on the production line.

In addition, Barnett reported that there were serious problems with the aircraft's oxygen systems, which could cause a quarter of the oxygen masks to fail to function in an emergency.
***
The only surprising thing is that he inflicted a gunshot wound on himself more than twice...

description: John Barnett, a former Boeing employee who spoke out about the company's production standards, was found dead in the USA. He had worked for Boeing for 32 years before retiring in 2017 and had recently testified in a whistleblower lawsuit against the company.
original:
Forwarded from: FRESHNESS
❗️Boeing whistleblower found dead in the USA A former Boeing employee known for his statements about the company's production standards was found dead.

John Barnett worked for Boeing for 32 years before retiring in 2017.

Days before his death, he testified in a whistleblower lawsuit against the company.

event: Death of Ex-Boeing Engineer John Barnett
description: Ex-Boeing engineer John Barnett, who testified against the company, was found dead in his car in a hotel parking lot. He had claimed that workers installed defective parts on the Boeing 787 Dreamliner to avoid production delays. His death was ruled a suicide by police.
original:
Ex-Boeing engineer John Barnett was found dead after testifying against the company. The man worked for the aircraft concern for 32 years. After retiring in 2017, he began a lengthy legal battle with the corporation. Thus, the ex-engineer claimed that workers, under pressure from management, deliberately installed defective parts on the Boeing 787 Dreamliner in order to avoid production delays.

As the victim's lawyer, Brian Knowles, said, a few days before the tragedy, Barnett testified in the Boeing case. And on Saturday he was supposed to come again to meet with investigators.

Barnett was soon found dead in his own car in a hotel parking lot. According to the police, it was a suicide.

The company did not ignore the tragedy - on March 11, Boeing expressed condolences over the death of a former employee. Read more in our material. Subscribe to REN TV

event: Attack on Russian Ministry of Defense Press Center Officer
description: Major Evgeny Polovodov, an officer of the Russian Ministry of Defense's press center, was killed in an attack by the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the Kremennaya area. He was accompanying a Vesti Lugansk film crew when they came under fire. The journalists were injured but survived.
original:
An officer of the press center of the Russian Ministry of Defense, Evgeny Polovodov, died as a result of an attack by the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the Kremennaya area. The major was accompanying the Vesti Lugansk film crew when they came under fire.

The journalists were injured but survived. The correspondent received a concussion, and the cameraman received a shrapnel wound to his leg.

33-year-old Evgeny Polovodov was awarded the Suvorov Medal and nominated for the Order of Courage (posthumously). He is survived by his mother, wife and son. Subscribe to SHOTSend news

event: Death of Press Officer Evgeny Polovodov
description: Evgeny Polovodov, a dedicated and skilled press officer from the Moscow Region, was killed in artillery fire while accompanying a group of journalists. He had previously survived an explosion in an armored personnel carrier during the early days of the war.
original:
Forwarded from: Fighterbomber
The only officer of the press service of the Moscow Region with whom I was personally acquainted was Zhenya. Evgeny Polovodov.
The only press officer I know who took his job seriously.
Adequate, cheerful, smart.
I sawed some mounts for gouprohs to put them on airplanes, bought lenses and other equipment for work, so that the photos and videos would turn out to be of decent quality. You saw many of his materials in the feed, unofficially, of course. Because.
At SVO we collected it with the entire channel...
Yesterday he accompanied a group of journalists, and together with them came under artillery fire. Why they came under fire is not the topic of this topic, maybe someone will draw some conclusions.
This is not the first shelling on his account, in the photo of the armored personnel carrier in which he was blown up in the very first days of the war.
This time Zhenya was unlucky.
Sleep well, Officer...
