event: Drones Shot Down Over Voronezh Region
description: The Russian Ministry of Defense reported that two Ukrainian drones were destroyed over the Voronezh region. The drones allegedly attacked the Chkalov aviation training center in Borisoglebsk, with one crashing into a building's façade and another hitting the same spot an hour later.
original:
The Russian Ministry of Defense reported that two drones were shot down over the Voronezh region. According to telegram channels, they attacked an aviation training center. Two Ukrainian drones were destroyed over the territory of the Voronezh region on the night of April 9, the Russian Ministry of Defense reports. The governor of the Voronezh region, Alexander Gusev, announced one destroyed drone. According to him, no one was injured, “the consequences on the ground are being clarified.”

Telegram channels Baza and Astra write that drones attacked the Chkalov aviation training center in Borisoglebsk, Voronezh region.

Baza reports that the first drone crashed into the façade of a building on the fourth floor at around three o'clock in the morning. An hour later, a second drone hit the same spot.

———

Read more news from the 776th day of the full-scale war between Russia and Ukraine on Meduza online. Telegram Be careful, news Borisoglebsk in the Voronezh region was attacked by a UAV.

According to local residents, the drone attack caused an explosion on the ground. About the damage...0:11VIEW MESSAGE

description: Vice Admiral Konstantin Kabantsov, a seasoned submariner, has been appointed as the acting commander of the Northern Fleet. He has held various positions, including chief of staff of the Northern Fleet, commander of the 24th submarine division, and commander of the White Sea naval base.
original:
According to the Russian Ministry of Defense, the acting commander of the Northern Fleet is Vice Admiral Konstantin Kabantsov.
Kabantsov (born in 1968) has been the chief of staff of the Northern Fleet since October 2021. He is a submariner, was the commander of the nuclear submarine Gepard (2003-2006), deputy commander, chief of staff and commander of the 24th submarine division of the Northern Fleet (2006-2016), commander of the White Sea naval base of the Northern Fleet (2018 -2020), commander of the Primorsky flotilla of heterogeneous forces of the Pacific Fleet (2020-2021).

description: Today, Ukraine celebrates the birthday of Taras Shevchenko, a Ukrainian poet and writer. While official authorities mark the occasion, many young people seem disinterested, with some even unaware of his literary works. In contrast, the older generation, educated in Soviet schools, still recalls excerpts from his book.
original:
Today in Ukraine they celebrate the birthday of Taras Shevchenko. Official authorities celebrate. The rest of the citizens, especially young people, don’t seem to care at all about this.

A survey conducted on the streets showed that the younger generation of Ukrainians does not know “what that Shevchenko of yours wrote.” But he can give a lecture about patriotism and damned Muscovites.

But the older generation, educated in Soviet schools, still remembers excerpts from Shevchenko’s imperishable book. Know more from Ukraine.ru

description: Ukraine celebrates the birthday of Taras Hryhorovych Shevchenko, a renowned poet and spiritual father of Ukrainians, whose words remain prophetic.
original: Today, March 9, Ukraine celebrates the birthday of Taras Hryhorovych Shevchenko, the spiritual father of Ukrainians, the glorious Kobzar, whose words still sound extremely prophetic📲 Subscribe to Ukrinform|Facebook|Twitter|YouTube

description: On the 210th anniversary of Taras Shevchenko's birthday, a celebration was held in Kherson near the poet's monument. The event highlighted the relevance of Kobzar's poems in the current struggle for Ukrainian freedom and showcased the indomitable spirit of the Ukrainian people.
original:
In Kherson, on the 210th anniversary of Taras Shevchenko's birthday, near the poet's chest, a Kherson celebration was held, Svitlana Dumynska, the head of the city's culture department, told Souspilno. Quotations from the works of Taras Shevchenko were pasted on the banner protecting the monument from shelling by the Russian military.

Kobzar's poems are relevant even in our time, says Dumynska, and prove the indomitability of the spirit of the Ukrainian people in their struggle for freedom.

Photo: Suspilne Kherson.

description: Defector Kuzminov entered Spain using a Ukrainian passport in the name of Igor Shevchenko, which was issued on September 22 last year. The document contains false information, including a birth year that is five years earlier than his actual birth year.

The passport was registered in the name of Igor Shevchenko. Subscribe to REN TV

event: Traitor Pilot Maxim Kuzminov Enters Spain
description: Traitor pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who deserted and killed two comrades, entered Spain under the alias Igor Shevchenko, a 33-year-old Ukrainian refugee from Donetsk. He was given a Ukrainian passport issued on September 22, 2023, using the identity of a deceased DPR militiaman.
original:
The traitor pilot Maxim Kuzminov entered Spain under the name of 33-year-old Igor Shevchenko - with a Ukrainian passport issued on September 22, 2023. As Mash learned, he was given the identity of a DPR militiaman who died in 2014.

After deserting and killing two comrades, he tried to start a new life by posing as refugee Igor Shevchenko from Donetsk. Here is the answer to the question about the age confusion that arose after the first publications about his liquidation: according to fake documents, Kuzminov was 33 years old.

According to our information, the “new identity” of the pilot is not fictitious - Igor Shevchenko, born on September 15, 1990 in Donetsk, was a DPR militiaman, but died back in 2014. It is likely that Ukrainian militants took his documents in order to appropriate the data later if necessary.

The traitor was given a passport on September 22, 2023, a month and a half after fleeing to Ukraine. He entered Spain in October. Local authorities are awaiting the results of the biometric examination, which was requested in both Russia and Ukraine. Subscribe to Mash

As a result of the missile attack, the facility was completely disabled, and a fire started in the turbine shop. It hasn't been localized yet.

Trypilska Thermal Power Plant is the most powerful power plant in the Kyiv region. It generates about 57% of all energy generated by enterprises in the region (total output was 3,600 MW).

event: Strike on Patriot Air Defense System
description: The Iskander air defense missile system struck west of Pokrovsk, destroying 2 launchers of the Ukrainian Armed Forces' Patriot air defense system. The destroyed equipment included an M901 launcher based on the MAN KAT1 truck and a MAN KAT1 truck. This loss represents greater damage to Ukraine's air defense than the S-300.
original:
Clarification on the strike of the Iskander air defense missile system west of Pokrovsk: The guys from Lost Armour analyzed the objective control footage and came to the conclusion that as a result of the strike, 2 launchers of the Patriot air defense system of the Ukrainian Armed Forces were destroyed.

Later, Ukrainian resources confirmed that the following were destroyed: M901 based on the MAN KAT1 truck of the MIM-104 Patriot complex; MAN KAT1 truck. The loss of two Patriot installations represents greater damage to the Ukrainian air defense than the S-300.
We are waiting for Washington's reaction...INSIDE OUT★Our Chat★Send news

event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: An OTRK strike west of Pokrovsk destroyed 2 launchers of the Ukrainian Armed Forces' Patriot air defense system, as well as a multifunctional radar. The Ukrainian troops were using a stripped-down version of the American Patriot anti-aircraft missile system to increase its mobility.
original:
Forwarded from: LOSTARMOUR | Carthago delenda est!
Apparently, an OTRK strike west of Pokrovsk destroyed 2 launchers of the Patriot air defense system of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, as well as a multifunctional radar.

Before the video was published, the channel https://t.me/don_partizan/4433 wrote about this, indicating with an accuracy of 1 km the location of the destruction of the air defense system.

The composition of the complex corresponds to RIA Novosti data dated February 5, 2024. Ukrainian troops are using a stripped-down version of the American Patriot anti-aircraft missile system (SAM) to increase its mobility, military analyst and air defense systems specialist Alexei Leonkov told RIA Novosti.

“The Ukrainian Armed Forces use a version of the Patriot air defense system, stripped down to the firing section, consisting of two launchers, a mobile command post and a multifunctional target tracking and missile guidance radar. All of them are mounted on semi-trailers. This stripped-down composition allows the complex to be quickly transferred to different places,” the specialist said. Also in favor of this version is the location of the semi-trailer axles, which is characteristic of the Patriot rather than the C-300 launcher.

event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: Russian troops successfully destroyed a Ukrainian Armed Forces anti-aircraft missile system, specifically a MIM-104 Patriot launcher, near Pokrovsk using an Iskander ballistic missile strike. The attack showcased high reconnaissance capabilities and efficiency in inflicting fire damage.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
❗️🇷🇺🇺🇦Destruction of the Patriot air defense system near Pokrovsk In the morning, the Russian Ministry of Defense published footage of the destruction of the Ukrainian Armed Forces anti-aircraft missile system by an Iskander ballistic missile strike. A column of cars was hit near the village of Sergeev, just west of Pokrovsk (Krasnoarmeysk): a powerful explosion occurred, characteristic of the detonation of rocket fuel. Coordinates: 48.2975341, 36.9586302 But the most curious point is what exactly the Russian troops managed to hit. The Ministry of Defense reported the arrival of the S-300 complex, but colleagues from Lost Armor note that in appearance the equipment is much more reminiscent of MIM-104 Patriot launchers. This is also indicated by the use of corresponding semi-trailers.

In any case, this is a clear success for the Russian troops. Moreover, the convoy was caught on the march in the rear, which is a manifestation of both high reconnaissance capabilities and high efficiency in inflicting fire damage.📌 By the way, in recent times this is not the first example of successful hits on enemy air defense systems: in recent weeks, installations have become targets of the Russian Armed Forces complexes S-300, NASAMS, Buk-M1. Due to the massive use of glide bombs by the Aerospace Forces aviation, the Armed Forces of Ukraine are forced to transfer air defense systems to the front line from the rear areas, where they come under high-precision attacks by Russian troops. UPD. New footage of the results of the arrival make it possible to clearly determine that during the attack there was It was the ZRSMIM-104 Patriot that was destroyed. High-resolution infographicsEnglish versionIf you, your loved ones and relatives have information about damaged objects, enemy movements, or any other sensitive information that can help our troops, feel free to write to our bot@rybar_feedback_bot. We guarantee confidentiality. #Donetsk#Pokrovsk#Russia#Ukraine@rybarSupport us

description: The second prototype of the Il-114-300 aircraft made its first flight from the LAZ airfield, piloted by a crew of experienced test pilots. The 40-minute flight tested the aircraft's stability, controllability, and Russian-made systems and equipment. The crew reported a smooth flight and successful completion of the flight program.
original:
UAC resumed the Il-114-300 flight test program, within the framework of which the second prototype aircraft made its first flight from the airfield of the branch of PJSC UAC - LAZ named after. P.A. Voronin.

The aircraft was piloted by a crew consisting of the aircraft commander, chief pilot of Il PJSC, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Sergei Sukhar, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Igor Zinov, and on-board test engineer 1st class Oleg Gryazev. The flight lasted 40 minutes and took place at altitudes up to 900 m and at speeds up to 230 km/h.

During the tests, the stability and controllability of the aircraft was checked, as well as the stable operation of Russian systems and equipment, most of which were manufactured by enterprises of the Rostec State Corporation.

The crew commander reported that the flight went smoothly, the systems and equipment worked properly, and the flight program was completed in full. Before the start of flights, the aircraft underwent a cycle of ground tests: workshop and airfield tests were carried out. Taxiing and high-speed runs were also performed as part of the flight test program. “The resumption of the flight test program is an important step towards creating a new aircraft for regional transportation. We are connecting a second experimental machine to flights. I would like to thank my cooperation colleagues for their contribution to the continuation of the testing program. We all have hard work ahead of us. The aircraft is designed for operation, including in difficult climatic conditions. We will have to confirm the reliability and performance of all systems, including in harsh climates,” said Daniil Brenerman, Managing Director of Il PJSC, commenting on the upcoming test program.

description: The Il-114-300 civil aviation aircraft resumed its flight testing program, conducting a 40-minute test flight from the LAZ airfield. The aircraft was tested for stability, controllability, and the operation of Russian-made systems and equipment, including those manufactured by Rostec enterprises.
original:
The Il-114-300 is flying again, and using Russian equipment. UAC has resumed its flight testing program for civil aviation aircraft. It made its first flight from the airfield of the branch of PJSC "UAC" - LAZ named after. P.A. Voronin.

The test lasted 40 minutes and took place at altitudes up to 900 m and at speeds up to 230 km/h. During the flight, the aircraft was tested for stability and controllability, as well as the stable operation of Russian systems and equipment, most of which were manufactured by Rostec enterprises. -114, which has an increased thrust of 4 tons,” Rostec reported. event: Flight Testing of Il-114-300 Passenger Aircraft
description: The United Aircraft Corporation resumed flight testing of the Il-114-300 passenger aircraft, with the second prototype taking off on March 31, 2024. The 40-minute flight tested the aircraft's stability, controllability, and on-board systems, reaching a height of 900 meters and a speed of 230 km/h.
location: Luzhnikov Aircraft Plant, Leningrad Oblast, Russia
original:
The United Aircraft Corporation resumed the flight testing program of the new Il-14-300 passenger aircraft, and the second prototype of the aircraft took off. This was reported by the UAC press service.

On March 31, 2024, the second prototype of the Il-114-300 aircraft, assembled at LAZ named after. P.A. Voronin. The flight lasted 40 minutes, the plane rose to a height of 900 meters and picked up a speed of 230 km/h. The stability and controllability of the aircraft was checked, as well as the stable operation of on-board systems and equipment. The flight went smoothly.

The plane was piloted by a crew consisting of the aircraft commander, chief pilot, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Sergei Sukhar, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Igor Zinov, and on-board test engineer 1st class Oleg Gryazev, the report says.

event: First Flight of Il-114-300 Turboprop Aircraft
description: The second experimental Il-114-300 turboprop aircraft successfully completed its first 40-minute flight, marking a significant milestone in the flight test program for the Russian regional aircraft. The flight tested the aircraft's stability, controllability, and Russian systems and equipment.
original:
The second experimental turboprop aircraft Il-114-300 made its first flight. The second experimental turboprop aircraft Il-114-300 made its first flight, resuming the flight test program of the Russian regional aircraft.

According to the United Aircraft Corporation, the flight lasted 40 minutes and took place at altitudes up to 900 m and at speeds up to 230 km/h, and was made from the airfield of the UAC branch - LAZ named after. P.A. Voronin in Lukhovitsy.

During the tests, the stability and controllability of the aircraft was checked, as well as the stable operation of Russian systems and equipment.

Crew commander Sergei Sukhar said that the flight went smoothly, the systems and equipment worked properly, the flight program was completed in full. “The resumption of the flight test program is an important step towards the creation of a new aircraft for regional transport. We are connecting the second experimental machine to flights. <…> We all have hard work ahead of us. <…> We will have to confirm the reliability and performance of all systems, including in harsh climates,” said Daniil Brenerman, Managing Director of PJSC Il, commenting on the upcoming test program. The developer of the aircraft is PJSC Il, the final assembly of the aircraft carried out at an enterprise in Lukhovitsy, Moscow Region (the enterprises are part of the UAC).

Il-114-300 is a regional passenger aircraft with a maximum capacity of 68 seats. It is intended to replace the An-24 on local airlines.

According to the latest version of the comprehensive development program for the Russian aviation industry until 2030, it is planned to produce 70 Il-114-300s.

The aircraft is equipped with a TV7-117ST-01 engine, which has undergone a series of modifications. A new auxiliary power unit TA 14-114 has also been installed. “Aircraft manufacturers still have a large amount of certification work ahead for the Il-114-300 aircraft, including flight tests,” noted the head of the Federal Air Transport Agency Dmitry Yadrov. Photo: OAK Subscribe to @ATOjournal

description: The second experimental Il-114-300 aircraft completed its first 40-minute flight, reaching altitudes of up to 900m and speeds of up to 230km/h. The new airliner features Russian components, improved flight characteristics, and enhanced ergonomics. It is designed to operate in challenging climatic conditions and replace An-24 aircraft on regional airlines.
original:
UAC has resumed flight testing of the new passenger Il-114-300. The second experimental aircraft of this type made its first flight, the Rostec state corporation, which includes UAC, reported. It lasted 40 minutes and took place at altitudes of up to 900 m and at speeds of up to 230 km/h.

Before taking to the skies, the aircraft completed a cycle of ground tests.

The new Il-144-300 consists entirely of Russian components. It is equipped with a TV7-117ST-01 engine, which has undergone a series of modifications.

The new airliner has improved flight characteristics, increased the use of composite materials, and improved almost all major systems. The designers paid special attention to improving the ergonomics of the cockpit, where a new digital flight navigation system was also installed.

The Il-114-300 is being created taking into account operation in difficult climatic conditions, as it is supposed to replace An-24 aircraft on regional airlines. Modern Russian-made regional aircraft are extremely necessary to solve the problems that the country's leadership has set for air transport. This is an increase in the mobility of our citizens, an increase in the intensity of air traffic in Russia by one and a half times by 2030,” noted the head of the Federal Air Transport Agency Dmitry Yadrov.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades to suppress enemy positions, demonstrating good results despite enemy fire. This combat use will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

description: The FSB and Federal Customs Service intercepted a cargo of explosives in the Pskov region, which was being smuggled from Ukraine through EU countries to Moscow. The driver, who received the cargo in Romania, was given necessary documents and passed through multiple countries without issue, but was caught by Russian border guards.
original: The FSB and the Federal Customs Service blocked the smuggling channel for the delivery of explosives to the Russian Federation from Ukraine in transit through the EU countries. A cargo of explosives in icons, intercepted by the Russian special services in the Pskov region, was en route to Moscow. It was planned to unload the goods there, said the driver, in whose car the dangerous cargo was found. He said that he received the cargo in Romania, and he was given all the necessary documents for travel. Having passed through Hungary, Slovakia, Poland, Lithuania and Latvia, he did not encounter any obstacles. Only Russian border guards discovered the deadly contents of the icons during inspection. The power of the explosives seized in the icons in the Pskov region would be enough to blow up a five-story residential building.

description: The FSB intercepted a shipment of explosives from Ukraine through the EU, hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils, in the Pskov region. The seized materials included 27 homemade bombs, 70 kg of explosives, RPG-7 parts, and 91 electric detonators. The carrier was detained, and organizers will be put on the wanted list.
original:
💣They tried to import bombs in icons into Russia from the territory of Ukraine. The FSB blocked the supply of explosives from the territory of Ukraine through the EU in the Pskov region. 27 homemade bombs were found in Orthodox icons and church utensils during a vehicle search at a checkpoint.

70 kg of explosives, parts of an RPG-7 shot and 91 electric detonators were transported through Romania, Hungary, Slovakia, Poland, Lithuania and Latvia. The carrier was detained, the organizers and accomplices of the crime will be put on the wanted list.

The mass of the discovered hexogen would be enough to blow up a five-story building.@node_of_time_RUS

description: Russian FSB employees, along with customs, intercepted a smuggling operation in the Pskov region, which aimed to deliver explosives from Ukraine through the European Union. The inspection of a car at a checkpoint revealed explosives hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils.
original:
In the Pskov region, employees of the Russian FSB, together with customs, blocked a smuggling channel for the delivery of explosives from Ukraine in transit through the countries of the European Union.

During an inspection of a car at a checkpoint in the Pskov region, explosives, including foreign ones, were found in Orthodox icons and church utensils.

DSP FSB of Russia reports:
“In total, from the cargo traveling along the route Ukraine - Romania - Hungary - Slovakia - Poland - Lithuania - Latvia - Russia, 27 improvised explosive devices camouflaged in icons and ready for use, 70 kg of industrially produced high-power plastic explosives, 91 electric detonators and shot parts were recovered to RPG-7.#Russia@new_militarycolumnist

description: FSB officers intercepted a cargo of explosives hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils in the Pskov region. The shipment originated from Ukraine and transited through Romania, Hungary, Slovakia, Poland, Lithuania, and Latvia before reaching Russia. Authorities seized approximately 70 kg of high-power plastic explosive, 91 electric detonators, and parts of an RPG-7 shot.
original:
❗️ FSB officers “opened” a channel for importing explosives into the Russian Federation, which were hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils.

The cargo, intercepted in the Pskov region, followed the route Ukraine - Romania - Hungary - Slovakia - Poland - Lithuania - Latvia - Russia.

In total, about 70 kg of industrially produced high-power plastic explosive, 91 electric detonators and parts of an RPG-7 shot were seized.@voenkorKotenok

description: Russian forces successfully destroyed an American Abrams tank near Avdeevka using a Lancet drone. The drone evaded enemy fire before striking the M1A1SA Abrams turret near the village of Solovevo.
original: Our fighters destroyed 1 more American Abrams tank near Avdeevka▪️The Lancet hit the M1A1SA Abrams turret near the village of Solovevo.▪️Before attacking the target, the drone performs an evasive maneuver from enemy fire.#NotesDenazification⬆️⬇️⏏️*️⃣➖

description: A Lancet combat UAV successfully destroyed an enemy Abrams tank in the Avdeevsky direction. The UAV's precision strike left no doubt about the scale of the explosion, debunking the myth of the American tank's invincibility.
original:
Another one - in the Avdeevsky direction, the Lancet gracefully opened up another enemy Abrams tank. By naming our combat UAV the name Lancet, the creators showed a certain kind of wit. The device took over from its namesake - a stabbing surgical instrument - the function of effectively opening “abscesses” on the battlefield, be it a cluster of equipment or a targeted tank.

Another "Abrams" from the deafening "injection" of the "Lancet" went to the heavenly Kubinka from the outskirts of the Avdeevsky direction - the scale of the explosion in the video leaves no doubt. The image of a terrible and indestructible American flies around in a circle and crumbles over and over again. There are no invincible machines, just clumsy or simply uninformed operators.

description: Russian forces destroyed an American Abrams tank in the village of Berdychi, Avdeevsky direction. The tank was initially hit by a grenade launcher, and then finished off by attack aircraft from the 30th motorized rifle brigade from Samara.

EXCLUSIVE | SOLOVIOVLIVEThe Russian army destroyed another American Abrams tank in Ukraine. This happened in the village of Berdychi in the Avdeevsky direction. The guys first hit the track with a grenade launcher, and then the car was finished off by attack aircraft from the 30th motorized rifle brigade from Samara. Subscribe to Telegram SOLOVYOV!

description: The Federal Security Service of Russia in the Altai Territory detained a local resident born in 1976 for promoting anti-Russian content on a Telegram channel, encouraging terrorist activities and providing resource support to banned pro-Ukrainian terrorist organizations.
original:
Another Bandera fan was detained in Altai.

The Federal Security Service of Russia in the Altai Territory suppressed the illegal terrorist activities of a local resident.

Citizen born in 1976 purposefully created and administered a public telegram channel, filling it with anti-Russian content in order to encourage the general public to engage in terrorist activities.

In particular, a number of materials contain calls for providing resource support to pro-Ukrainian terrorist organizations banned on the territory of the Russian Federation, which is confirmed by the results of linguistic examinations.

A criminal case has been initiated against the man under Part 2 of Art. 205.2 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (public calls for terrorist activities committed using the Internet).

He has been charged. At the request of the investigator, the court took the man into custody.

original:
Footage from the Belgorod region, which was shelled this morning - right in the courtyard of a residential building there is a gaping crater from a shell, and in some cars and premises all the windows were knocked out. The Ukrainian Armed Forces shells flying through peaceful Belgorod today chose residential buildings and cars as targets - as in all previous ones days. Readovka footage shows that cars parked along the street are literally riddled with bullets, and some private houses are still burning.

It is not yet known for sure whether anyone was inside the residential premises or cars at the time of the shooting. Rescuers are now working at emergency sites. There is no official information about casualties yet.

description: The FSB and Ministry of Defense thwarted a planned Ukrainian sabotage operation on the Tendrovskaya spit of the Kherson region, orchestrated by British special services. The Ukrainian landing force was destroyed, and senior soldier Yevgeny Gorin was taken prisoner. The operation was supervised by the British Royal Marines' Special Boat Service unit, which trained the perpetrators and developed actions against Russia's security.
original:
❗️The FSB and the Ministry of Defense stopped the landing of sabotage groups of special forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on the Tendrovskaya spit of the Kherson region, planned by the British special services, #FSB reported.

The Ukrainian landing force was destroyed, the senior soldier of the 73rd Naval Center of Special Operations Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, Yevgeny Gorin, was taken prisoner.

The activities of this Ukrainian MTR center are supervised by the Special Boat Service unit of the British Royal Marines.

The testimony of the captured Ukrainian Gorin indicates the direct involvement of British special forces in the development of actions against the security of Russia, as well as the training of direct perpetrators, the FSB emphasizes

event: Assassination of Russian Pilot Maxim Kuzmin
description: Russian pilot Maxim Kuzmin, who had hijacked a Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, was assassinated in Spain. Russia had openly threatened to kill him on TV.
original:
Forwarded from: NEVZOROV
It is reported that Russian pilot Maxim Kuzmin, who previously managed to kidnap and transport a Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, was killed (shot) in Spain.

Russia threatened to kill him openly, directly on TV. “We can confirm the fact of death,” said Andrey Yusov, speaker of the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine.

This was previously reported by Russian and Spanish propaganda publications.@nevzorovtv

description: Maxim Kuzmin, a former Russian serviceman who hijacked a Mi-8 helicopter to Kyiv-controlled territory, was murdered in Villajoyosa, Spain. Unidentified individuals shot him 6 times in an underground parking lot and fled in a stolen car, which was later found burnt.
original:
A number of Spanish media immediately reported the murder of Maxim Kuzmin, a former serviceman of the Russian Armed Forces. He “became famous” for hijacking a Mi-8 helicopter into territory controlled by the Kyiv regime. What we managed to find out from several materials:

It all happened in the La Cala neighborhood in the municipality of Villajoyosa. Unidentified people shot a 33-year-old Ukrainian in an underground parking lot 6 times - all the bullets hit the target and then fled. Later, a burnt car was discovered nearby, which was used to escape. It is stated that she was listed as stolen.

It is noted that this microdistrict is mainly inhabited by immigrants from Russia, Ukraine and Bulgaria. None of the neighbors knew anything about the murdered man, and many residents learned about what had happened at least a day later - the operation was carried out on February 13. So far, there is no confirmation of the liquidation of the traitor, for example, a body. So it’s worth waiting for clarifications.

description: Russian pilot Kuzminov, who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, was assassinated in Spain. He was shot 12 times and then run over by a car. Kuzminov had recent issues with alcohol and drugs. His body was discovered in a cottage community in La Villajoyosa, Alicante province.
original:
The Russian pilot Kuzminov, who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, was shot 12 times and then run over in a car, Spanish media write.

According to them, Kuzminov has recently had problems with alcohol and drugs.

The body was discovered in a cottage community by a neighbor last Tuesday, February 13, at around five o'clock in the evening in the town of La Villajoyosa in the province of Alicante.

Soon after, investigators learned of a burned-out car in the nearby town of El Campello, where the alleged killer may have fled.

Kuzminov's death has not yet been officially confirmed. So far only the media are writing about the fact that it was he who was killed in Spain. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Assassination of Defector Pilot Maxim Kuzminov
description: Defector pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian Aerospace Forces Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, was assassinated in Spain. Two men, believed to be professionals, shot him six times and then ran over his body with a car. The investigation is ongoing, with authorities still trying to determine how the killers found out Kuzminov's whereabouts.
original:
The perpetrators of the murder of defector pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian Aerospace Forces Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, shot him six times and then ran over his body with a car, writes the American news agency The New York Times, citing sources in the Spanish Civil Guard. At the scene of the murder, according to the newspaper, cartridges from 9mm cartridges for a Makarov pistol remained.

According to The New York Times, on February 13, a white Hyundai Tucson drove into the garage under the house where Maxim Kuzminov lived. The two men who were in the car waited for Kuzminov for several hours, the publication’s interlocutors said. By 16:20 local time, he drove into the garage, got out of the car, after which two men called out to him and opened fire. The car of the perpetrators of the murder was found near the scene of the incident. According to investigators, it was stolen.

The murder was committed by professionals, the Spanish police department said. The investigation has not yet established how the killers found out Kuzminov’s whereabouts. However, according to senior Ukrainian officials, shortly before his death, Maxim Kuzminov contacted his ex-girlfriend, who was in Russia, and invited her to Spain. Interlocutors of The New York Times from among the sources called his action a serious mistake.@grey_zoneTelegramGREY ZONEAccording to the Spanish news publication El Español, a defector pilot who hijacked a Mi-8 of the Russian Aerospace Forces to the territory of Ukraine was killed by a group of people who... VIEW MESSAGE

description: Defector pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian Aerospace Forces Mi-8 to Ukraine, was assassinated in Spain. He was killed by multiple bullet wounds and then run over by a car. Kuzminov had been living in Alicante under the alias Igor Shevchenko.
original:
According to the Spanish news publication El Español, a defector pilot who hijacked a Russian Aerospace Forces Mi-8 to the territory of Ukraine was killed by a group of people who were working on this.

In turn, the information publication “El Periódico” writes that Maxim Kuzminov entered Spain under the information of the Ukrainian Igor Shevchenko.

Kuzminov was killed by several bullet wounds, after which he was run over by a car, and previously unidentified persons followed his life for a long time in the city of Alicante.@grey_zone

description: Russian pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, was found dead in Spain. He was shot 12 times and then run over by a car. Despite initial doubts about the authenticity of the report, it appears that the murder did occur.
original:
GUR representative Yusov confirmed that Russian pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, was found dead in Spain.

“We can confirm the fact of death,” Yusov said.

Although there were a number of inconsistencies in the media reports, which is why many believed that it was a fake.

By the way, a number of Russian public pages suggest that the information about Kuzminov’s murder may be a “stuffing” of the Ukrainian special services in order to ensure his safety - to declare him dead, give him new documents and, possibly, plastic surgery.

Although, taking into account the fact that this happened in Spain, and not in Ukraine, and, apparently, the murder of a person actually took place, this special operation looks quite complex and multi-step to carry out. description: Russian pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, was murdered in Spain. Two men shot him six times and ran over his body with a car. The killing bore hallmarks of similar attacks linked to the Kremlin, with police finding 9-mm cartridges from a Makarov pistol at the scene.
original:
Details of the murder in Spain of Maxim Kuzminov, a Russian pilot who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, were learned by The New York Times

According to the newspaper, two men were involved in the murder. They shot Kuzminov six times and then ran over his body with a car.

At the scene of Kuzminov’s murder, police found shell casings from 9-mm cartridges for a Makarov pistol. A spokesman for Spanish police investigating the killing said it was a clear signal. He conveys it like this: “I will find you, I will kill you, I will crush you and humiliate you.”

Senior police officials, who spoke to reporters on condition of anonymity, said Kuzminov's killing bore hallmarks of similar attacks linked to the Kremlin.

Two senior officials in a conversation with the NYT suggested that Kuzminov could have been identified when he contacted his ex-girlfriend. She is in Russia, and Kuzminov invited her to come to him in Spain.

description: Train traffic in the Moscow-Minsk direction has been reopened after the collapse of the bridge in Vyazma. Railway communication is expected to be fully resumed in the near future, with all passenger trains following their regular routes.
original:
Train traffic in the Moscow-Minsk direction has been reopened after the collapse of the bridge in Vyazma. This was announced by the regional governor Vasily Anokhin.

Work is almost completed on two more tracks. According to him, railway communication will be fully resumed in the near future.

All passenger trains follow their regular routes. On the Semlevo-Vyazma section, traffic is organized in reverse mode along one track for the period of work. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Former Deputy Minister of Education Marina Rakova was sentenced to 5 years in prison for stealing 50 million rubles from the Teacher of the Year project. She was also fined 900 thousand rubles.
original:
Former Deputy Minister of Education Marina Rakova was sentenced to 5 years in prison for the theft of 50 million rubles.

According to investigators, seven people from the Ministry of Education, RANEPA and Shaninka, including Rakov, stole budget money allocated for the Teacher of the Year project. Rakova and other defendants were detained in 2021.

In 2022, Rakova admitted her guilt. The Nikulinsky Court of Moscow found her guilty and sentenced her to 5 years in prison. She was also fined 900 thousand rubles.

At the same time, the former rector of Shaninka Zuev was sentenced to four years of suspended imprisonment for fraud.

event: Sentencing of Marina Rakova and Sergei Zuev
description: Ex-Deputy Minister of Education Marina Rakova was sentenced to five years in prison for fraud, while former rector of Shaninka Sergei Zuev received four years probation. The verdict was handed down by the Nikulinsky Court of Moscow. Rakova was accused of major fraud in the allocation of money for the federal project 'Teacher of the Future' and fictitious employment of employees at RANEPA.
original:
Ex-Deputy Minister of Education Marina Rakova was sentenced to five years in prison in a fraud case. Another person involved in the case, former rector of Shaninka Sergei Zuev, was sentenced to four years probation. The verdict was handed down today by the Nikulinsky Court of Moscow, writes TASS.

Rakova was detained in the fall of 2021, she was accused of major fraud in the allocation of money for the federal project “Teacher of the Future” and fictitious employment of employees at RANEPA.

Sergei Zuev has headed Shaninka since 2011. He was detained on charges of fraud in October 2021, he was charged with theft of money allocated to Shaninka for research and fictitious employment.

In August 2022, Rakova admitted guilt and asked to be released under house arrest, but the court refused. At the same time, Zuev also admitted guilt, he repaid the damage in the case, and also, according to the investigator, “exposed other accomplices.” After this, the court released him from the pre-trial detention center under house arrest. At the beginning of November, Rakovaya was ordered to prohibit certain actions and was released from the pre-trial detention center.

Another person involved in the case was the rector of RANEPA Vladimir Mau, but the charges against him were dropped. On January 23, 2023, the government press service reported that Mau was relieved of his post as rector of RANEPA “at his own request due to health reasons.” Video: Mash Subscribe to Dozhdya’s Telegram Watch us on YouTube

The strike destroyed one S-300 launcher, disabled another launcher, and a 30N6 illumination and guidance radar. The attack demonstrated the growth of Russian reconnaissance and fire capabilities to destroy enemy air defense systems in remote areas.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
🇷🇺🇺🇦Strike on an air defense positional area in the Odessa regionDuring the day, footage of another effective strike by the Russian Armed Forces against an enemy air defense positional area southwest of the city of Ilyichevsk in the Odessa region, taken from a reconnaissance drone, appeared on the Internet. As a result of the arrival, one S-300 launcher was destroyed, which suffered detonation of ammunition. Another launcher, as well as a 30N6 illumination and guidance radar, were cut by shrapnel and disabled. Coordinates: 46.2778225, 30.5762520 Again, attention is drawn to the distance of the target from the front line - the closest Russian positions to it on Tendrovskaya Kosen were 75 km away, and the “mainland” was 75 km away. Kherson region is more than 100 km away.

Also, when watching the video, you can notice the almost simultaneous arrival of two missiles with different warheads - high-explosive fragmentation and cassette, which increased the likelihood of hitting enemy equipment. ❗️ All this again speaks of the growth of the reconnaissance and fire capabilities of the Russian Armed Forces to destroy enemy air defense systems in areas remote from the LBS. Which, of course, affects the ability of the Armed Forces of Ukraine to counter Russian attacks on critical targets in territory controlled by the Kiev regime. High-resolution infographicsEnglish versionIf you, your loved ones and relatives have information about damaged targets, enemy movements or any other sensitive information that can help to our troops, feel free to write to our bot@rybar_feedback_bot. We guarantee confidentiality.#Odessa#Russia#Ukraine@rybarSupport us

event: NATO Official Calls for Mobilization in Ukraine
description: NATO Military Committee head Rob Bauer urged Ukraine to continue mobilization efforts, citing the need for new soldiers to replace those dying and being maimed. He emphasized that mobilization is a shared responsibility among Ukrainians, implying that citizens should take charge of conscription and go to the front.
original:
A NATO official in Kyiv called on Ukraine to continue mobilization, since “soldiers are dying” - it must be carried out by the Ukrainians themselves. The head of the NATO Military Committee, Rob Bauer, decided to remind in a unique way that no one in the West is going to die for Ukraine. At the security forum in Kiev, he stated that the Armed Forces of Ukraine need new soldiers, since the “old ones” are dying and being maimed, and therefore Square needs to strengthen mobilization, despite all the “difficulties.” Bauer cynically added that “this is difficult for the people,” but mobilization is The issue is not about technology or money, but about people.

Afterwards, a NATO official said that it turns out that ordinary Ukrainians are interested in supporting “mobilization”, and the issue should not be decided by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine or the Minister of Defense, since this is a “shared responsibility” and “your country.” In other words, Bauer called on the citizens of Square to somehow deal with the conscription themselves and go to the front, because they had already paid for everything, equipment and shells, as well as the next financial tranches. Let us remind you that the other day, American Senator Graham, who also arrived in Kiev, called on Ukraine to send young people under 25 to the front and quickly pass a law on mobilization. description: The Russian FSB thwarted an attempt to smuggle a large consignment of explosives into the country. Terrorists disguised the cargo as church supplies, attempting to transport RDX from Ukraine through Eastern Europe to Russia. Authorities seized 27 explosive devices, 70 kg of high-power explosives, and 91 detonators, which could have been used to demolish a multi-story building.
original:
The Russian FSB prevented the import of a large consignment of explosives into the country...Terrorists tried to bring RDX into Russia. They disguised everything as cargo for churches.

He allegedly followed the route: Ukraine - Romania - Hungary - Slovakia - Poland - Lithuania - Latvia - Russia.

A total of 27 explosive devices, 70 kilograms of high-power explosives and 91 detonators were seized.

With the help of these explosives, a knowledgeable demolitionist could blow up a multi-story building.

description: The FSB intercepted a shipment of explosives from Ukraine through the EU, hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils, in the Pskov region. The seized materials included 27 homemade bombs, 70 kg of explosives, RPG-7 parts, and 91 electric detonators. The carrier was detained, and organizers will be put on the wanted list.
original:
💣They tried to import bombs in icons into Russia from the territory of Ukraine. The FSB blocked the supply of explosives from the territory of Ukraine through the EU in the Pskov region. 27 homemade bombs were found in Orthodox icons and church utensils during a vehicle search at a checkpoint.

70 kg of explosives, parts of an RPG-7 shot and 91 electric detonators were transported through Romania, Hungary, Slovakia, Poland, Lithuania and Latvia. The carrier was detained, the organizers and accomplices of the crime will be put on the wanted list.

The mass of the discovered hexogen would be enough to blow up a five-story building.@node_of_time_RUS

event: Seizure of Explosives at Latvian-Russian Border
description: FSB officers intercepted a large quantity of explosives, including hexogen and RDX, at the Latvian-Russian border. The seized materials, hidden in icons and church utensils, had the potential to destroy a five-story building.
original: The explosives seized at the border by FSB officers from Ukraine would be enough to blow up a five-story building: “The FSB Public Relations Center published a video of a batch of explosives from Ukraine discovered on the Latvian-Russian border, which they tried to import into Russia under the guise of icons and other church utensils. A plastic explosive, hexogen, whose power is 1.5 times greater than that of TNT, was found in the icons’ attachments. The RDX seized by law enforcement officers would be enough to blow up a five-story residential building.”

description: FSB officers intercepted a cargo of explosives hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils in the Pskov region. The shipment originated from Ukraine and transited through Romania, Hungary, Slovakia, Poland, Lithuania, and Latvia before reaching Russia. Authorities seized approximately 70 kg of high-power plastic explosive, 91 electric detonators, and parts of an RPG-7 shot.
original:
❗️ FSB officers “opened” a channel for importing explosives into the Russian Federation, which were hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils.

The cargo, intercepted in the Pskov region, followed the route Ukraine - Romania - Hungary - Slovakia - Poland - Lithuania - Latvia - Russia.

In total, about 70 kg of industrially produced high-power plastic explosive, 91 electric detonators and parts of an RPG-7 shot were seized.@voenkorKotenok

description: The Ural River in Orsk experienced a severe flood in 1957, with water levels reaching 988 cm. The disaster resulted in the flooding of 11 schools, 9 hospitals and clinics, and nearly 7,500 residential buildings.
original:
The water in the Ural River in Orsk during the severe flood of 1957 rose to 988 centimeters; data and photos of that time were published by the archive of the region.
Then 11 schools, 9 hospitals and clinics, and almost 7.5 thousand residential buildings were flooded. Now, according to the latest data, the water level in the Urals near Orsk is 928 cm.

description: The water level in the Ural River in Orenburg exceeded the dangerous level, reaching 931 cm. The flooding affected 12,464 residential buildings, 14,566 household plots, and 16 medical organizations. Authorities prepared 495 temporary accommodation centers to house over 82,000 people.
original: Governor: The water level in the Ural River in Orenburg exceeded the dangerous level and amounted to 931 cm. In the Orenburg region, 12,464 residential buildings, 14,566 household plots and 16 medical organizations were flooded, authorities reported. 495 temporary temporary accommodation centers are ready in the region, which can accommodate more than 82 thousand people. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: A severe flood in the Orenburg region has caused significant damage, with the water level in the Ural River reaching a record 1095 centimeters. The preliminary damage assessment is 40 billion rubles. The situation is stabilizing in Orsk, with the water level dropping by 28 centimeters. However, 14 people, including four children, are hospitalized due to the flood, with 259 seeking medical help.
original:
Flood in the Orenburg region. The main thing for the day✹ The water level in the Ural River reached 1095 centimeters - this is the maximum value in the entire history of observations. Orenburg Mayor Sergei Salmin wrote about this in his Telegram channel.

✹ A preliminary assessment of damage from the flood in the Orenburg region is 40 billion rubles: this amount was announced by the head of the region Denis Pasler to Vladimir Putin.

✹ In Orsk, according to local authorities, the situation is stabilizing. Over the course of a day, the water level in the city dropped by 28 centimeters to 832 centimeters.

✹ In the Orenburg region, 14 people are in hospitals due to the consequences of the flood, four of them are children. This was reported by Assistant to the Head of the Ministry of Health Alexey Kuznetsov. In total, 259 people sought medical help, he said.

✹ “Important stories” connected the general contractor of the broken dam in Orsk with local authorities.

———

Video shows flooding in Orenburg. Footage from the telegram channel.

description: The Russian Armed Forces destroyed the Zmiivskaya TPP, one of the largest in the Kharkiv region, during a massive missile attack on March 22. All units were destroyed, and auxiliary equipment was damaged, causing significant disruptions to electricity supply in Kharkiv, Poltava, and Sumy regions.
original:
The Russian Armed Forces destroyed the Zmiivskaya TPP in the Kharkiv region: where there will be problems with electricity. The Russian army destroyed the Zmiivskaya TPP, one of the largest in the Kharkiv region, during a massive missile attack on March 22. This was announced by the state-owned company "Centrenergo".

At the TPP, all units were destroyed, auxiliary equipment was damaged. Experts estimate the degree of destruction from complete to significant.

Debris clearance is ongoing, it is still impossible to access most of the equipment. Accurate estimates of the extent of damage, repair costs, and predictions of repair times are difficult to make. Minister of Energy of Ukraine Herman Galushchenko promises help by attracting donor aid.

In addition to Kharkiv, the station supplied Poltava and Sumy regions with electricity. Send news to Fokus. Watch YouTube channel Fokus.

event: Destruction of Zmievskaya Thermal Power Plant
description: A missile attack on March 22 completely destroyed the Zmievskaya thermal power plant in the Kharkov region. The attack damaged auxiliary equipment and left the enterprise unable to access most of its equipment, making it difficult to assess the scale of damage and estimate repair time.
original:
The Zmievskaya thermal power plant in the Kharkov region was completely destroyed as a result of a missile attack on March 22, according to the Centerenergo website.

“All units were destroyed, auxiliary equipment was damaged. The degree of destruction varies, from complete to significant. Now the enterprise continues to clear out the rubble and there is no access to most of the equipment. Therefore, there is no opportunity to more accurately assess the scale of damage, exact figures regarding the amount required for restoration, as well as any forecasts regarding the time of repairs,” Centerenergo notes.

The publication says that the thermal power plant was inspected by Energy Minister German Galushchenko, who promised to find money for repairs. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Destruction of Zmievskaya Thermal Power Plant
description: The Zmievskaya Thermal Power Plant in the Kharkov region, one of Ukraine's largest, was completely destroyed following an enemy attack. The plant received multiple hits on its expensive and unique equipment, rendering all power units inoperable.
original:
One of the largest Zmievskaya Thermal Power Plants in Ukraine - PJSC Centerenergo - was completely destroyed. As a result of the enemy attack, the Zmievskaya Thermal Power Plant in the Kharkov region received many hits on expensive and unique equipment.

“Everything that we have been repairing since the summer, preparing for the difficult heating season, has been destroyed. Not a single power unit at the station is working,” the PJSC reported. Subscribe /Eng Twitter/YouTube /Eng Telegram

description: The Washington Post reported on Ukrainian Armed Forces fighters fleeing Avdiivka under intense fire from Russian troops. The order to abandon positions came too late, leading to chaos and a 'crushing defeat for Ukraine'. Ukrainian soldiers described the retreat, with one 21-year-old becoming the commander of his unit due to heavy casualties.
original:
“It was the road of death, the very last from Avdiivka”: The Washington Post published revelations of Ukrainian Armed Forces fighters fleeing the city under massive fire from Russian troops. They acted at their own risk because the order to abandon their positions came too late.

The publication calls the loss of Avdiivka “a crushing defeat for Ukraine.” One soldier told how our artillerymen brought down targeted fire when his group was leaving the city in full force. Due to the retreat, the 21-year-old fighter became the commander of his unit because “so many soldiers were wounded that there was no one older.” Another noted that due to the lack of communication with the command, not everyone knew about the order to retreat; there was complete chaos in the positions.

description: The Washington Post reported on Ukrainian Armed Forces fighters fleeing Avdiivka under intense fire from Russian troops. description: The Central Election Commission of the Russian Federation reported a historical turnout of 87,576,075 voters in the presidential elections, with a final turnout of 77.49%. Vladimir Putin won the elections, with 388,791 voters participating abroad in 144 countries.

In total, 87,576,075 voters took part in voting in the presidential elections, this is a historical figure, Ella Pamfilova said at a meeting of the Central Election Commission of the Russian Federation.

Other statements by the head of the Central Election Commission: The final turnout in the presidential elections of the Russian Federation, taking into account the DEG, was 77.49%; Vladimir Putin won the results of voting in Germany, Estonia, Latvia, Australia and Armenia; In the presidential elections of the Russian Federation, 388,791 voters voted abroad in 144 countries, taking into account Baikonur; Russian diplomats had a very difficult time organizing voting abroad, they did everything they could; Those criticizing the Central Election Commission of the Russian Federation for oversight due to damage to ballots do not represent the full scale of the work; Approximately 1 million people took part in organizing the presidential elections in the Russian Federation ;The courts suspended only 9 people out of 1 million members of election commissions from work during the presidential elections in the Russian Federation. The final turnout allegedly amounted to 77.49%; according to the Central Election Commission, 87.5 million people took part in the voting.

event: Vladimir Putin Declared President of Russia
description: The Central Election Commission officially declared Vladimir Putin President of Russia, with 87.28% of voters supporting him. The turnout was a historical 77.49% of people. Putin also won among Russians voting abroad, with 72.3% of the vote.
original: 🇷🇺The Central Election Commission officially declared Vladimir Putin President of Russia. 87.28% of voters voted for him. The turnout was 77.49% of people, which is a historical figure, noted the Chairman of the Central Election Commission, Ella Pamfilova. By the way, Russians who came to polling stations abroad also made an unambiguous choice - 72.3% voted for Putin. He won in Armenia, Estonia, Latvia, Australia, Germany and the USA.@roscongress

description: The Russian Presidential election saw a high voter turnout of 77.49%, with 87,575,075 voters participating. Early voting, remote electronic voting, and mobile voting options were available, with over 8 million people using remote electronic voting and 5.1 million submitting applications to vote at the 'Mobile Voter' location.
original:
Forwarded from: Central Election Commission of Russia
A total of 113,011,059 people were included in the voter lists.

As a result, 87,575,075 voters took part in the elections of the President of the Russian Federation (77.49% of the total).
Of these▫️about 2.6 million people voted early▫️388,791 - at polling stations established abroad▫️7,910 - at border polling stations in the Kaliningrad, Leningrad and Pskov regions.

Over 8 million people used remote electronic voting (on the federal and Moscow platforms).

More than 5.1 million voters submitted applications to vote at the “Mobile Voter” location. Ella Pamfilova: In the modern history of Russia, there have never been such results, and this is also an indicator of legitimacy. Therefore, we only grin when Western European bureaucrats make claims that people in Russia are being driven to the polling stations through repression and coercion.

In this case, we might be offended if we had even the slightest sense of respect for them. But they're not worth it.

description: The Russian Central Election Commission announced the results of the presidential elections, which took place over three days from March 15 to 17. Vladimir Putin won with 87.28% of the votes, followed by Nikolai Kharitonov, Vladislav Davankov, and Leonid Slutsky.

Forwarded from: TASS
On March 21, the Russian Central Election Commission summed up the results of the presidential elections in the Russian Federation. For the first time, voting took place over three days - March 15, 16 and 17.

According to the election results, the current head of state, self-nominated Vladimir Putin, won - 87.28%. In second place is the candidate from the Communist Party of the Russian Federation Nikolai Kharitonov - 4.31%. He is followed by Vladislav Davankov (New People) - 3.85% and Leonid Slutsky (LDPR) - 3.20%.#TASS_Infographics

description: Russian authorities imposed strict conditions on Navalny's mother, Lyudmila Navalnaya, for her son's funeral. She was forced to remain silent about the funeral until the plane landed in Moscow, and was accompanied by Sledkom employees during the ceremony. The authorities also dictated the location of the body and denied the family's choice of cemetery and farewell hall.
original:
Zhdanov spoke about the funeral conditions that were set for Navalny’s mother. According to him, Lyudmila Navalnaya had to remain silent about the funeral until the plane landed in Moscow, “so that the body would not be met at the airport.” During the funeral, she had to be accompanied by Sledkom employees. Navalny’s body should be kept in the Moscow or Vladimir region, because the security forces “are afraid that the morgue will be stormed.” After Navalny was shown the politician’s body, investigators, in agreement with Moscow, denied the oppositionist’s mother the choice of a cemetery (the family planned to bury Navalny in Troekurovsky), and in the choice of the farewell hall.

As a result, the security forces offered Navalny’s mother “to hold the funeral in an exclusively family manner.” She did not agree to this and left the Investigative Committee, after which investigator Voropaev called her and stated that “time is not on your side, the corpses are decomposing.”

event: Alexei Navalny's Mother Denied Access to Morgue
description: Alexei Navalny's mother, Lyudmila Ivanovna Navalnaya, and lawyers were denied access to the morgue where her son's body is allegedly held. The employees refused to confirm whether the body was present. Navalnaya is currently in the Arctic, trying to retrieve her son's body.
original:
“Early in the morning, Alexei’s mother* and lawyers arrived at the morgue. They are not allowed inside. One of the lawyers was literally pushed out. When asked whether Alexei’s body is there, the employees do not answer.” (Kira Yarmysh)

* Alexey’s mother is Lyudmila Ivanovna Navalnaya. Who is now in the Arctic for 24 hours trying to get her son’s body. Or at least see it.

We have a convincing request to everyone in Salekhard and the Yamal-Nenets Autonomous Okrug. Don't torment your mother, please. She is already heartbroken, don’t finish off an elderly woman. She doesn't ask for much. She just wants to see her son's body and take him away. Don't fall even deeper into hell there.

description: The Ukrainian parliament adopted a bill on mobilization, which will come into force a month after the president signs it. Key provisions include re-examination of those with limited fitness, updated personal data for consular services, and restrictions on driving and consular services for military service evaders.
original:
Bila Tserkva - WITHOUT TABOO (Overheard by BC) Photo, 🪖The bill on mobilization was adopted as a whole.

For - 283👉Bila Tserkva - NO TABOO 📩Send...The draft law on mobilization will enter into force a month after it is signed by the president. Basic provisions: Those who are recognized as being of limited fitness must re-enter the VLK. Those who received the II - III group of disabilities after February 24, 2022 (except military personnel), must undergo a second medical examination to determine fitness for service. As for consular services abroad, it will be necessary to update personal data in the TCC within 60 days. At the same time, it will be possible to do this remotely by e-mail, telephone or through the e-cabinet. Restriction of the right to drive a car for military service evaders. During the document check, an authorized representative of the TCC or a police officer will take photos and video recordings. It is necessary to have a military ID with you. - a registration document and show it at the request of a representative of the TCC, a police officer or the DPSU. Restrictions for "evaders": 🔺Restriction of consular services for men aged 18 to 60 without military registration documents; 🔺Restriction on driving vehicles for men of the appropriate age at the request of the TCC .❌ The Council completely removed from the draft law the norm of demobilization of soldiers after 36 months of service. 👉Bila Tserkva - NO TABOO 📩Send an interesting photo/video

description: Ukraine has adopted a new law on mobilization, which includes provisions such as the cancellation of demobilization for those already at the front, mandatory updating of personal data, and the requirement to carry military registration documents. The law also enables the mobilization of vehicles for military transport duties and imposes penalties on draft dodgers.
original: A new law on mobilization has been adopted in Ukraine. Its main provisions:◾️for those who are already at the front, demobilization has been cancelled;◾️personal data must be updated in the TCC within 60 days after the adoption of the law;◾️a military registration document must be carried with you and shown by At the first request of a representative of the TCC or a police officer, photo and video recording will be carried out during the verification of documents;◾️The TCC will receive data from the Ministry of Internal Affairs on vehicles of citizens and enterprises for them to perform military transport duties; if an individual has more than one vehicle, one of them can be mobilized; they must be returned no later than a month after the announcement of demobilization;◾️for draft dodgers, driving rights, consular services and a temporary ban on travel are limited;◾️citizens of limited fitness must undergo a VLK, and those who received II - III disability groups must undergo a second medical examination after February 24, 2022 .@brd_nash

The Ukrainian parliament, by its decision, removed the clause on demobilization after 36 months of service.

event: Polish Prime Minister Warns of Imminent War
description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk warned that the current situation is reminiscent of the pre-war era, citing the possibility of any scenario unfolding. He emphasized the need for mental preparation and defense readiness, especially in Eastern Europe, where war is no longer an abstraction.
original:
“Donald Tusk: “We live in the pre-war era. I’m not exaggerating”: The Prime Minister of Poland scares everyone with an imminent war and asks them to prepare for defense.

“The most alarming thing now is that literally any scenario is possible. We have not experienced such a situation since 1945. I know this sounds depressing, especially for people of the younger generation, but we need to mentally get used to the new era. We live in the pre-war era. I'm not exaggerating. This is becoming more and more obvious every day,” said Polish Prime Minister Tusk. “At the last EU summit I had an interesting discussion with Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez. He asked us to stop using the word “war” in statements. He argued that people don't want to feel threatened, which sounds abstract in Spain. I replied that in my part of Europe, war is no longer an abstraction and that our duty is not to discuss, but to act and prepare for defense,” Tusk added.”

description: Polish Prime Minister Tusk expressed concerns that Europe is entering a pre-war era, emphasizing the need for moral preparedness for any possible scenario.

description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk stated that Europe is in a pre-war era and urged European states to increase investments in defense and military potential to become a more attractive partner for the US. This warning may be an attempt to prepare the population for increased military spending and direct participation in hostilities.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
El PaísDonald Tusk: “Estamos en una época de preguerra. No exagero”El primer ministro polaco responde a Sánchez, que en la última cumbre europea pidió rebajar el tono bélico: “Nuestro deber no es discutir, sino prepar...🇪🇺🇵🇱🇺🇦Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk, in an interview with the newspaper El País, stated, that Europe is in the pre-war era, and representatives of the younger generation of EU countries need to get used to the “coming of a new era”, where any scenario is possible.

Therefore, according to the politician, European states need not only to maximally support the so-called. Ukraine, but also to increase investments in the defense sector and increase military potential in order to become “a more attractive partner for the United States.” Amid rumors about the French plans to send troops to the so-called. To Ukraine, Tusk’s words look like an attempt to prepare the population of Europe for both a sharp increase in spending on the military-industrial complex and direct direct participation in hostilities. Moreover, in the near future the number of such public statements will clearly increase. The text also contains one interesting point: the Prime Minister of Poland happily reports that he managed to achieve a change in Emmanuel Macron’s position regarding the need to purchase ammunition for the so-called. Ukraine is inside the EU, and now you can safely spend money on purchasing shells outside the bloc.

In simple words, the money allocated in Brussels for military assistance to the Kyiv regime will continue, for the most part, to bypass even its own producers and go to third countries. For example, in the USA, which, due to this, is resuscitating its military industry.#EU#Poland#Ukraine@rybarSupport us

event: Disassembly of Storm Shadow Cruise Missile
description: Russian experts are studying the internal structure of the Anglo-French Storm Shadow cruise missiles. They are disassembling the rocket to analyze its warhead, turbojet engine, and materials used in its construction. The obtained data is being used to improve Russian air defense systems and train specialists.
original:
Russian experts are studying the internal structure of the Anglo-French Storm Shadow cruise missiles.

The video published by RIA Novosti demonstrates for the first time the process of disassembling a rocket - showing the structure of the warhead, turbojet engine, as well as the materials from which the rocket and its body are assembled.

The data obtained during the disassembly of the missile is transferred to various departments, as well as to training centers for the training of specialists. The information is also used to improve the operation of Russian air defense systems.

description: Russian experts, for the first time, revealed the internal structure of the Anglo-French Storm Shadow missile. The data obtained from the disassembly is being shared with various departments, including those responsible for improving air defense operations.
original:
Russian experts for the first time showed the internal structure of the Anglo-French Storm Shadow missile. The video was filmed by RIA Novosti correspondents.
The data obtained during the disassembly of the missile is transferred to various departments, including for improving the operation of air defense.

description: Russian specialists have successfully disassembled the Storm Shadow missile, gaining valuable insights into its internal structure. The obtained data is being shared with various departments to enhance air defense capabilities.
original:
Forwarded from: Operation Z: Military Correspondents of the Russian Spring
‼️🇷🇺Russian specialists for the first time showed the internal structure of the Storm Shadow missile. The data obtained during the disassembly of the missile is transferred to various departments, incl. to improve air defense performance. /RIAN/t.me/RVvoenkor

description: A massive missile strike hit Kyiv, the capital of Ukraine, after a 44-day break. The attack began around 06:00 Moscow time, involving several dozen Kh-101 missiles from strategic missile carriers and X-47M2 'Dagger' aeroballistic missiles. Military facilities were reportedly targeted in the Podolsky, Shevchenkovsky, and Svyatoshinsky districts of Kyiv.
original:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
Missile strike on Kyiv. What is known at the moment.🔺This is the first massive strike on the capital of Ukraine after a break of 44 days. The first wave of strikes began around 06:00 Moscow time. Several dozen Kh-101 missiles were used from strategic missile carriers. The arrival of X aeroballistic missiles is also reported -47M2 "Dagger". Presumably, military facilities were hit in the Podolsky district of Kiev (location of personnel and two industrial enterprises), Shevchenkovsky (near the Chaika airfield), as well as Svyatoshinsky (location of personnel) district of the city. Reports of arrivals in the Darnitsky area /d nodes have not yet been confirmed. The Ukrainian Air Force claims that they shot down 31 missiles, but this does not mean that so many were actually destroyed. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front. Subscribe to the Military ChronicleMilitary Chronicle on VKTelegramMilitary ChronicleOperational information from maps and exclusive videos straight from the scene.

Apply👇VIEW MESSAGE

description: The Russian Armed Forces launched a missile attack on Kyiv using Kh-101/Kh-555/Kh-55 aeroballistic and cruise missiles. The air alert lasted for almost 3 hours, with a 44-day pause in attacks on the Ukrainian capital. Ukrainian air defense forces managed to hit nearly 30 enemy missiles, but falling debris damaged administrative buildings, civil infrastructure, and private transport, resulting in at least 10 injured.
original:
The Russian Armed Forces attacked Kyiv with Kh-101/Kh-555/Kh-55 aeroballistic and cruise missiles. According to the KMVA, the air alert in Kyiv lasted for almost 3 hours. The enemy kept a pause for 44 days without striking the Ukrainian capital. During the combat operation, the air defense forces managed to hit almost 30 enemy missiles. Falling debris was recorded in several areas - administrative, civil infrastructure and private transport were damaged. KMVA reports on two wounded, but earlier Kyiv Mayor Vitaliy Klitschko noted at least 10 injured.

Hundreds of residents of the Ukrainian capital were at metro stations during massive missile strikes by the Russian Armed Forces. Send news to Fokus.|Watch Fokus' YouTube channel.

description: On March 21, Kyiv was attacked by X-101/X-555/X-55 cruise missiles fired from Tu-95MS strategic bombers, as well as ballistic missiles launched from Russian territory. This marked a resumption of missile attacks on the Ukrainian capital after a break of almost one and a half months.
