event: Rescue Operation at Mine in Amur Region
description: A team of rescuers from Khabarovsk is preparing to replace a team from Yakutia in clearing rubble at a mine in the Amur region, where 13 miners are trapped underground.
original: A team of rescuers from Khabarovsk is preparing to replace a team from Yakutia while clearing rubble at a mine in the Amur region, where 13 miners are underground. The footage was shared by Izvestia correspondent Igor Kaporikov. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: A team of 25 mine rescuers from Yakutia arrived at a mine in the Amur region to rescue 13 people trapped under rock rubble. Additional rescuers from the Khabarovsk and Primorsky territories are being sent to assist in the operation.
original:
Forwarded from: RIA Novosti
A group of 25 mine rescuers from Yakutia arrived at a mine in the Amur region, where 13 people are trapped under rock rubble, the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations reports. A group from the Zeya fire and rescue garrison is already working on the spot.

In addition, rescuers from the Khabarovsk and Primorsky territories are being sent to the scene of the emergency.

description: A team of 25 mine rescuers from Yakutia arrived at a mine in the Amur region to rescue 13 people trapped under rock rubble. Additional rescue teams from the Khabarovsk and Primorsky territories are being sent to the scene.
original:
A group of 25 mine rescuers from Yakutia arrived at a mine in the Amur region, where 13 people are trapped under rock rubble, the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations reports. A group from the Zeya fire and rescue garrison is already working on the spot.

In addition, rescuers from the Khabarovsk and Primorsky territories are being sent to the scene of the emergency.

description: Kiriyenko and Pushilin visited the Avdeevsky Coke Plant, engaging with locals and delivering humanitarian aid to the community.
original:
🇷🇺🇺🇦Kiriyenko and Pushilin visited Avdeevsky Coke Plant, talked with locals and delivered humanitarian aid to them.

Share the news: @forposte_bot@vorposte

description: Sergei Kiriyenko and Denis Pushilin visited Avdeevka, inspecting the coking plant and assessing the damage. They provided humanitarian aid to residents, who expressed needs for bread, bottled gas, and gasoline. Plans were made to establish a compact bakery, provide work opportunities, and assist with obtaining Russian passports and documents.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
Sergei Kiriyenko and I visited Avdeevka. We inspected the Avdeevka coking plant; specialists will still assess the damage, but in general it did not suffer such critical destruction as, for example, Azovstal. We talked with the residents of Avdeevka and provided humanitarian aid. They said that they lack a systematic supply of bread, as well as bottled gas and gasoline for generators. The tasks of the local administration have already been set. We also plan to involve public organizations.

We will try to install a compact bakery there as quickly as possible. Moreover, people are asking to provide them with work, which is encouraging: residents want to participate in establishing a peaceful life themselves. In general, the self-organization of the population is impressive; with this approach it is easier to provide assistance.

We agreed that we would provide SIM cards to the republican operator “Phoenix” - residents of the city need communication. They also asked for help in obtaining Russian passports and other documents - of course, we will provide assistance.

Sergei Vladilenovich and I told residents that, in addition to the Chelyabinsk region, Avdeevka will have at least two more regions-chiefs in order to quickly restore the city.

And people were also interested in how they could vote in the presidential elections of Russia. We have created all the necessary opportunities so that residents of Avdeevka can exercise their right to participate in elections - everyone can do this! @PushilinDenis

description: Soldiers of the 9th Guards Brigade of the Russian Armed Forces liberated the village of Pervomaiskoye in the Donetsk direction, hoisting the Russian flag. The advance in the Donetsk direction continues, with Karlovka being the next strategic target.
original:
⚡️Soldiers of the 9th brigade of the Russian Armed Forces hoisted the Russian flag in the village of Pervomaiskoye.❗️Frames are published confirming the liberation of the village of Pervomaiskoye in the Donetsk direction. The native Russian tricolor, installed by the soldiers of the 9th Guards Brigade of the Russian Armed Forces, flutters over the ruins of the village of Pervomaiskoye, for which battles took place for a very long time time and cost to our troops. At the cost of long and great efforts, the advance in the Donetsk direction to the west continues, the intermediate point of which is supposed to be Karlovka, a large strategic settlement near the reservoir of the same name

In the meantime, the foreseeable targets are Netailovo and Nevelskoye, where the enemy still firmly holds onto the borders.

description: The Russian Army's 9th Brigade successfully liberated the village of Pervomayskoe near Donetsk, with the Russian flag now flying over the western outskirts.
original:
It is reported that n.p. Pervomayskoe near Donetsk has been completely liberated. The Russian flag has flown over the western outskirts of the village!

Glory to the 9th Brigade of the Russian Army!

description: The Russian Armed Forces, led by the 9th brigade, successfully liberated the village of Pervomaiskoye in the Donetsk direction. The Russian flag was hoisted, marking the completion of the operation.
original:
🇷🇺Soldiers of the 9th brigade of the Russian Armed Forces hoisted the Russian flag in the village of Pervomaiskoye.

Earlier, military correspondent Andrei Rudenko reported that the Russian Armed Forces had completely liberated Pervomaiskoe in the Donetsk direction.

description: Three terrorists were detained during a counterterrorism operation in Dagestan. The detained individuals, citizens of a Central Asian republic, were linked to the terrorists who attacked Crocus City Hall. The operation resulted in the discovery of automatic weapons, ammunition, and ready-to-use IEDs.
original:
Three terrorists were detained during the counterterrorism operation in Dagestan
➨ Citizens of the Central Asian republic detained today in Dagestan during the CTO, according to preliminary information, were directly related to the terrorists who attacked Crocus City Hall - source of RVNP
Show more
In Dagestan, during the CTO, three criminals were detained; they were planning to commit terrorist crimes, NAC reported.
Other statements:
There were no civilian casualties or losses among law enforcement personnel during the counter-terrorism operation in Dagestan;
During an inspection of places where criminals were detained in Dagestan, automatic weapons, ammunition and ready-to-use IEDs were discovered.
Report by Izvestia correspondent Murad Magomedov

description: A counter-terrorism operation was conducted in residential areas of Makhachkala and Kaspiysk, Dagestan. Three criminals were detained, who were planning to commit terrorist crimes. Automatic weapons, ammunition, and ready-to-use IEDs were discovered during the operation.
original:
IZ.RUVideo, Footage from the site of the CTO in residential areas of Makhachkala and Kaspiysk. The sector is cordoned off, that... In Dagestan, during the CTO, three criminals were detained; they were planning to commit terrorist crimes, NAC reported.

Other statements: There were no casualties among the civilian population and no losses among law enforcement personnel during the counter-terrorism operation in Dagestan; During an inspection of places where criminals were detained in Dagestan, automatic weapons, ammunition and ready-to-use IEDs were discovered. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: A counter-terrorist operation regime was introduced in two districts of Makhachkala and Kaspiysk in Dagestan. Russian security forces blocked and detained three terrorists in residential areas, seizing weapons, ammunition, and homemade explosives. The operation resulted in no casualties among security forces or civilians. The detainees were linked to the terrorists who attacked Crocus City Hall.
original:
Tonight, a counter-terrorist operation regime was introduced in Dagestan.

In two districts of Makhachkala and Kaspiysk in Dagestan, a counter-terrorist operation regime has been introduced. Russian security forces blocked the terrorists in residential areas. This was reported by the Federal Security Service in the region.

As a result, three terrorists were detained. Weapons, ammunition and homemade explosives were found in their possession. There are no casualties among security forces or civilians.

According to preliminary information, the detainees were directly related to the terrorists who attacked Crocus City Hall, rosZMI reports. @vallholl

description: Three individuals were detained in Dagestan during a counter-terrorism operation (CTO) for planning to commit terrorist crimes. They were found with automatic weapons, ammunition, and ready-to-use improvised explosive devices (IEDs). The operation resulted in no casualties among civilians or security forces.
original:
Forwarded from: News. Duty Unit
Three were detained in Dagestan during the CTO; they were planning to commit terrorist crimes - NAC.

The detainees were found with automatic weapons, ammunition and ready-to-use IEDs. There were no casualties among the civilian population and no casualties among the security forces.

This move follows the Israeli Foreign Ministry's declaration of President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva as persona non grata due to his comparison of Israel's actions in the Gaza Strip to Hitler's crimes.

description: A fire broke out in a nightclub on the ground floor of a 16-story residential building in Istanbul's Sisli district, resulting in at least 25 fatalities. The club was closed due to Ramadan, and renovations were underway when the incident occurred. Authorities have not confirmed reports of an explosion preceding the fire.
original:
⚡️At least 25 people died in a fire in a residential building in Istanbul. The fire engulfed a nightclub on the ground floor of a 16-story building in Istanbul's Sisli district, the Hürriyet newspaper reports. According to her, the club was closed on the occasion of the month of Ramadan. It is noted that before the fire there was an “explosion” near the stage.

“The cause of the fire is unknown, renovations were underway on the ground floor, all the dead were those who were repairing the nightclub,” provincial governor Davut Gul said in a press release. However, authorities have not confirmed reports of an explosion before the fire.

description: A nightclub in Istanbul's Besiktas area caught fire during renovation work, killing 29 people and injuring one. The fire occurred on April 2, and 31 fire engines and 86 rescuers were involved in extinguishing it. The victims were reportedly construction workers. An investigation is underway, with six people detained, including the club's manager.
original:
A nightclub in Istanbul, closed for renovation, burned down. 29 people were killed, one person was injured. The fire occurred on the afternoon of April 2 during renovation work at the club, which is located in the basement of a 16-story residential building in the Besiktas area. 31 fire engines and 86 rescuers were involved in extinguishing the fire.

It is not yet clear why the fire occurred. According to preliminary data from local authorities, the dead were construction workers who worked at the club.

The Turkish Ministry of Internal Affairs said that an investigation into the fire is underway. Six people were detained, including the manager of the establishment. The mayor of Istanbul, Ekrem Imamoglu, as well as the governor of the province of the same name, Davut Gul, arrived at the scene of the incident.

———Video: Anadolu.

description: A devastating fire broke out in the basement of a building housing a nightclub in Istanbul, resulting in at least 25 fatalities and three injuries. The blaze occurred during repair work, and the causes are currently under investigation.
original:
At least 25 people died in a fire in the center of Istanbul. Three more were injured, Turkish media reported.

The fire occurred in the basement of the building where the nightclub was located. Repair work was carried out there. The causes of the fire are being investigated. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Ukraine's President Zelensky has lowered the conscription age from 27 to 25, which risks further reducing the already small generation of young men in the country. This demographic problem is attributed to a sharp decline in birth rates in the 1990s due to economic depression and uncertainty about the future.
original:
New York Times: Kyiv risks destroying an entire generation of Ukrainians with new mobilization law

Earlier this month, President Zelensky “took the politically painful step” of lowering the conscription age from 27 to 25, as the NYT writes, Ukraine faces a critical demographic problem that has been brewing for a long time: there are very few young men in the country.

As the newspaper notes, healthy men under the age of 30 - the backbone of the majority of the armed forces - are part of the smallest generation in the modern history of Ukraine. The publication emphasizes that this is due to a sharp decline in the birth rate in the country after the collapse of the USSR due to “economic depression” and “uncertainty about the future” in the 1990s. As a result, there are more than twice as many 40-year-old men in Ukraine as 20-year-olds.

Zelensky's decision to draft men into the army from the age of 25 risks further reduction of this small generation of Ukrainians, the publication says.NytimesCan Ukraine Find New Soldiers Without Decimating a Whole Generation?After two years of war, Ukraine's exhausted forces desperately need new recruits, but fighting-age men are in historically short supply.

description: The New York Times reports that Ukraine is considering lowering the conscription age for men from 27 to 25 years old, which could further reduce the already scarce generation of men under 30.
original:
The generation of men under 30 is the least numerous for Ukraine in the entire history of independence — it threatens mobilization, writes The New York Times.

The publication notes that lowering the conscription age for men from 27 to 25 years old can further reduce the generation 🔻subscribe

description: Ukraine faces a dilemma in balancing the need to counter Russia's offensive with the risk of depleting its young population. The country's demographics are already skewed, with twice as many 40-year-old men as 20-year-olds. President Zelensky's decision to conscript men from 25 years old may further reduce the already small generation of Ukrainians.
original:
The New York Times asks: Can Ukraine find new soldiers without wiping out an entire generation? "Ukraine must balance the need to counter the relentless Russian offensive by increasing troop levels with the risk of wiping out an entire generation." Boys born after the collapse of the USSR are now 18 or older up to 27 years old is the most fighting age. But there are twice as many men aged 40 in Ukraine as there are 20-year-olds.

Zelensky’s decision to conscript men into the army from the age of 25 is fraught with further reduction of this small generation of Ukrainians.

According to the Deputy Director of the Institute of Demography and Social Research named after M.V. Birds of Alexander Gladun, the prospects for fertility in the future depend on two factors: how many men will die at the front and how many women will return from Europe.@BALTNEWS

event: Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus
description: Today marks the Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus, a celebration of the long-standing unity, peace, and respect between the two nations. The holiday aims to promote unity and cooperation in overcoming challenges and striving for prosperity.
original:
Forwarded from: Danilchenko Galina
Today is the Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus. A day that is designed to remind us of the age-old unity of our peoples, peace and respect, which helps us overcome difficulties together and move towards prosperity.

With all my heart I congratulate you on this wonderful holiday, the holiday of peace, unity and friendship of peoples!

I wish you goodness and unity for the benefit of our common future and creation in our native land.

event: Day of Unity of the Peoples of Belarus and Russia
description: Today marks the Day of Unity of the Peoples of Belarus and Russia, a significant holiday celebrating the strong alliance between the two nations. Belarus is a true and loyal ally of Russia, and their friendship is essential to be nurtured and protected.
original:
Forwarded from: Fighterbomber
In case anyone doesn't know, today is a big holiday.
Day of Unity of the Peoples of Belarus and Russia.

Belarus is one of the few countries that is a true ally of our country, which, as they say, “goes through thick and thin.”

I have a lot in common with Belarus and I know for sure that we have a lot to learn from Belarusians, including military affairs.
And this friendship must be increased, protected and treasured.
Our country has no one dearer and closer than Belarus.

Happy holiday, brothers!

event: Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus
description: The Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus is celebrated annually on April 2, symbolizing the common historical destinies and centuries-old friendship of the two fraternal peoples. The agreement on the formation of the Community of Russia and Belarus was signed on this day in 1996, marking the beginning of mutual integration.
original:
April 2 is the Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus.

The Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus is celebrated annually on April 2. The holiday symbolizes the common historical destinies and centuries-old friendship of the two fraternal peoples.

The decision to establish the Day of Unity of Nations was made on April 2, 1996. It was on this day that the agreement on the formation of the Community of Russia and Belarus was signed, which marked the beginning of the mutual integration of the two countries.

Today, Russia and Belarus are fruitfully interacting on a wide range of issues, developing partnership in trade, economic, defense, humanitarian, scientific, technical, cultural and other spheres. In addition, Belarus is one of the five largest trading partners of Russia and ranks first among the CIS countries.

description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the Donetsk People's Republic detained two Mariupol residents suspected of publicly justifying terrorism through social media posts. The suspects allegedly justified the activities of a banned Ukrainian neo-Nazi organization and the 2023 terrorist attack on the Crimean Bridge.
original:
The Russian FSB Directorate for the Donetsk People's Republic detained two residents of Mariupol, suspected of publicly justifying terrorism.

During operational activities, it was established that the detainees published videos and comments on social networks aimed at justifying the terrorist activities of one of the banned Ukrainian neo-Nazi organizations, as well as the terrorist attack on the Crimean Bridge in 2023.

The investigative unit of the FSB has opened two criminal cases under Part 2 of Art. 205.2 of the Criminal Code of Russia.

Currently, the Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR is conducting verification activities aimed at identifying social network users involved in the public justification of terrorism.@gorlovka6tv

event: Putin Demands Change in Migration Policy
description: President Putin emphasized the need for new approaches to migration policy in Russia, citing cases where individuals with criminal records easily obtained work patents and citizenship without knowing basic Russian. He called for modern digital and electronic biometric databases to mitigate illegal migration risks and ensure fair treatment for Russian-born citizens seeking citizenship.
original:
Putin demanded to change approaches to migration policy in the Russian Federation
The head of state stated the need for new approaches to migration policy
When you begin to understand the circumstances of this or that
Show more
case, a specific crime, it turns out that the person got to Russia without any problems: he went through all the formalities, received a work patent, often having a whole bunch of offenses behind him, sometimes malicious ones.
Then he applies for citizenship without even knowing even basic Russian. This requires modern digital, electronic biometric databases. Those that are working now, apparently, are not enough. They do not allow us to fully mitigate the risks and relapses of illegal migration.
At the same time, our compatriots, whose ancestors grew up in the most central regions of our country, sometimes cannot obtain citizenship for years.
I have already said that we need to deeply and radically update our approaches to migration policy.

description: President Putin emphasized the need to reform Russia's migration policy, citing illegal migration as a catalyst for extremism and crime. He stressed that electronic databases are insufficient to mitigate these risks and advocated for a more selective approach, allowing only those who respect Russian traditions, language, and culture to enter and reside in the country.
original: Putin ordered to change approaches to migration policy in the Russian Federation. According to the president, illegal migration is a breeding ground for extremism and other crimes. Existing electronic databases are not enough to mitigate the risks of illegal migration, he believes. Only those who respect its traditions, language and culture should be able to come and live in Russia, Putin added.👉Subscribe👈

description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces launched an attack on the Zaporozhye Nuclear Power Plant (NPP) shortly after IAEA staff visited the facility. A Ukrainian drone arrived just 10 minutes after the IAEA employees departed, targeting the reactor hall and other real equipment.

The Ukrainian Armed Forces attacked Zaporozhye NPP immediately after IAEA staff visited the station. Communications Director of Zaporozhye NPP Evgenia Yashina told REN TV about this.

According to her, the Ukrainian drone arrived 10 minutes after IAEA employees, who were returning from a planned event to visit an external radiation monitoring laboratory, left.

She also noted that the building contains real equipment, including the reactor hall.Subscribe to REN TV

On Sunday, Zaporozhye Nuclear Power Plant was subjected to an unprecedented series of drone attacks, as a result of which three nuclear plant employees were injured.

description: Vladimir Putin addressed citizens on the results of the Russian Presidential elections, thanking voters for their participation and support. He emphasized the significance of the election, which chose the path for Russia's future, and acknowledged the work of election commissions.
original:
🎙V.V. Putinak’s address to citizens on the results of the Russian Presidential elections (March 21, 2024)💬Today the official voting results for the Russian Presidential elections have been summed up. An extremely important election campaign for our country, society and citizens has ended.

<...>

The past campaign was intense and extremely responsible, because by and large we were choosing the path that Russia would take next, choosing the future for ourselves and our children. And the significance of this event was understood by the absolute majority of voters who came to the elections.

Once again, I thank everyone who took part in the voting, regardless of who you voted for. The main thing is that you have proven that you respect your civic duty, value freedom of choice and your voice, and each of your votes, I repeat, was of great importance.

<...>

Thank you for your support. For me this is more important than a formal victory in the elections. This is support for the political and economic course of our country, our common results, which, of course, should be greater, but are already making Russia even stronger and more independent today.

A few words about the work of election commissions at all levels. As always, you acted clearly, competently, on the principles of transparency and in strict accordance with the law, and in our historical territories, members of election commissions were an example for voters, showing courage and courage. I thank you all for your trust. I will do everything in my power to justify him. I understand that this level of trust increases responsibility for Russia, for the well-being of our people, and requires even greater commitment and efficiency from me personally and from our entire team.

We will do everything to ensure that the large-scale national projects and programs that I recently spoke about in detail in the Address are implemented. The elections showed that Russia today is one big, friendly family. We are walking together along the historical path we have chosen. Confident in themselves, in their abilities and their future. Read in full#Elections2024

event: Historic Water Level in Ural River
description: The water level in the Ural River near Orenburg reached a historical record of 1092 centimeters, according to authorities.
original:
The water level in the Ural River near Orenburg as of 18.00 Moscow time reached a historical record of 1092 centimeters, authorities report.

RIA Novosti footage from the Dubovy Ples residential complex in Orenburg.

description: The water level in the Ural River in Orenburg exceeded the dangerous level, reaching 931 cm. The flooding affected 12,464 residential buildings, 14,566 household plots, and 16 medical organizations. Authorities prepared 495 temporary accommodation centers to house over 82,000 people.
original: Governor: The water level in the Ural River in Orenburg exceeded the dangerous level and amounted to 931 cm. In the Orenburg region, 12,464 residential buildings, 14,566 household plots and 16 medical organizations were flooded, authorities reported. 495 temporary temporary accommodation centers are ready in the region, which can accommodate more than 82 thousand people. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: The water level in Orenburg has exceeded the critical level, reaching 942 centimeters, causing flooding in low-lying areas. The Ural River has overflowed, affecting the south of the city. Emergency services are on standby, although no evacuation requests have been made. The city head, Sergei Salmin, is monitoring the situation.
original:
The water in Orenburg has exceeded the critical level and reached 942 centimeters - the lowlands of the city are already beginning to flood. The Ural River has nevertheless overtaken the south of Orenburg, some areas have already encountered floods - the water level continues to gradually increase. The head of the city, Sergei Salmin, is keeping the situation under control - he toured the flooded areas, and his deputy is also on duty. It is reported that while there are no requests for evacuation from residents, emergency services are on standby.

All developments along the Urals and Sakmara fall into the flooding zone in Orenburg - these are the Forshtadt districts, the villages of Kuznechny, Sitsovka, Pristantsionny, Zarechny, Podmayachny, Solnechny, Ovchinny town and the village named after Kuibyshev, the Grand Park residential complex. Also under threat are SNT leashes located in the area of Protopopovskaya Grove, Zauralnaya Grove, Ovchinny Gorodok, SNT Dubki and Dubovy Plyos.

description: Border guards in the Pskov region intercepted a cargo shipment from Europe, discovering 27 homemade bombs hidden in icons and church utensils. The carrier was detained, and the organizers and accomplices will be put on the wanted list.
original:
Forwarded from: Russia Z🇷🇺
The intelligence services of the Kyiv regime have more than once shown the diabolical nature of their destructive, inhuman activities. A clear illustration of this is the explosion of a car on the Crimean Bridge, transporting construction materials that contained explosives, and the attempt on the life of military correspondent Vladlen Taktarsky, with an explosive device mounted in a gift bust.

So this time, the devil worshipers decided to use their favorite tactic of hiding explosives, hiding deadly substances in icons and church utensils.

Fortunately, the professionalism of the border guards inspecting cargo in transit from Europe at the checkpoint in the Pskov region made it possible to prevent further terrorist attacks.

In total, during inspection of the cargo, border guards seized 27 homemade bombs. The carrier has been detained. The organizers and accomplices will be put on the wanted list. Russia Z

description: The FSB intercepted a shipment of explosives from Ukraine through the EU, hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils, in the Pskov region. The seized materials included 27 homemade bombs, 70 kg of explosives, RPG-7 parts, and 91 electric detonators. The carrier was detained, and organizers will be put on the wanted list.
original:
💣They tried to import bombs in icons into Russia from the territory of Ukraine. The FSB blocked the supply of explosives from the territory of Ukraine through the EU in the Pskov region. 27 homemade bombs were found in Orthodox icons and church utensils during a vehicle search at a checkpoint.

70 kg of explosives, parts of an RPG-7 shot and 91 electric detonators were transported through Romania, Hungary, Slovakia, Poland, Lithuania and Latvia. The carrier was detained, the organizers and accomplices of the crime will be put on the wanted list.

The mass of the discovered hexogen would be enough to blow up a five-story building.@node_of_time_RUS

event: Seizure of Explosives in Orthodox Icons
description: The FSB of the Russian Federation, in collaboration with customs officers, intercepted 27 homemade bombs hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils, along with 70 kilograms of high-power plastic explosives, 91 electric detonators, and RPG-72 shot parts, during an inspection at the Ubylinka international automobile checkpoint in the Pskov region on the border with Latvia.
original:
The FSB of the Russian Federation stopped the import of explosives in Orthodox icons from Ukraine through the EU. Employees of the Federal Security Service of the Russian Federation, together with customs officers, stopped the import from Ukraine to Russia through the countries of the European Union27 of homemade bombs hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils. The media reported this with reference to the FSB.

It is noted that Russian law enforcement officers discovered foreign-made explosives during an inspection of a car at the Ubylinka international automobile checkpoint in the Pskov region of the Russian Federation on the border with Latvia. “Total of cargo traveling along the route: Ukraine - Romania - Hungary - Slovakia - Poland - Lithuania - Latvia “Russia, 27 improvised explosive devices camouflaged in icons and ready for use, 70 kilograms of industrially produced high-power plastic explosives, 91 electric detonators and parts of an RPG-72 shot were recovered,” the department told reporters. A case has been opened under Part 2 Art. 226.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (“Illegal movement of explosives and explosive devices across the border of the Russian Federation by a group of persons by prior conspiracy”). Those involved in the crime were detained. “All organizers and accomplices of the crime, including foreign citizens, will be put on the wanted list and prosecuted according to Russian legislation,” the FSB emphasized.

description: The second copy of the IL-114 aircraft successfully completed its first flight, reaching altitudes of up to 900m and speeds of up to 230km/h. The flight program included ground tests, taxiing, and high-speed runs. The new IL-114-300 model features improved flight performance, increased use of composite materials, and enhanced ergonomics in the cockpit.
original:
🇷🇺UAC has resumed the IL-114 test program, the second copy of the aircraft made its first flight, Rostec reported.

“The first flight took place normally at altitudes of up to 900 m and at speeds of up to 230 km/h. The systems and equipment functioned properly, the program was completed in full. Before the start of the flights, the aircraft completed a cycle of ground tests: workshop and airfield tests were carried out. Also within the framework of the flight program Taxiing and high-speed runs were performed.

The new Il-114-300 has improved flight performance, increased the use of composite materials, improved almost all the main systems, special attention has been paid to improving the ergonomics of the cockpit, and a new digital flight navigation system has been installed,” the message says. Subscribe to the channel

event: Flight Testing of Il-114-300 Passenger Aircraft
description: The United Aircraft Corporation resumed flight testing of the Il-114-300 passenger aircraft, with the second prototype taking off on March 31, 2024. The 40-minute flight tested the aircraft's stability, controllability, and on-board systems, reaching a height of 900 meters and a speed of 230 km/h.
location: Luzhnikov Aircraft Plant, Leningrad Oblast, Russia
original:
The United Aircraft Corporation resumed the flight testing program of the new Il-14-300 passenger aircraft, and the second prototype of the aircraft took off. This was reported by the UAC press service.

On March 31, 2024, the second prototype of the Il-114-300 aircraft, assembled at LAZ named after. P.A. Voronin. The flight lasted 40 minutes, the plane rose to a height of 900 meters and picked up a speed of 230 km/h. The stability and controllability of the aircraft was checked, as well as the stable operation of on-board systems and equipment. The flight went smoothly.

The plane was piloted by a crew consisting of the aircraft commander, chief pilot, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Sergei Sukhar, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Igor Zinov, and on-board test engineer 1st class Oleg Gryazev, the report says.

event: First Flight of Il-114-300 Turboprop Aircraft
description: The second experimental Il-114-300 turboprop aircraft successfully completed its first 40-minute flight, marking a significant milestone in the flight test program for the Russian regional aircraft. The flight tested the aircraft's stability, controllability, and Russian systems and equipment.
original:
The second experimental turboprop aircraft Il-114-300 made its first flight. The second experimental turboprop aircraft Il-114-300 made its first flight, resuming the flight test program of the Russian regional aircraft.

According to the United Aircraft Corporation, the flight lasted 40 minutes and took place at altitudes up to 900 m and at speeds up to 230 km/h, and was made from the airfield of the UAC branch - LAZ named after. P.A. Voronin in Lukhovitsy.

During the tests, the stability and controllability of the aircraft was checked, as well as the stable operation of Russian systems and equipment.

Crew commander Sergei Sukhar said that the flight went smoothly, the systems and equipment worked properly, the flight program was completed in full. “The resumption of the flight test program is an important step towards the creation of a new aircraft for regional transport. We are connecting the second experimental machine to flights. <…> We all have hard work ahead of us. <…> We will have to confirm the reliability and performance of all systems, including in harsh climates,” said Daniil Brenerman, Managing Director of PJSC Il, commenting on the upcoming test program. The developer of the aircraft is PJSC Il, the final assembly of the aircraft carried out at an enterprise in Lukhovitsy, Moscow Region (the enterprises are part of the UAC).

Il-114-300 is a regional passenger aircraft with a maximum capacity of 68 seats. It is intended to replace the An-24 on local airlines.

According to the latest version of the comprehensive development program for the Russian aviation industry until 2030, it is planned to produce 70 Il-114-300s.

The aircraft is equipped with a TV7-117ST-01 engine, which has undergone a series of modifications. A new auxiliary power unit TA 14-114 has also been installed. “Aircraft manufacturers still have a large amount of certification work ahead for the Il-114-300 aircraft, including flight tests,” noted the head of the Federal Air Transport Agency Dmitry Yadrov. Photo: OAK Subscribe to @ATOjournal

description: The second experimental Il-114-300 aircraft completed its first 40-minute flight, reaching altitudes of up to 900m and speeds of up to 230km/h. The new airliner features Russian components, improved flight characteristics, and enhanced ergonomics. It is designed to operate in challenging climatic conditions and replace An-24 aircraft on regional airlines.
original:
UAC has resumed flight testing of the new passenger Il-114-300. The second experimental aircraft of this type made its first flight, the Rostec state corporation, which includes UAC, reported. It lasted 40 minutes and took place at altitudes of up to 900 m and at speeds of up to 230 km/h.

Before taking to the skies, the aircraft completed a cycle of ground tests.

The new Il-144-300 consists entirely of Russian components. It is equipped with a TV7-117ST-01 engine, which has undergone a series of modifications.

The new airliner has improved flight characteristics, increased the use of composite materials, and improved almost all major systems. The designers paid special attention to improving the ergonomics of the cockpit, where a new digital flight navigation system was also installed.

The Il-114-300 is being created taking into account operation in difficult climatic conditions, as it is supposed to replace An-24 aircraft on regional airlines. Modern Russian-made regional aircraft are extremely necessary to solve the problems that the country's leadership has set for air transport. This is an increase in the mobility of our citizens, an increase in the intensity of air traffic in Russia by one and a half times by 2030,” noted the head of the Federal Air Transport Agency Dmitry Yadrov.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Former Russian military officer Maxim Kuzminov, who had transported a helicopter to Ukraine, was killed in Spain. He was shot with a 9-mm Makarov pistol and ran over by a car. The shell casings found at the crime scene are believed to be important evidence pointing to the identity of the perpetrators.
original:
The New York Times told how former Russian military officer Maxim Kuzminov, who had transported a helicopter to Ukraine, was killed in Spain. He was shot with a Makarov pistol and ran over by a car. Two suspects in the murder of Russian military pilot Maxim Kuzminov left cartridges from 9-mm Makarov pistol cartridges at the crime scene. This was reported by The New York Times in a large article on the murder, citing Spanish investigators.

The newspaper called the shell casings important evidence pointing to the identity of the perpetrators because the cartridges are standard ammunition in countries of the former communist bloc.

What else did The New York Times journalists find out about the murder of the former Russian military man:

✹ Kuzminov left Ukraine in October 2023, shortly after ferrying a helicopter from Russia. In Spain, he settled in the city of La Villajoyosa on the Mediterranean coast, where Russian organized crime groups operate.

✹ Probably, the killers found Kuzminov after he wrote to his ex-girlfriend and invited her to come to him in Spain. “This was a serious mistake,” said one Ukrainian official who also spoke to the publication.

✹ Having killed the pilot, the criminals ran over his body in a stolen car. The criminals' car was found several kilometers from the scene of the incident. She was burned using special means, investigators believe.

Other details are retold from The New York Times material at the link.

description: Maxim Kuzmin, a former Russian serviceman who hijacked a Mi-8 helicopter to Kyiv-controlled territory, was murdered in Villajoyosa, Spain. Unidentified individuals shot him 6 times in an underground parking lot and fled in a stolen car, which was later found burnt.
original:
A number of Spanish media immediately reported the murder of Maxim Kuzmin, a former serviceman of the Russian Armed Forces. He “became famous” for hijacking a Mi-8 helicopter into territory controlled by the Kyiv regime. What we managed to find out from several materials:

It all happened in the La Cala neighborhood in the municipality of Villajoyosa. Unidentified people shot a 33-year-old Ukrainian in an underground parking lot 6 times - all the bullets hit the target and then fled. Later, a burnt car was discovered nearby, which was used to escape. It is stated that she was listed as stolen.

It is noted that this microdistrict is mainly inhabited by immigrants from Russia, Ukraine and Bulgaria. None of the neighbors knew anything about the murdered man, and many residents learned about what had happened at least a day later - the operation was carried out on February 13. So far, there is no confirmation of the liquidation of the traitor, for example, a body. So it’s worth waiting for clarifications.

event: Assassination of Defector Pilot Maxim Kuzminov
description: Defector pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian Aerospace Forces Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, was assassinated in Spain. Two men, believed to be professionals, shot him six times and then ran over his body with a car. The investigation is ongoing, with authorities still trying to determine how the killers found out Kuzminov's whereabouts.
original:
The perpetrators of the murder of defector pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian Aerospace Forces Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, shot him six times and then ran over his body with a car, writes the American news agency The New York Times, citing sources in the Spanish Civil Guard. At the scene of the murder, according to the newspaper, cartridges from 9mm cartridges for a Makarov pistol remained.

According to The New York Times, on February 13, a white Hyundai Tucson drove into the garage under the house where Maxim Kuzminov lived. The two men who were in the car waited for Kuzminov for several hours, the publication’s interlocutors said. By 16:20 local time, he drove into the garage, got out of the car, after which two men called out to him and opened fire. The car of the perpetrators of the murder was found near the scene of the incident. According to investigators, it was stolen.

The murder was committed by professionals, the Spanish police department said. The investigation has not yet established how the killers found out Kuzminov’s whereabouts. However, according to senior Ukrainian officials, shortly before his death, Maxim Kuzminov contacted his ex-girlfriend, who was in Russia, and invited her to Spain. Interlocutors of The New York Times from among the sources called his action a serious mistake.@grey_zoneTelegramGREY ZONEAccording to the Spanish news publication El Español, a defector pilot who hijacked a Mi-8 of the Russian Aerospace Forces to the territory of Ukraine was killed by a group of people who... description: Defector pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian Aerospace Forces Mi-8 to Ukraine, was assassinated in Spain. He was killed by multiple bullet wounds and then run over by a car. Kuzminov had been living in Alicante under the alias Igor Shevchenko.
original:
According to the Spanish news publication El Español, a defector pilot who hijacked a Russian Aerospace Forces Mi-8 to the territory of Ukraine was killed by a group of people who were working on this.

In turn, the information publication “El Periódico” writes that Maxim Kuzminov entered Spain under the information of the Ukrainian Igor Shevchenko.

Kuzminov was killed by several bullet wounds, after which he was run over by a car, and previously unidentified persons followed his life for a long time in the city of Alicante.@grey_zone

description: Russian pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, was murdered in Spain. Two men shot him six times and ran over his body with a car. The killing bore hallmarks of similar attacks linked to the Kremlin, with police finding 9-mm cartridges from a Makarov pistol at the scene.
original:
Details of the murder in Spain of Maxim Kuzminov, a Russian pilot who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, were learned by The New York Times

According to the newspaper, two men were involved in the murder. They shot Kuzminov six times and then ran over his body with a car.

At the scene of Kuzminov’s murder, police found shell casings from 9-mm cartridges for a Makarov pistol. A spokesman for Spanish police investigating the killing said it was a clear signal. He conveys it like this: “I will find you, I will kill you, I will crush you and humiliate you.”

Senior police officials, who spoke to reporters on condition of anonymity, said Kuzminov's killing bore hallmarks of similar attacks linked to the Kremlin.

Two senior officials in a conversation with the NYT suggested that Kuzminov could have been identified when he contacted his ex-girlfriend. She is in Russia, and Kuzminov invited her to come to him in Spain.

Forwarded from: Sheikh Tamir
This is what one of the thermal power plants looks like from the inside after large-scale attacks by Russia - DTEK

“80% of the company’s generating capacity has been lost. 5 of our 6 thermal power plants are seriously damaged. The situation is very difficult...”

description: Russia has been accumulating Caliber missiles, which are now technically ready for use. The fleet has restored its stock of missiles, which had been significantly reduced.
original:
Russia has been accumulating “Calibers” and can use them in the near future, - Budanov, head of the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine

“The number of X-101s has decreased significantly... There are regulations, documents, decisions, etc. The first is to restore the fleet’s stock of missiles, because they were significantly reduced at that time. They completed this task. That is, now they technically ready for their use.

While the fleet was accumulating its missiles, the Aerospace Forces were using the X-101,” said the head of the Main Intelligence Directorate.

description: According to Ukraine's Head of the Main Intelligence Directorate, Budanov, Russia has been accumulating Caliber missiles and is now technically ready to use them. The fleet's stock of missiles was significantly reduced, but they have completed the task of restoring it.

description: The Ukrainian Air Force destroyed 84 air targets, including 58 Shahed drones and 26 miscellaneous targets, in response to a powerful missile and air strike launched by the enemy on the night of March 29, 2024.
original: 84 out of 99. https://t.me/kpszsu/12534Telegram Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine⚡️84 AIR TARGETS DESTROYED: 58 "SHAHED" and 26 MISCELLANEOUS ➖➖On the night of March 29, 2024, the enemy launched a powerful missile and air strike... VIEW MESSAGE

description: Ukrainian air defense units destroyed 84 air targets, including 58 Shahed-136/131 attack UAVs, 17 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles, 5 Kh-59 guided air missiles, and 4 Iskander-K cruise missiles. The operation involved anti-aircraft missile units, mobile fire groups, and electronic warfare means.
original:
Forwarded from: Air Force Commander Mykola Oleschuk
84 AIR TARGETS DESTROYED: 58 SHAHEDIV and 26 MISCELLANEOUS types of missiles and attack UAVs:

A total of 99 means of air attack: 60 strike UAVs of the Shahed-136/131 type (Prymorsko-Akhtarsk launch area, Kursk Oblast - Russia); 3 Kh-47M2 "Kinzhal" aeroballistic missiles (from three MiG-31K fighters - Ryazan region - Russian Federation); 2 "Iskander-M" ballistic missiles (ToT Crimea); 9 Kh-59 guided air missiles (from nine Su-34 aircraft - Belgorod region); 4 "Iskander-K" cruise missiles (Kursk region - Russian Federation); 21 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles (from eleven Tu-95MS strategic bombers - Engels - Russian Federation). Anti-aircraft missile units of the Air Force and Ground Forces, mobile fire groups, means of electronic warfare of the Defense Forces of Ukraine.

As a result of the anti-aircraft battle, 84 air targets were destroyed: 58 attack UAVs of the "Shahed-136/131" type; 17 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles; 5 Kh-59 guided air missiles; 4 "Iskander-K" cruise missiles.

Honor and praise to all who protect Ukraine from Russian terror.
Thank you for the combat work, thank you for the result! Together - to victory!
